Note: Changing these bits when the START bit is set is not allowed.

BitField.name: SADD6
BitField.description: Slave address bit 7:1 (master mode) In 7-bit addressing mode (ADD10 = 0): These bits should be written with the 7-bit slave address to be sent In 10-bit addressing mode (ADD10 = 1): These bits should be written with bits 7:1 of the slave address to be sent. Note: Changing these bits when the START bit is set is not allowed.

BitField.name: SADD7
BitField.description: Slave address bit 7:1 (master mode) In 7-bit addressing mode (ADD10 = 0): These bits should be written with the 7-bit slave address to be sent In 10-bit addressing mode (ADD10 = 1): These bits should be written with bits 7:1 of the slave address to be sent. Note: Changing these bits when the START bit is set is not allowed.

BitField.name: SADD8
BitField.description: Slave address bit 9:8 (master mode) In 7-bit addressing mode (ADD10 = 0): These bits are dont care In 10-bit addressing mode (ADD10 = 1): These bits should be written with bits 9:8 of the slave address to be sent Note: Changing these bits when the START bit is set is not allowed.

BitField.name: SADD9
BitField.description: Slave address bit 9:8 (master mode) In 7-bit addressing mode (ADD10 = 0): These bits are dont care In 10-bit addressing mode (ADD10 = 1): These bits should be written with bits 9:8 of the slave address to be sent Note: Changing these bits when the START bit is set is not allowed.

BitField.name: RD_WRN
BitField.description: Transfer direction (master mode) Note: Changing this bit when the START bit is set is not allowed.

BitField.name: ADD10
BitField.description: 10-bit addressing mode (master mode) Note: Changing this bit when the START bit is set is not allowed.

BitField.name: HEAD10R
BitField.description: 10-bit address header only read direction (master receiver mode) Note: Changing this bit when the START bit is set is not allowed.

BitField.name: START
BitField.description: Start generation This bit is set by software, and cleared by hardware after the Start followed by the address sequence is sent, by an arbitration loss, by a timeout error detection, or when PE = 0. It can also be cleared by software by writing 1 to the ADDRCF bit in the I2C_ICR register. If the I2C is already in master mode with AUTOEND = 0, setting this bit generates a Repeated Start condition when RELOAD=0, after the end of the NBYTES transfer. Otherwise setting this bit will generate a START condition once the bus is free. Note: Writing 0 to this bit has no effect. The START bit can be set even if the bus is BUSY or I2C is in slave mode. This bit has no effect when RELOAD is set.

BitField.name: STOP
BitField.description: Stop generation (master mode) The bit is set by software, cleared by hardware when a Stop condition is detected, or when PE = 0. In Master Mode: Note: Writing 0 to this bit has no effect.

BitField.name: NACK
BitField.description: NACK generation (slave mode) The bit is set by software, cleared by hardware when the NACK is sent, or when a STOP condition or an Address matched is received, or when PE=0. Note: Writing 0 to this bit has no effect. This bit is used in slave mode only: in master receiver mode, NACK is automatically generated after last byte preceding STOP or RESTART condition, whatever the NACK bit value. When an overrun occurs in slave receiver NOSTRETCH mode, a NACK is automatically generated whatever the NACK bit value. When hardware PEC checking is enabled (PECBYTE=1), the PEC acknowledge value does not depend on the NACK value.

BitField.name: NBYTES
BitField.description: Number of bytes The number of bytes to be transmitted/received is programmed there. This field is dont care in slave mode with SBC=0. Note: Changing these bits when the START bit is set is not allowed.

BitField.name: RELOAD
BitField.description: NBYTES reload mode This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: AUTOEND
BitField.description: Automatic end mode (master mode) This bit is set and cleared by software. Note: This bit has no effect in slave mode or when the RELOAD bit is set.

BitField.name: PECBYTE
BitField.description: Packet error checking byte This bit is set by software, and cleared by hardware when the PEC is transferred, or when a STOP condition or an Address matched is received, also when PE=0. Note: Writing 0 to this bit has no effect. This bit has no effect when RELOAD is set. This bit has no effect is slave mode when SBC=0. If the SMBus feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to 0. Please refer to Section25.3: I2C implementation.

Register.name: I2C_OAR1
Register.description: Access: No wait states, except if a write access occurs while a write access to this register is ongoing. In this case, wait states are inserted in the second write access until the previous one is completed. The latency of the second write access can be up to 2 x PCLK1 + 6 x I2CCLK.

BitField.name: OA1
BitField.description: Interface address 7-bit addressing mode: dont care 10-bit addressing mode: bits 9:8 of address Note: These bits can be written only when OA1EN=0. OA1[7:1]: Interface address Bits 7:1 of address Note: These bits can be written only when OA1EN=0. OA1[0]: Interface address 7-bit addressing mode: dont care 10-bit addressing mode: bit 0 of address Note: This bit can be written only when OA1EN=0.

BitField.name: OA1MODE
BitField.description: Own Address 1 10-bit mode Note: This bit can be written only when OA1EN=0.

Register.name: I2C_OAR2
Register.description: Access: No wait states, except if a write access occurs while a write access to this register is ongoing. In this case, wait states are inserted in the second write access until the previous one is completed. The latency of the second write access can be up to 2 x PCLK1 + 6 x I2CCLK.

BitField.name: OA2
BitField.description: Interface address bits 7:1 of address Note: These bits can be written only when OA2EN=0.

BitField.name: OA2MSK
BitField.description: Own Address 2 masks Note: These bits can be written only when OA2EN=0. As soon as OA2MSK is not equal to 0, the reserved I2C addresses (0b0000xxx and 0b1111xxx) are not acknowledged even if the comparison matches.

BitField.name: SCLL
BitField.description: SCL low period (master mode) This field is used to generate the SCL low period in master mode. tSCLL = (SCLL+1) x tPRESC Note: SCLL is also used to generate tBUF and tSU:STA timings.

BitField.name: SCLH
BitField.description: SCL high period (master mode) This field is used to generate the SCL high period in master mode. tSCLH = (SCLH+1) x tPRESC Note: SCLH is also used to generate tSU:STO and tHD:STA timing.

BitField.name: SDADEL
BitField.description: Data hold time This field is used to generate the delay tSDADEL between SCL falling edge and SDA edge. In master mode and in slave mode with NOSTRETCH = 0, the SCL line is stretched low during tSDADEL. tSDADEL= SDADEL x tPRESC Note: SDADEL is used to generate tHD:DAT timing.

BitField.name: SCLDEL
BitField.description: Data setup time This field is used to generate a delay tSCLDEL between SDA edge and SCL rising edge. In master mode and in slave mode with NOSTRETCH = 0, the SCL line is stretched low during tSCLDEL. tSCLDEL = (SCLDEL+1) x tPRESC Note: tSCLDEL is used to generate tSU:DAT timing.

BitField.name: PRESC
BitField.description: Timing prescaler This field is used to prescale I2CCLK in order to generate the clock period tPRESC used for data setup and hold counters (refer to I2C timings on page9) and for SCL high and low level counters (refer to I2C master initialization on page24). tPRESC = (PRESC+1) x tI2CCLK

Register.name: I2C_TIMEOUTR
Register.description: Access: No wait states, except if a write access occurs while a write access to this register is ongoing. In this case, wait states are inserted in the second write access until the previous one is completed. The latency of the second write access can be up to 2 x PCLK1 + 6 x I2CCLK.

BitField.name: TIMEOUTA
BitField.description: Bus Timeout A This field is used to configure: The SCL low timeout condition tTIMEOUT when TIDLE=0 tTIMEOUT= (TIMEOUTA+1) x 2048 x tI2CCLK The bus idle condition (both SCL and SDA high) when TIDLE=1 tIDLE= (TIMEOUTA+1) x 4 x tI2CCLK Note: These bits can be written only when TIMOUTEN=0.

BitField.name: TIDLE
BitField.description: Idle clock timeout detection Note: This bit can be written only when TIMOUTEN=0.

BitField.name: TIMEOUTB
BitField.description: Bus timeout B This field is used to configure the cumulative clock extension timeout: In master mode, the master cumulative clock low extend time (tLOW:MEXT) is detected In slave mode, the slave cumulative clock low extend time (tLOW:SEXT) is detected tLOW:EXT= (TIMEOUTB+1) x 2048 x tI2CCLK Note: These bits can be written only when TEXTEN=0.

BitField.name: TXE
BitField.description: Transmit data register empty (transmitters) This bit is set by hardware when the I2C_TXDR register is empty. It is cleared when the next data to be sent is written in the I2C_TXDR register. This bit can be written to 1 by software in order to flush the transmit data register I2C_TXDR. Note: This bit is set by hardware when PE=0.

BitField.name: TXIS
BitField.description: Transmit interrupt status (transmitters) This bit is set by hardware when the I2C_TXDR register is empty and the data to be transmitted must be written in the I2C_TXDR register. It is cleared when the next data to be sent is written in the I2C_TXDR register. This bit can be written to 1 by software when NOSTRETCH=1 only, in order to generate a TXIS event (interrupt if TXIE=1 or DMA request if TXDMAEN=1). Note: This bit is cleared by hardware when PE=0.

BitField.name: RXNE
BitField.description: Receive data register not empty (receivers) This bit is set by hardware when the received data is copied into the I2C_RXDR register, and is ready to be read. It is cleared when I2C_RXDR is read. Note: This bit is cleared by hardware when PE=0.

BitField.name: ADDR
BitField.description: Address matched (slave mode) This bit is set by hardware as soon as the received slave address matched with one of the enabled slave addresses. It is cleared by software by setting ADDRCF bit. Note: This bit is cleared by hardware when PE=0.

BitField.name: NACKF
BitField.description: Not Acknowledge received flag This flag is set by hardware when a NACK is received after a byte transmission. It is cleared by software by setting the NACKCF bit. Note: This bit is cleared by hardware when PE=0.

BitField.name: STOPF
BitField.description: Stop detection flag This flag is set by hardware when a Stop condition is detected on the bus and the peripheral is involved in this transfer: either as a master, provided that the STOP condition is generated by the peripheral. or as a slave, provided that the peripheral has been addressed previously during this transfer. It is cleared by software by setting the STOPCF bit. Note: This bit is cleared by hardware when PE=0.

BitField.name: TC
BitField.description: Transfer Complete (master mode) This flag is set by hardware when RELOAD=0, AUTOEND=0 and NBYTES data have been transferred. It is cleared by software when START bit or STOP bit is set. Note: This bit is cleared by hardware when PE=0.

BitField.name: TCR
BitField.description: Transfer Complete Reload This flag is set by hardware when RELOAD=1 and NBYTES data have been transferred. It is cleared by software when NBYTES is written to a non-zero value. Note: This bit is cleared by hardware when PE=0. This flag is only for master mode, or for slave mode when the SBC bit is set.

BitField.name: BERR
BitField.description: Bus error This flag is set by hardware when a misplaced Start or Stop condition is detected whereas the peripheral is involved in the transfer. The flag is not set during the address phase in slave mode. It is cleared by software by setting BERRCF bit. Note: This bit is cleared by hardware when PE=0.

BitField.name: ARLO
BitField.description: Arbitration lost This flag is set by hardware in case of arbitration loss. It is cleared by software by setting the ARLOCF bit. Note: This bit is cleared by hardware when PE=0.

BitField.name: OVR
BitField.description: Overrun/Underrun (slave mode) This flag is set by hardware in slave mode with NOSTRETCH=1, when an overrun/underrun error occurs. It is cleared by software by setting the OVRCF bit. Note: This bit is cleared by hardware when PE=0.

BitField.name: PECERR
BitField.description: PEC Error in reception This flag is set by hardware when the received PEC does not match with the PEC register content. A NACK is automatically sent after the wrong PEC reception. It is cleared by software by setting the PECCF bit. Note: This bit is cleared by hardware when PE=0. If the SMBus feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to 0. Please refer to Section25.3: I2C implementation.

BitField.name: TIMEOUT
BitField.description: Timeout or tLOW detection flag This flag is set by hardware when a timeout or extended clock timeout occurred. It is cleared by software by setting the TIMEOUTCF bit. Note: This bit is cleared by hardware when PE=0. If the SMBus feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to 0. Please refer to Section25.3: I2C implementation.

BitField.name: ALERT
BitField.description: SMBus alert This flag is set by hardware when SMBHEN=1 (SMBus host configuration), ALERTEN=1 and a SMBALERT event (falling edge) is detected on SMBA pin. It is cleared by software by setting the ALERTCF bit. Note: This bit is cleared by hardware when PE=0. If the SMBus feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to 0. Please refer to Section25.3: I2C implementation.

BitField.name: BUSY
BitField.description: Bus busy This flag indicates that a communication is in progress on the bus. It is set by hardware when a START condition is detected. It is cleared by hardware when a Stop condition is detected, or when PE=0.

BitField.name: DIR
BitField.description: Transfer direction (Slave mode) This flag is updated when an address match event occurs (ADDR=1).

BitField.name: ADDCODE
BitField.description: Address match code (Slave mode) These bits are updated with the received address when an address match event occurs (ADDR = 1). In the case of a 10-bit address, ADDCODE provides the 10-bit header followed by the 2 MSBs of the address.

BitField.name: ADDRCF
BitField.description: Address matched flag clear Writing 1 to this bit clears the ADDR flag in the I2C_ISR register. Writing 1 to this bit also clears the START bit in the I2C_CR2 register.

BitField.name: NACKCF
BitField.description: Not Acknowledge flag clear Writing 1 to this bit clears the ACKF flag in I2C_ISR register.

BitField.name: STOPCF
BitField.description: Stop detection flag clear Writing 1 to this bit clears the STOPF flag in the I2C_ISR register.

BitField.name: BERRCF
BitField.description: Bus error flag clear Writing 1 to this bit clears the BERRF flag in the I2C_ISR register.

BitField.name: ARLOCF
BitField.description: Arbitration Lost flag clear Writing 1 to this bit clears the ARLO flag in the I2C_ISR register.

BitField.name: OVRCF
BitField.description: Overrun/Underrun flag clear Writing 1 to this bit clears the OVR flag in the I2C_ISR register.

BitField.name: PECCF
BitField.description: PEC Error flag clear Writing 1 to this bit clears the PECERR flag in the I2C_ISR register. Note: If the SMBus feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to 0. Please refer to Section25.3: I2C implementation.

BitField.name: TIMOUTCF
BitField.description: Timeout detection flag clear Writing 1 to this bit clears the TIMEOUT flag in the I2C_ISR register. Note: If the SMBus feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to 0. Please refer to Section25.3: I2C implementation.

BitField.name: ALERTCF
BitField.description: Alert flag clear Writing 1 to this bit clears the ALERT flag in the I2C_ISR register. Note: If the SMBus feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to 0. Please refer to Section25.3: I2C implementation.

BitField.name: PEC
BitField.description: Packet error checking register This field contains the internal PEC when PECEN=1. The PEC is cleared by hardware when PE=0.

BitField.name: RXDATA
BitField.description: 8-bit receive data Data byte received from the I2C bus.

BitField.name: TXDATA
BitField.description: 8-bit transmit data Data byte to be transmitted to the I2C bus. Note: These bits can be written only when TXE=1.

Register.name: I2C_CR1
Register.description: Access: No wait states, except if a write access occurs while a write access to this register is ongoing. In this case, wait states are inserted in the second write access until the previous one is completed. The latency of the second write access can be up to 2 x PCLK1 + 6 x I2CCLK.

BitField.name: PE
BitField.description: Peripheral enable Note: When PE=0, the I2C SCL and SDA lines are released. Internal state machines and status bits are put back to their reset value. When cleared, PE must be kept low for at least 3 APB clock cycles.

BitField.name: TCIE
BitField.description: Transfer Complete interrupt enable Note: Any of these events will generate an interrupt: Transfer Complete (TC) Transfer Complete Reload (TCR)

BitField.name: ERRIE
BitField.description: Error interrupts enable Note: Any of these errors generate an interrupt: Arbitration Loss (ARLO) Bus Error detection (BERR) Overrun/Underrun (OVR) Timeout detection (TIMEOUT) PEC error detection (PECERR) Alert pin event detection (ALERT)

BitField.name: DNF
BitField.description: Digital noise filter These bits are used to configure the digital noise filter on SDA and SCL input. The digital filter will filter spikes with a length of up to DNF[3:0] * tI2CCLK ... Note: If the analog filter is also enabled, the digital filter is added to the analog filter. This filter can only be programmed when the I2C is disabled (PE = 0).

BitField.name: ANFOFF
BitField.description: Analog noise filter OFF Note: This bit can only be programmed when the I2C is disabled (PE = 0).

BitField.name: SBC
BitField.description: Slave byte control This bit is used to enable hardware byte control in slave mode.

BitField.name: NOSTRETCH
BitField.description: Clock stretching disable This bit is used to disable clock stretching in slave mode. It must be kept cleared in master mode. Note: This bit can only be programmed when the I2C is disabled (PE = 0).

BitField.name: WUPEN
BitField.description: Wakeup from Stop mode enable Note: If the Wakeup from Stop mode feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to 0. Please refer to Section25.3: I2C implementation. Note: WUPEN can be set only when DNF = 0000

BitField.name: SMBHEN
BitField.description: SMBus Host address enable Note: If the SMBus feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to 0. Please refer to Section25.3: I2C implementation.

BitField.name: SMBDEN
BitField.description: SMBus Device Default address enable Note: If the SMBus feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to 0. Please refer to Section25.3: I2C implementation.

BitField.name: ALERTEN
BitField.description: SMBus alert enable Device mode (SMBHEN=0): Host mode (SMBHEN=1): Note: When ALERTEN=0, the SMBA pin can be used as a standard GPIO. If the SMBus feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to 0. Please refer to Section25.3: I2C implementation.

BitField.name: PECEN
BitField.description: PEC enable Note: If the SMBus feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to 0. Please refer to Section25.3: I2C implementation.

Register.name: I2C_CR2
Register.description: Access: No wait states, except if a write access occurs while a write access to this register is ongoing. In this case, wait states are inserted in the second write access until the previous one is completed. The latency of the second write access can be up to 2 x PCLK1 + 6 x I2CCLK.

BitField.name: SADD0
BitField.description: Slave address bit 0 (master mode) In 7-bit addressing mode (ADD10 = 0): This bit is dont care In 10-bit addressing mode (ADD10 = 1): This bit should be written with bit 0 of the slave address to be sent Note: Changing these bits when the START bit is set is not allowed.

BitField.name: SADD1
BitField.description: Slave address bit 7:1 (master mode) In 7-bit addressing mode (ADD10 = 0): These bits should be written with the 7-bit slave address to be sent In 10-bit addressing mode (ADD10 = 1): These bits should be written with bits 7:1 of the slave address to be sent. Note: Changing these bits when the START bit is set is not allowed.

BitField.name: SADD2
BitField.description: Slave address bit 7:1 (master mode) In 7-bit addressing mode (ADD10 = 0): These bits should be written with the 7-bit slave address to be sent In 10-bit addressing mode (ADD10 = 1): These bits should be written with bits 7:1 of the slave address to be sent. Note: Changing these bits when the START bit is set is not allowed.

BitField.name: SADD3
BitField.description: Slave address bit 7:1 (master mode) In 7-bit addressing mode (ADD10 = 0): These bits should be written with the 7-bit slave address to be sent In 10-bit addressing mode (ADD10 = 1): These bits should be written with bits 7:1 of the slave address to be sent. Note: Changing these bits when the START bit is set is not allowed.

BitField.name: SADD4
BitField.description: Slave address bit 7:1 (master mode) In 7-bit addressing mode (ADD10 = 0): These bits should be written with the 7-bit slave address to be sent In 10-bit addressing mode (ADD10 = 1): These bits should be written with bits 7:1 of the slave address to be sent. Note: Changing these bits when the START bit is set is not allowed.

BitField.name: SADD5
BitField.description: Slave address bit 7:1 (master mode) In 7-bit addressing mode (ADD10 = 0): These bits should be written with the 7-bit slave address to be sent In 10-bit addressing mode (ADD10 = 1): These bits should be written with bits 7:1 of the slave address to be sent. Note: Changing these bits when the START bit is set is not allowed.

BitField.name: SADD6
BitField.description: Slave address bit 7:1 (master mode) In 7-bit addressing mode (ADD10 = 0): These bits should be written with the 7-bit slave address to be sent In 10-bit addressing mode (ADD10 = 1): These bits should be written with bits 7:1 of the slave address to be sent. Note: Changing these bits when the START bit is set is not allowed.

BitField.name: SADD7
BitField.description: Slave address bit 7:1 (master mode) In 7-bit addressing mode (ADD10 = 0): These bits should be written with the 7-bit slave address to be sent In 10-bit addressing mode (ADD10 = 1): These bits should be written with bits 7:1 of the slave address to be sent. Note: Changing these bits when the START bit is set is not allowed.

BitField.name: SADD8
BitField.description: Slave address bit 9:8 (master mode) In 7-bit addressing mode (ADD10 = 0): These bits are dont care In 10-bit addressing mode (ADD10 = 1): These bits should be written with bits 9:8 of the slave address to be sent Note: Changing these bits when the START bit is set is not allowed.

BitField.name: SADD9
BitField.description: Slave address bit 9:8 (master mode) In 7-bit addressing mode (ADD10 = 0): These bits are dont care In 10-bit addressing mode (ADD10 = 1): These bits should be written with bits 9:8 of the slave address to be sent Note: Changing these bits when the START bit is set is not allowed.

BitField.name: RD_WRN
BitField.description: Transfer direction (master mode) Note: Changing this bit when the START bit is set is not allowed.

BitField.name: ADD10
BitField.description: 10-bit addressing mode (master mode) Note: Changing this bit when the START bit is set is not allowed.

BitField.name: HEAD10R
BitField.description: 10-bit address header only read direction (master receiver mode) Note: Changing this bit when the START bit is set is not allowed.

BitField.name: START
BitField.description: Start generation This bit is set by software, and cleared by hardware after the Start followed by the address sequence is sent, by an arbitration loss, by a timeout error detection, or when PE = 0. It can also be cleared by software by writing 1 to the ADDRCF bit in the I2C_ICR register. If the I2C is already in master mode with AUTOEND = 0, setting this bit generates a Repeated Start condition when RELOAD=0, after the end of the NBYTES transfer. Otherwise setting this bit will generate a START condition once the bus is free. Note: Writing 0 to this bit has no effect. The START bit can be set even if the bus is BUSY or I2C is in slave mode. This bit has no effect when RELOAD is set.

BitField.name: STOP
BitField.description: Stop generation (master mode) The bit is set by software, cleared by hardware when a Stop condition is detected, or when PE = 0. In Master Mode: Note: Writing 0 to this bit has no effect.

BitField.name: NACK
BitField.description: NACK generation (slave mode) The bit is set by software, cleared by hardware when the NACK is sent, or when a STOP condition or an Address matched is received, or when PE=0. Note: Writing 0 to this bit has no effect. This bit is used in slave mode only: in master receiver mode, NACK is automatically generated after last byte preceding STOP or RESTART condition, whatever the NACK bit value. When an overrun occurs in slave receiver NOSTRETCH mode, a NACK is automatically generated whatever the NACK bit value. When hardware PEC checking is enabled (PECBYTE=1), the PEC acknowledge value does not depend on the NACK value.

BitField.name: NBYTES
BitField.description: Number of bytes The number of bytes to be transmitted/received is programmed there. This field is dont care in slave mode with SBC=0. Note: Changing these bits when the START bit is set is not allowed.

BitField.name: RELOAD
BitField.description: NBYTES reload mode This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: AUTOEND
BitField.description: Automatic end mode (master mode) This bit is set and cleared by software. Note: This bit has no effect in slave mode or when the RELOAD bit is set.

BitField.name: PECBYTE
BitField.description: Packet error checking byte This bit is set by software, and cleared by hardware when the PEC is transferred, or when a STOP condition or an Address matched is received, also when PE=0. Note: Writing 0 to this bit has no effect. This bit has no effect when RELOAD is set. This bit has no effect is slave mode when SBC=0. If the SMBus feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to 0. Please refer to Section25.3: I2C implementation.

Register.name: I2C_OAR1
Register.description: Access: No wait states, except if a write access occurs while a write access to this register is ongoing. In this case, wait states are inserted in the second write access until the previous one is completed. The latency of the second write access can be up to 2 x PCLK1 + 6 x I2CCLK.

BitField.name: OA1
BitField.description: Interface address 7-bit addressing mode: dont care 10-bit addressing mode: bits 9:8 of address Note: These bits can be written only when OA1EN=0. OA1[7:1]: Interface address Bits 7:1 of address Note: These bits can be written only when OA1EN=0. OA1[0]: Interface address 7-bit addressing mode: dont care 10-bit addressing mode: bit 0 of address Note: This bit can be written only when OA1EN=0.

BitField.name: OA1MODE
BitField.description: Own Address 1 10-bit mode Note: This bit can be written only when OA1EN=0.

Register.name: I2C_OAR2
Register.description: Access: No wait states, except if a write access occurs while a write access to this register is ongoing. In this case, wait states are inserted in the second write access until the previous one is completed. The latency of the second write access can be up to 2 x PCLK1 + 6 x I2CCLK.

BitField.name: OA2
BitField.description: Interface address bits 7:1 of address Note: These bits can be written only when OA2EN=0.

BitField.name: OA2MSK
BitField.description: Own Address 2 masks Note: These bits can be written only when OA2EN=0. As soon as OA2MSK is not equal to 0, the reserved I2C addresses (0b0000xxx and 0b1111xxx) are not acknowledged even if the comparison matches.

BitField.name: SCLL
BitField.description: SCL low period (master mode) This field is used to generate the SCL low period in master mode. tSCLL = (SCLL+1) x tPRESC Note: SCLL is also used to generate tBUF and tSU:STA timings.

BitField.name: SCLH
BitField.description: SCL high period (master mode) This field is used to generate the SCL high period in master mode. tSCLH = (SCLH+1) x tPRESC Note: SCLH is also used to generate tSU:STO and tHD:STA timing.

BitField.name: SDADEL
BitField.description: Data hold time This field is used to generate the delay tSDADEL between SCL falling edge and SDA edge. In master mode and in slave mode with NOSTRETCH = 0, the SCL line is stretched low during tSDADEL. tSDADEL= SDADEL x tPRESC Note: SDADEL is used to generate tHD:DAT timing.

BitField.name: SCLDEL
BitField.description: Data setup time This field is used to generate a delay tSCLDEL between SDA edge and SCL rising edge. In master mode and in slave mode with NOSTRETCH = 0, the SCL line is stretched low during tSCLDEL. tSCLDEL = (SCLDEL+1) x tPRESC Note: tSCLDEL is used to generate tSU:DAT timing.

BitField.name: PRESC
BitField.description: Timing prescaler This field is used to prescale I2CCLK in order to generate the clock period tPRESC used for data setup and hold counters (refer to I2C timings on page9) and for SCL high and low level counters (refer to I2C master initialization on page24). tPRESC = (PRESC+1) x tI2CCLK

Register.name: I2C_TIMEOUTR
Register.description: Access: No wait states, except if a write access occurs while a write access to this register is ongoing. In this case, wait states are inserted in the second write access until the previous one is completed. The latency of the second write access can be up to 2 x PCLK1 + 6 x I2CCLK.

BitField.name: TIMEOUTA
BitField.description: Bus Timeout A This field is used to configure: The SCL low timeout condition tTIMEOUT when TIDLE=0 tTIMEOUT= (TIMEOUTA+1) x 2048 x tI2CCLK The bus idle condition (both SCL and SDA high) when TIDLE=1 tIDLE= (TIMEOUTA+1) x 4 x tI2CCLK Note: These bits can be written only when TIMOUTEN=0.

BitField.name: TIDLE
BitField.description: Idle clock timeout detection Note: This bit can be written only when TIMOUTEN=0.

BitField.name: TIMEOUTB
BitField.description: Bus timeout B This field is used to configure the cumulative clock extension timeout: In master mode, the master cumulative clock low extend time (tLOW:MEXT) is detected In slave mode, the slave cumulative clock low extend time (tLOW:SEXT) is detected tLOW:EXT= (TIMEOUTB+1) x 2048 x tI2CCLK Note: These bits can be written only when TEXTEN=0.

BitField.name: TXE
BitField.description: Transmit data register empty (transmitters) This bit is set by hardware when the I2C_TXDR register is empty. It is cleared when the next data to be sent is written in the I2C_TXDR register. This bit can be written to 1 by software in order to flush the transmit data register I2C_TXDR. Note: This bit is set by hardware when PE=0.

BitField.name: TXIS
BitField.description: Transmit interrupt status (transmitters) This bit is set by hardware when the I2C_TXDR register is empty and the data to be transmitted must be written in the I2C_TXDR register. It is cleared when the next data to be sent is written in the I2C_TXDR register. This bit can be written to 1 by software when NOSTRETCH=1 only, in order to generate a TXIS event (interrupt if TXIE=1 or DMA request if TXDMAEN=1). Note: This bit is cleared by hardware when PE=0.

BitField.name: RXNE
BitField.description: Receive data register not empty (receivers) This bit is set by hardware when the received data is copied into the I2C_RXDR register, and is ready to be read. It is cleared when I2C_RXDR is read. Note: This bit is cleared by hardware when PE=0.

BitField.name: ADDR
BitField.description: Address matched (slave mode) This bit is set by hardware as soon as the received slave address matched with one of the enabled slave addresses. It is cleared by software by setting ADDRCF bit. Note: This bit is cleared by hardware when PE=0.

BitField.name: NACKF
BitField.description: Not Acknowledge received flag This flag is set by hardware when a NACK is received after a byte transmission. It is cleared by software by setting the NACKCF bit. Note: This bit is cleared by hardware when PE=0.

BitField.name: STOPF
BitField.description: Stop detection flag This flag is set by hardware when a Stop condition is detected on the bus and the peripheral is involved in this transfer: either as a master, provided that the STOP condition is generated by the peripheral. or as a slave, provided that the peripheral has been addressed previously during this transfer. It is cleared by software by setting the STOPCF bit. Note: This bit is cleared by hardware when PE=0.

BitField.name: TC
BitField.description: Transfer Complete (master mode) This flag is set by hardware when RELOAD=0, AUTOEND=0 and NBYTES data have been transferred. It is cleared by software when START bit or STOP bit is set. Note: This bit is cleared by hardware when PE=0.

BitField.name: TCR
BitField.description: Transfer Complete Reload This flag is set by hardware when RELOAD=1 and NBYTES data have been transferred. It is cleared by software when NBYTES is written to a non-zero value. Note: This bit is cleared by hardware when PE=0. This flag is only for master mode, or for slave mode when the SBC bit is set.

BitField.name: BERR
BitField.description: Bus error This flag is set by hardware when a misplaced Start or Stop condition is detected whereas the peripheral is involved in the transfer. The flag is not set during the address phase in slave mode. It is cleared by software by setting BERRCF bit. Note: This bit is cleared by hardware when PE=0.

BitField.name: ARLO
BitField.description: Arbitration lost This flag is set by hardware in case of arbitration loss. It is cleared by software by setting the ARLOCF bit. Note: This bit is cleared by hardware when PE=0.

BitField.name: OVR
BitField.description: Overrun/Underrun (slave mode) This flag is set by hardware in slave mode with NOSTRETCH=1, when an overrun/underrun error occurs. It is cleared by software by setting the OVRCF bit. Note: This bit is cleared by hardware when PE=0.

BitField.name: PECERR
BitField.description: PEC Error in reception This flag is set by hardware when the received PEC does not match with the PEC register content. A NACK is automatically sent after the wrong PEC reception. It is cleared by software by setting the PECCF bit. Note: This bit is cleared by hardware when PE=0. If the SMBus feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to 0. Please refer to Section25.3: I2C implementation.

BitField.name: TIMEOUT
BitField.description: Timeout or tLOW detection flag This flag is set by hardware when a timeout or extended clock timeout occurred. It is cleared by software by setting the TIMEOUTCF bit. Note: This bit is cleared by hardware when PE=0. If the SMBus feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to 0. Please refer to Section25.3: I2C implementation.

BitField.name: ALERT
BitField.description: SMBus alert This flag is set by hardware when SMBHEN=1 (SMBus host configuration), ALERTEN=1 and a SMBALERT event (falling edge) is detected on SMBA pin. It is cleared by software by setting the ALERTCF bit. Note: This bit is cleared by hardware when PE=0. If the SMBus feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to 0. Please refer to Section25.3: I2C implementation.

BitField.name: BUSY
BitField.description: Bus busy This flag indicates that a communication is in progress on the bus. It is set by hardware when a START condition is detected. It is cleared by hardware when a Stop condition is detected, or when PE=0.

BitField.name: DIR
BitField.description: Transfer direction (Slave mode) This flag is updated when an address match event occurs (ADDR=1).

BitField.name: ADDCODE
BitField.description: Address match code (Slave mode) These bits are updated with the received address when an address match event occurs (ADDR = 1). In the case of a 10-bit address, ADDCODE provides the 10-bit header followed by the 2 MSBs of the address.

BitField.name: ADDRCF
BitField.description: Address matched flag clear Writing 1 to this bit clears the ADDR flag in the I2C_ISR register. Writing 1 to this bit also clears the START bit in the I2C_CR2 register.

BitField.name: NACKCF
BitField.description: Not Acknowledge flag clear Writing 1 to this bit clears the ACKF flag in I2C_ISR register.

BitField.name: STOPCF
BitField.description: Stop detection flag clear Writing 1 to this bit clears the STOPF flag in the I2C_ISR register.

BitField.name: BERRCF
BitField.description: Bus error flag clear Writing 1 to this bit clears the BERRF flag in the I2C_ISR register.

BitField.name: ARLOCF
BitField.description: Arbitration Lost flag clear Writing 1 to this bit clears the ARLO flag in the I2C_ISR register.

BitField.name: OVRCF
BitField.description: Overrun/Underrun flag clear Writing 1 to this bit clears the OVR flag in the I2C_ISR register.

BitField.name: PECCF
BitField.description: PEC Error flag clear Writing 1 to this bit clears the PECERR flag in the I2C_ISR register. Note: If the SMBus feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to 0. Please refer to Section25.3: I2C implementation.

BitField.name: TIMOUTCF
BitField.description: Timeout detection flag clear Writing 1 to this bit clears the TIMEOUT flag in the I2C_ISR register. Note: If the SMBus feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to 0. Please refer to Section25.3: I2C implementation.

BitField.name: ALERTCF
BitField.description: Alert flag clear Writing 1 to this bit clears the ALERT flag in the I2C_ISR register. Note: If the SMBus feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to 0. Please refer to Section25.3: I2C implementation.

BitField.name: PEC
BitField.description: Packet error checking register This field contains the internal PEC when PECEN=1. The PEC is cleared by hardware when PE=0.

BitField.name: RXDATA
BitField.description: 8-bit receive data Data byte received from the I2C bus.

BitField.name: TXDATA
BitField.description: 8-bit transmit data Data byte to be transmitted to the I2C bus. Note: These bits can be written only when TXE=1.

BitField.name: KEY
BitField.description: Key value (write only, read 0x0000) These bits must be written by software at regular intervals with the key value 0xAAAA, otherwise the watchdog generates a reset when the counter reaches 0. Writing the key value 0x5555 to enable access to the IWDG_PR, IWDG_RLR and IWDG_WINR registers (see Section23.3.6: Register access protection) Writing the key value CCCCh starts the watchdog (except if the hardware watchdog option is selected)

BitField.name: PR
BitField.description: Prescaler divider These bits are write access protected see Section23.3.6: Register access protection. They are written by software to select the prescaler divider feeding the counter clock. PVU bit of IWDG_SR must be reset in order to be able to change the prescaler divider. Note: Reading this register returns the prescaler value from the VDD voltage domain. This value may not be up to date/valid if a write operation to this register is ongoing. For this reason the value read from this register is valid only when the PVU bit in the IWDG_SR register is reset.

BitField.name: RL
BitField.description: Watchdog counter reload value These bits are write access protected see Section23.3.6. They are written by software to define the value to be loaded in the watchdog counter each time the value 0xAAAA is written in the IWDG_KR register. The watchdog counter counts down from this value. The timeout period is a function of this value and the clock prescaler. Refer to the datasheet for the timeout information. The RVU bit in the IWDG_SR register must be reset in order to be able to change the reload value. Note: Reading this register returns the reload value from the VDD voltage domain. This value may not be up to date/valid if a write operation to this register is ongoing on this register. For this reason the value read from this register is valid only when the RVU bit in the IWDG_SR register is reset.

BitField.name: PVU
BitField.description: Watchdog prescaler value update This bit is set by hardware to indicate that an update of the prescaler value is ongoing. It is reset by hardware when the prescaler update operation is completed in the VDD voltage domain (takes up to 5 RC 40 kHz cycles). Prescaler value can be updated only when PVU bit is reset.

BitField.name: RVU
BitField.description: Watchdog counter reload value update This bit is set by hardware to indicate that an update of the reload value is ongoing. It is reset by hardware when the reload value update operation is completed in the VDD voltage domain (takes up to 5 RC 40 kHz cycles). Reload value can be updated only when RVU bit is reset.

BitField.name: WVU
BitField.description: Watchdog counter window value update This bit is set by hardware to indicate that an update of the window value is ongoing. It is reset by hardware when the reload value update operation is completed in the VDD voltage domain (takes up to 5 RC 40 kHz cycles). Window value can be updated only when WVU bit is reset. This bit is generated only if generic window = 1

BitField.name: WIN
BitField.description: Watchdog counter window value These bits are write access protected see Section23.3.6. These bits contain the high limit of the window value to be compared to the downcounter. To prevent a reset, the downcounter must be reloaded when its value is lower than the window register value and greater than 0x0 The WVU bit in the IWDG_SR register must be reset in order to be able to change the reload value. Note: Reading this register returns the reload value from the VDD voltage domain. This value may not be valid if a write operation to this register is ongoing. For this reason the value read from this register is valid only when the WVU bit in the IWDG_SR register is reset.

BitField.name: START
BitField.description: Start This bit start or stop the encoding or decoding process. Read this register always return 0.

BitField.name: NF
BitField.description: Number of color components This field defines the number of color components minus 1.

BitField.name: DE
BitField.description: Decoding Enable This bit selects the coding or decoding process

BitField.name: COLORSPACE
BitField.description: Color Space This filed defines the number of quantization tables minus 1 to insert in the output stream.

BitField.name: NS
BitField.description: Number of components for Scan This field defines the number of components minus 1 for scan header marker segment.

BitField.name: HDR
BitField.description: Header Processing This bit enable the header processing (generation/parsing).

BitField.name: YSIZE
BitField.description: Y Size This field defines the number of lines in source image.

BitField.name: NMCU
BitField.description: Number of MCU For encoding: this field defines the number of MCU units minus 1 to encode. For decoding: this field indicates the number of complete MCU units minus 1 to be decoded (this field is updated after the JPEG header parsing). If the decoded image size has not a X or Y size multiple of 8 or 16 (depending on the sub-sampling process), the resulting incomplete or empty MCU must be added to this value to get the total number of MCU generated.

BitField.name: XSIZE
BitField.description: X size This field defines the number of pixels per line.

BitField.name: HD
BitField.description: Huffman DC Selects the Huffman table for encoding the DC coefficients.

BitField.name: HA
BitField.description: Huffman AC Selects the Huffman table for encoding the AC coefficients.

BitField.name: QT
BitField.description: Quantization Table Selects quantization table associated with a color component.

BitField.name: NB
BitField.description: Number of Block Number of data units minus 1 that belong to a particular color in the MCU.

BitField.name: VSF
BitField.description: Vertical Sampling Factor Vertical sampling factor for component i.

BitField.name: HSF
BitField.description: Horizontal Sampling Factor Horizontal sampling factor for component i.

BitField.name: HD
BitField.description: Huffman DC Selects the Huffman table for encoding the DC coefficients.

BitField.name: HA
BitField.description: Huffman AC Selects the Huffman table for encoding the AC coefficients.

BitField.name: QT
BitField.description: Quantization Table Selects quantization table associated with a color component.

BitField.name: NB
BitField.description: Number of Block Number of data units minus 1 that belong to a particular color in the MCU.

BitField.name: VSF
BitField.description: Vertical Sampling Factor Vertical sampling factor for component i.

BitField.name: HSF
BitField.description: Horizontal Sampling Factor Horizontal sampling factor for component i.

BitField.description: Huffman DC Selects the Huffman table for encoding the DC coefficients.

BitField.description: Huffman AC Selects the Huffman table for encoding the AC coefficients.

BitField.description: Number of Block Number of data units minus 1 that belong to a particular color in the MCU.

BitField.name: VSF
BitField.description: Vertical Sampling Factor Vertical sampling factor for component i.

BitField.name: HSF
BitField.description: Horizontal Sampling Factor Horizontal sampling factor for component i.

BitField.name: HD
BitField.description: Huffman DC Selects the Huffman table for encoding the DC coefficients.

BitField.name: HA
BitField.description: Huffman AC Selects the Huffman table for encoding the AC coefficients.

BitField.name: QT
BitField.description: Quantization Table Selects quantization table associated with a color component.

BitField.description: Number of Block Number of data units minus 1 that belong to a particular color in the MCU.

BitField.name: VSF
BitField.description: Vertical Sampling Factor Vertical sampling factor for component i.

BitField.name: HSF
BitField.description: Horizontal Sampling Factor Horizontal sampling factor for component i.

BitField.name: JCEN
BitField.description: JPEG Core Enable Enable the JPEG codec Core.

BitField.name: IFTIE
BitField.description: Input FIFO Threshold Interrupt Enable This bit enables the interrupt generation when input FIFO reach the threshold.

BitField.name: IFNFIE
BitField.description: Input FIFO Not Full Interrupt Enable This bit enables the interrupt generation when input FIFO is not empty.

BitField.name: OFTIE
BitField.description: Output FIFO Threshold Interrupt Enable This bit enables the interrupt generation when output FIFO reach the threshold.

BitField.name: OFNEIE
BitField.description: Output FIFO Not Empty Interrupt Enable This bit enables the interrupt generation when output FIFO is not empty.

BitField.name: EOCIE
BitField.description: End of Conversion Interrupt Enable This bit enables the interrupt generation on the end of conversion.

BitField.name: HPDIE
BitField.description: Header Parsing Done Interrupt Enable This bit enables the interrupt generation on the Header Parsing Operation.

BitField.name: IDMAEN
BitField.description: Input DMA Enable Enable the DMA request generation for the input FIFO.

BitField.name: ODMAEN
BitField.description: Output DMA Enable Enable the DMA request generation for the output FIFO.

BitField.name: IFF
BitField.description: Input FIFO Flush This bit flush the input FIFO. This bit is always read as 0.

BitField.name: OFF
BitField.description: Output FIFO Flush This bit flush the output FIFO. This bit is always read as 0.

BitField.name: IFTF
BitField.description: Input FIFO Threshold Flag This bit is set when the input FIFO is not full and is bellow its threshold.

BitField.name: IFNFF
BitField.description: Input FIFO Not Full Flag This bit is set when the input FIFO is not full (a data can be written).

BitField.name: OFTF
BitField.description: Output FIFO Threshold Flag This bit is set when the output FIFO is not empty and has reach its threshold.

BitField.name: OFNEF
BitField.description: Output FIFO Not Empty Flag This bit is set when the output FIFO is not empty (a data is available).

BitField.name: EOCF
BitField.description: End of Conversion Flag This bit is set when the JPEG codec core has finished the encoding or the decoding process and than last data has been sent to the output FIFO.

BitField.name: HPDF
BitField.description: Header Parsing Done Flag This bit is set in decode mode when the JPEG codec has finished the parsing of the headers and the internal registers have been updated.

BitField.name: COF
BitField.description: Codec Operation Flag This bit is set when when a JPEG codec operation is on going (encoding or decoding).

BitField.name: CEOCF
BitField.description: Clear End of Conversion Flag Writing 1 clears the End of Conversion Flag of the JPEG Status Register.

BitField.name: CHPDF
BitField.description: Clear Header Parsing Done Flag Writing 1 clears the Header Parsing Done Flag of the JPEG Status Register.

BitField.name: DATAIN
BitField.description: Data Input FIFO Input FIFO data register.

BitField.name: DATAOUT
BitField.description: Data Output FIFO Output FIFO data register.

BitField.name: GIF0
BitField.description: Channel x global interrupt flag (x=...) This bit is set and reset by hardware. It is a logical OR of all the Channel x interrupt flags (CTCIFx, BTIFx, BRTIFx, TEIFx) which are enabled in the interrupt mask register (CTCIEx, BTIEx, BRTIEx, TEIEx)

BitField.name: GIF1
BitField.description: Channel x global interrupt flag (x=...) This bit is set and reset by hardware. It is a logical OR of all the Channel x interrupt flags (CTCIFx, BTIFx, BRTIFx, TEIFx) which are enabled in the interrupt mask register (CTCIEx, BTIEx, BRTIEx, TEIEx)

BitField.name: GIF2
BitField.description: Channel x global interrupt flag (x=...) This bit is set and reset by hardware. It is a logical OR of all the Channel x interrupt flags (CTCIFx, BTIFx, BRTIFx, TEIFx) which are enabled in the interrupt mask register (CTCIEx, BTIEx, BRTIEx, TEIEx)

BitField.name: GIF3
BitField.description: Channel x global interrupt flag (x=...) This bit is set and reset by hardware. It is a logical OR of all the Channel x interrupt flags (CTCIFx, BTIFx, BRTIFx, TEIFx) which are enabled in the interrupt mask register (CTCIEx, BTIEx, BRTIEx, TEIEx)

BitField.name: GIF4
BitField.description: Channel x global interrupt flag (x=...) This bit is set and reset by hardware. It is a logical OR of all the Channel x interrupt flags (CTCIFx, BTIFx, BRTIFx, TEIFx) which are enabled in the interrupt mask register (CTCIEx, BTIEx, BRTIEx, TEIEx)

BitField.name: GIF5
BitField.description: Channel x global interrupt flag (x=...) This bit is set and reset by hardware. It is a logical OR of all the Channel x interrupt flags (CTCIFx, BTIFx, BRTIFx, TEIFx) which are enabled in the interrupt mask register (CTCIEx, BTIEx, BRTIEx, TEIEx)

BitField.name: GIF6
BitField.description: Channel x global interrupt flag (x=...) This bit is set and reset by hardware. It is a logical OR of all the Channel x interrupt flags (CTCIFx, BTIFx, BRTIFx, TEIFx) which are enabled in the interrupt mask register (CTCIEx, BTIEx, BRTIEx, TEIEx)

BitField.name: GIF7
BitField.description: Channel x global interrupt flag (x=...) This bit is set and reset by hardware. It is a logical OR of all the Channel x interrupt flags (CTCIFx, BTIFx, BRTIFx, TEIFx) which are enabled in the interrupt mask register (CTCIEx, BTIEx, BRTIEx, TEIEx)

BitField.description: Channel x global interrupt flag (x=...) This bit is set and reset by hardware. It is a logical OR of all the Channel x interrupt flags (CTCIFx, BTIFx, BRTIFx, TEIFx) which are enabled in the interrupt mask register (CTCIEx, BTIEx, BRTIEx, TEIEx)

BitField.description: Channel x global interrupt flag (x=...) This bit is set and reset by hardware. It is a logical OR of all the Channel x interrupt flags (CTCIFx, BTIFx, BRTIFx, TEIFx) which are enabled in the interrupt mask register (CTCIEx, BTIEx, BRTIEx, TEIEx)

BitField.name: GIF10
BitField.description: Channel x global interrupt flag (x=...) This bit is set and reset by hardware. It is a logical OR of all the Channel x interrupt flags (CTCIFx, BTIFx, BRTIFx, TEIFx) which are enabled in the interrupt mask register (CTCIEx, BTIEx, BRTIEx, TEIEx)

BitField.name: GIF11
BitField.description: Channel x global interrupt flag (x=...) This bit is set and reset by hardware. It is a logical OR of all the Channel x interrupt flags (CTCIFx, BTIFx, BRTIFx, TEIFx) which are enabled in the interrupt mask register (CTCIEx, BTIEx, BRTIEx, TEIEx)

BitField.name: GIF12
BitField.description: Channel x global interrupt flag (x=...) This bit is set and reset by hardware. It is a logical OR of all the Channel x interrupt flags (CTCIFx, BTIFx, BRTIFx, TEIFx) which are enabled in the interrupt mask register (CTCIEx, BTIEx, BRTIEx, TEIEx)

BitField.name: GIF13
BitField.description: Channel x global interrupt flag (x=...) This bit is set and reset by hardware. It is a logical OR of all the Channel x interrupt flags (CTCIFx, BTIFx, BRTIFx, TEIFx) which are enabled in the interrupt mask register (CTCIEx, BTIEx, BRTIEx, TEIEx)

BitField.name: GIF14
BitField.description: Channel x global interrupt flag (x=...) This bit is set and reset by hardware. It is a logical OR of all the Channel x interrupt flags (CTCIFx, BTIFx, BRTIFx, TEIFx) which are enabled in the interrupt mask register (CTCIEx, BTIEx, BRTIEx, TEIEx)

BitField.name: GIF15
BitField.description: Channel x global interrupt flag (x=...) This bit is set and reset by hardware. It is a logical OR of all the Channel x interrupt flags (CTCIFx, BTIFx, BRTIFx, TEIFx) which are enabled in the interrupt mask register (CTCIEx, BTIEx, BRTIEx, TEIEx)

BitField.name: TEIF0
BitField.description: Channel x transfer error interrupt flag This bit is set by hardware. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the corresponding bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

BitField.name: CTCIF0
BitField.description: Channel x Channel Transfer Complete interrupt flag This bit is set by hardware. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the corresponding bit in the DMA_IFCRy register. CTC is set when the last block was transferred and the channel has been automatically disabled. CTC is also set when the channel is suspended, as a result of writing EN bit to 0.

BitField.name: BRTIF0
BitField.description: Channel x block repeat transfer complete interrupt flag This bit is set by hardware. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the corresponding bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

BitField.name: BTIF0
BitField.description: Channel x block transfer complete interrupt flag This bit is set by hardware. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the corresponding bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

Register.name: MDMA_C0IFCR
Register.description: MDMA channel x interrupt flag clear register

BitField.name: CTEIF0
BitField.description: Channel x clear transfer error interrupt flag Writing a 1 into this bit clears TEIFx in the MDMA_ISRy register

BitField.name: CCTCIF0
BitField.description: Clear Channel transfer complete interrupt flag for channel x Writing a 1 into this bit clears CTCIFx in the MDMA_ISRy register

BitField.name: CBRTIF0
BitField.description: Channel x clear block repeat transfer complete interrupt flag Writing a 1 into this bit clears BRTIFx in the MDMA_ISRy register

BitField.name: CBTIF0
BitField.description: Channel x Clear block transfer complete interrupt flag Writing a 1 into this bit clears BTIFx in the MDMA_ISRy register

BitField.name: CLTCIF0
BitField.description: CLear buffer Transfer Complete Interrupt Flag for channel x Writing a 1 into this bit clears TCIFx in the MDMA_ISRy register

Register.name: MDMA_C0ESR
Register.description: MDMA Channel x error status register

BitField.name: TEA
BitField.description: Transfer Error Address These bits are set and cleared by HW, in case of an MDMA data transfer error. It is used in conjunction with TED. This field indicates the 7 LSBits of the address which generated a transfer/access error. It may be used by SW to retrieve the failing address, by adding this value (truncated to the buffer transfer length size) to the current SAR/DAR value. Note: The SAR/DAR current value doesnt reflect this last address due to the FIFO management system. The SAR/DAR are only updated at the end of a (buffer) transfer (of TLEN+1 bytes). Note: It is not set in case of a link data error.

BitField.name: TED
BitField.description: Transfer Error Direction These bit is set and cleared by HW, in case of an MDMA data transfer error.

BitField.name: TELD
BitField.description: Transfer Error Link Data These bit is set by HW, in case of a transfer error while reading the block link data structure. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the CTEIFx bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

BitField.name: TEMD
BitField.description: Transfer Error Mask Data These bit is set by HW, in case of a transfer error while writing the Mask Data. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the CTEIFx bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

BitField.name: ASE
BitField.description: Address/Size Error These bit is set by HW, when the programmed address is not aligned with the data size. TED will indicate whether the problem is on the source or destination. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the CTEIFx bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

BitField.name: BSE
BitField.description: Block Size Error These bit is set by HW, when the block size is not an integer multiple of the data size either for source or destination. TED will indicate whether the problem is on the source or destination. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the CTEIFx bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

Register.name: MDMA_C0CR
Register.description: This register is used to control the concerned channel.

BitField.name: TEIE
BitField.description: Transfer error interrupt enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: CTCIE
BitField.description: Channel Transfer Complete interrupt enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: BRTIE
BitField.description: Block Repeat transfer interrupt enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: BTIE
BitField.description: Block Transfer interrupt enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: TCIE
BitField.description: buffer Transfer Complete interrupt enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: PL
BitField.description: Priority level These bits are set and cleared by software. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.name: SWRQ
BitField.description: SW ReQuest Writing a 1 into this bit sets the CRQAx in MDMA_ISRy register, activating the request on Channel x Note: Either the whole CxCR register or the 8-bit/16-bit register @ Address offset: 0x4E + 0x40 chn may be used for SWRQ activation. In case of a SW request, acknowledge is not generated (neither HW signal, nor CxMAR write access).

Register.name: MDMA_C0TCR
Register.description: This register is used to configure the concerned channel.

BitField.name: SINC
BitField.description: Source increment mode These bits are set and cleared by software. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0 Note: When source is AHB (SBUS=1), SINC = 00 is forbidden. In Linked List Mode, at the end of a block (single or last block in repeated block transfer mode), this register will be loaded from memory (from address given by current LAR[31:0] + 0x00).

BitField.name: DINC
BitField.description: Destination increment mode These bits are set and cleared by software. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0 Note: When destination is AHB (DBUS=1), DINC = 00 is forbidden.

BitField.name: SSIZE
BitField.description: Source data size These bits are set and cleared by software. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0 Note: If a value of 11 is programmed for the TCM access/AHB port, a transfer error will occur (TEIF bit set) If SINCOS < SSIZE and SINC ≠ 00, the result will be unpredictable. Note: SSIZE = 11 (double-word) is forbidden when source is TCM/AHB bus (SBUS=1).

BitField.name: DSIZE
BitField.description: Destination data size These bits are set and cleared by software. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0. Note: If a value of 11 is programmed for the TCM access/AHB port, a transfer error will occur (TEIF bit set) If DINCOS < DSIZE and DINC ≠ 00, the result will be unpredictable. Note: DSIZE = 11 (double-word) is forbidden when destination is TCM/AHB bus (DBUS=1).

BitField.name: PKE
BitField.description: PacK Enable These bit is set and cleared by software. If the Source Size is smaller than the destination, it will be padded according to the PAM value. If the Source data size is larger than the destination one, it will be truncated. The alignment will be done according to the PAM[0] value. This bit is protected and can be written only if EN is 0

BitField.name: PAM
BitField.description: Padding/Alignement Mode These bits are set and cleared by software. Case 1: Source data size smaller than destination data size - 3 options are valid. Case 2: Source data size larger than destination data size. The remainder part is discarded. When PKE = 1 or DSIZE=SSIZE, these bits are ignored. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0

BitField.name: TRGM
BitField.description: Trigger Mode These bits are set and cleared by software. Note: If TRGM is 11 for the current block, all the values loaded at the end of the current block through the linked list mechanism must keep the same value (TRGM=11) and the same SWRM value, otherwise the result is undefined. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.name: SWRM
BitField.description: SW Request Mode This bit is set and cleared by software. If a HW or SW request is currently active, the bit change will be delayed until the current transfer is completed. If the CxMAR contains a valid address, the CxMDR value will also be written @ CxMAR address. This bit is protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.name: BWM
BitField.description: Bufferable Write Mode This bit is set and cleared by software. This bit is protected and can be written only if EN is 0. Note: All MDMA destination accesses are non-cacheable.

Register.name: MDMA_C0BNDTR
Register.description: MDMA Channel x block number of data register

BitField.name: BNDT
BitField.description: block number of data to transfer

BitField.name: BRSUM
BitField.description: Block Repeat Source address Update Mode These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.name: BRDUM
BitField.description: Block Repeat Destination address Update Mode These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.name: BRC
BitField.description: Block Repeat Count This field contains the number of repetitions of the current block (0 to 4095). When the channel is enabled, this register is read-only, indicating the remaining number of blocks, excluding the current one. This register decrements after each complete block transfer. Once the last block transfer has completed, this register can either stay at zero or be reloaded automatically from memory (in Linked List mode - i.e. Link Address valid). These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

Register.name: MDMA_C0SAR
Register.description: MDMA channel x source address register

Register.name: MDMA_C0DAR
Register.description: MDMA channel x destination address register

Register.name: MDMA_C0BRUR
Register.description: MDMA channel x Block Repeat address Update register

Register.name: MDMA_C0LAR
Register.description: MDMA channel x Link Address register

Register.name: MDMA_C0TBR
Register.description: MDMA channel x Trigger and Bus selection Register

BitField.name: SBUS
BitField.description: Source BUS select This bit is protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.name: DBUS
BitField.description: Destination BUS slect This bit is protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

Register.name: MDMA_C0MAR
Register.description: MDMA channel x Mask address register

Register.name: MDMA_C0MDR
Register.description: MDMA channel x Mask Data register

BitField.name: CTCIF1

CTC is set when the last block was transferred and the channel has been automatically disabled. CTC is also set when the channel is suspended, as a result of writing EN bit to 0.

BitField.name: BRTIF1
BitField.description: Channel x block repeat transfer complete interrupt flag This bit is set by hardware. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the corresponding bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

BitField.name: BTIF1
BitField.description: Channel x block transfer complete interrupt flag This bit is set by hardware. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the corresponding bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

Register.name: MDMA_C1IFCR
Register.description: MDMA channel x interrupt flag clear register

BitField.name: SSIZE
BitField.description: Source data size These bits are set and cleared by software. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0 Note: If a value of 11 is programmed for the TCM access/AHB port, a transfer error will occur (TEIF bit set) If SINCOS < SSIZE and SINC ≠ 00, the result will be unpredictable. Note: SSIZE = 11 (double-word) is forbidden when source is TCM/AHB bus (SBUS=1).

BitField.name: DSIZE
BitField.description: Destination data size These bits are set and cleared by software. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0. Note: If a value of 11 is programmed for the TCM access/AHB port, a transfer error will occur (TEIF bit set) If DINCOS < DSIZE and DINC ≠ 00, the result will be unpredictable. Note: DSIZE = 11 (double-word) is forbidden when destination is TCM/AHB bus (DBUS=1).

BitField.name: PKE
BitField.description: PacK Enable These bit is set and cleared by software. If the Source Size is smaller than the destination, it will be padded according to the PAM value. If the Source data size is larger than the destination one, it will be truncated. The alignment will be done according to the PAM[0] value. This bit is protected and can be written only if EN is 0

BitField.name: PAM
BitField.description: Padding/Alignement Mode These bits are set and cleared by software. Case 1: Source data size smaller than destination data size - 3 options are valid. Case 2: Source data size larger than destination data size. The remainder part is discarded. When PKE = 1 or DSIZE=SSIZE, these bits are ignored. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0

BitField.name: TRGM
BitField.description: Trigger Mode These bits are set and cleared by software. Note: If TRGM is 11 for the current block, all the values loaded at the end of the current block through the linked list mechanism must keep the same value (TRGM=11) and the same SWRM value, otherwise the result is undefined. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.name: SWRM
BitField.description: SW Request Mode This bit is set and cleared by software. If a HW or SW request is currently active, the bit change will be delayed until the current transfer is completed. If the CxMAR contains a valid address, the CxMDR value will also be written @ CxMAR address. This bit is protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.name: BWM
BitField.description: Bufferable Write Mode This bit is set and cleared by software. This bit is protected and can be written only if EN is 0. Note: All MDMA destination accesses are non-cacheable.

Register.name: MDMA_C2BNDTR
Register.description: MDMA Channel x block number of data register

BitField.name: BNDT
BitField.description: block number of data to transfer

BitField.name: BRSUM
BitField.description: Block Repeat Source address Update Mode These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.name: BRDUM
BitField.description: Block Repeat Destination address Update Mode These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.name: BRC
BitField.description: Block Repeat Count This field contains the number of repetitions of the current block (0 to 4095). When the channel is enabled, this register is read-only, indicating the remaining number of blocks, excluding the current one. This register decrements after each complete block transfer. Once the last block transfer has completed, this register can either stay at zero or be reloaded automatically from memory (in Linked List mode - i.e. Link Address valid). These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

Register.name: MDMA_C2SAR
Register.description: MDMA channel x source address register

Register.name: MDMA_C2DAR
Register.description: MDMA channel x destination address register

Register.name: MDMA_C2BRUR
Register.description: MDMA channel x Block Repeat address Update register

Register.name: MDMA_C2LAR
Register.description: MDMA channel x Link Address register

Register.name: MDMA_C2TBR
Register.description: MDMA channel x Trigger and Bus selection Register

BitField.name: SBUS
BitField.description: Source BUS select This bit is protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.name: DBUS
BitField.description: Destination BUS slect This bit is protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

Register.name: MDMA_C2MAR
Register.description: MDMA channel x Mask address register

Register.name: MDMA_C2MDR
Register.description: MDMA channel x Mask Data register

BitField.name: TEIF3
BitField.description: Channel x transfer error interrupt flag This bit is set by hardware. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the corresponding bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

BitField.name: CTCIF3
BitField.description: Channel x Channel Transfer Complete interrupt flag This bit is set by hardware. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the corresponding bit in the DMA_IFCRy register. CTC is set when the last block was transferred and the channel has been automatically disabled. CTC is also set when the channel is suspended, as a result of writing EN bit to 0.

BitField.name: BRTIF3
BitField.description: Channel x block repeat transfer complete interrupt flag This bit is set by hardware. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the corresponding bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

BitField.name: BTIF3
BitField.description: Channel x block transfer complete interrupt flag This bit is set by hardware. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the corresponding bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

Register.name: MDMA_C3IFCR
Register.description: MDMA channel x interrupt flag clear register

BitField.name: CTEIF3
BitField.description: Channel x clear transfer error interrupt flag Writing a 1 into this bit clears TEIFx in the MDMA_ISRy register

BitField.name: CCTCIF3
BitField.description: Clear Channel transfer complete interrupt flag for channel x Writing a 1 into this bit clears CTCIFx in the MDMA_ISRy register

BitField.name: CBRTIF3
BitField.description: Channel x clear block repeat transfer complete interrupt flag Writing a 1 into this bit clears BRTIFx in the MDMA_ISRy register

BitField.name: CBTIF3
BitField.description: Channel x Clear block transfer complete interrupt flag Writing a 1 into this bit clears BTIFx in the MDMA_ISRy register

BitField.name: CLTCIF3
BitField.description: CLear buffer Transfer Complete Interrupt Flag for channel x Writing a 1 into this bit clears TCIFx in the MDMA_ISRy register

Register.name: MDMA_C3ESR
Register.description: MDMA Channel x error status register

BitField.name: TEA
BitField.description: Transfer Error Address These bits are set and cleared by HW, in case of an MDMA data transfer error. It is used in conjunction with TED. This field indicates the 7 LSBits of the address which generated a transfer/access error. It may be used by SW to retrieve the failing address, by adding this value (truncated to the buffer transfer length size) to the current SAR/DAR value. Note: The SAR/DAR current value doesnt reflect this last address due to the FIFO management system. The SAR/DAR are only updated at the end of a (buffer) transfer (of TLEN+1 bytes). Note: It is not set in case of a link data error.

BitField.name: TED
BitField.description: Transfer Error Direction These bit is set and cleared by HW, in case of an MDMA data transfer error.

BitField.name: TELD
BitField.description: Transfer Error Link Data These bit is set by HW, in case of a transfer error while reading the block link data structure. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the CTEIFx bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

BitField.name: TEMD
BitField.description: Transfer Error Mask Data These bit is set by HW, in case of a transfer error while writing the Mask Data. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the CTEIFx bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

BitField.name: ASE
BitField.description: Address/Size Error These bit is set by HW, when the programmed address is not aligned with the data size. TED will indicate whether the problem is on the source or destination. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the CTEIFx bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

BitField.name: BSE
BitField.description: Block Size Error These bit is set by HW, when the block size is not an integer multiple of the data size either for source or destination. TED will indicate whether the problem is on the source or destination. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the CTEIFx bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

Register.name: MDMA_C3CR
Register.description: This register is used to control the concerned channel.

BitField.name: TEIE
BitField.description: Transfer error interrupt enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: CTCIE
BitField.description: Channel Transfer Complete interrupt enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: BRTIE
BitField.description: Block Repeat transfer interrupt enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: BTIE
BitField.description: Block Transfer interrupt enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: TCIE
BitField.description: buffer Transfer Complete interrupt enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: PL
BitField.description: Priority level These bits are set and cleared by software. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.name: SWRQ
BitField.description: SW ReQuest Writing a 1 into this bit sets the CRQAx in MDMA_ISRy register, activating the request on Channel x Note: Either the whole CxCR register or the 8-bit/16-bit register @ Address offset: 0x4E + 0x40 chn may be used for SWRQ activation. In case of a SW request, acknowledge is not generated (neither HW signal, nor CxMAR write access).

Register.name: MDMA_C3TCR
Register.description: This register is used to configure the concerned channel.

BitField.name: SINC
BitField.description: Source increment mode These bits are set and cleared by software. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0 Note: When source is AHB (SBUS=1), SINC = 00 is forbidden. In Linked List Mode, at the end of a block (single or last block in repeated block transfer mode), this register will be loaded from memory (from address given by current LAR[31:0] + 0x00).

BitField.name: DINC
BitField.description: Destination increment mode These bits are set and cleared by software. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0 Note: When destination is AHB (DBUS=1), DINC = 00 is forbidden.

BitField.name: SSIZE
BitField.description: Source data size These bits are set and cleared by software. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0 Note: If a value of 11 is programmed for the TCM access/AHB port, a transfer error will occur (TEIF bit set) If SINCOS < SSIZE and SINC ≠ 00, the result will be unpredictable. Note: SSIZE = 11 (double-word) is forbidden when source is TCM/AHB bus (SBUS=1).

Note: If a value of 11 is programmed for the TCM access/AHB port, a transfer error will occur (TEIF bit set) If DINCOS < DSIZE and DINC ≠ 00, the result will be unpredictable. Note: DSIZE = 11 (double-word) is forbidden when destination is TCM/AHB bus (DBUS=1).

If the Source data size is larger than the destination one, it will be truncated. The alignment will be done according to the PAM[0] value. This bit is protected and can be written only if EN is 0

BitField.name: PAM
BitField.description: Padding/Alignement Mode These bits are set and cleared by software. Case 1: Source data size smaller than destination data size - 3 options are valid. Case 2: Source data size larger than destination data size. The remainder part is discarded. When PKE = 1 or DSIZE=SSIZE, these bits are ignored. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0

BitField.name: TRGM
BitField.description: Trigger Mode These bits are set and cleared by software. Note: If TRGM is 11 for the current block, all the values loaded at the end of the current block through the linked list mechanism must keep the same value (TRGM=11) and the same SWRM value, otherwise the result is undefined. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.description: SW Request Mode This bit is set and cleared by software. If a HW or SW request is currently active, the bit change will be delayed until the current transfer is completed. If the CxMAR contains a valid address, the CxMDR value will also be written @ CxMAR address. This bit is protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.name: BWM
BitField.description: Bufferable Write Mode This bit is set and cleared by software. This bit is protected and can be written only if EN is 0. Note: All MDMA destination accesses are non-cacheable.
