BitField.description: Source increment mode These bits are set and cleared by software. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0 Note: When source is AHB (SBUS=1), SINC = 00 is forbidden. In Linked List Mode, at the end of a block (single or last block in repeated block transfer mode), this register will be loaded from memory (from address given by current LAR[31:0] + 0x00).

BitField.name: DINC
BitField.description: Destination increment mode These bits are set and cleared by software. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0 Note: When destination is AHB (DBUS=1), DINC = 00 is forbidden.

BitField.name: SSIZE
BitField.description: Source data size These bits are set and cleared by software. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0 Note: If a value of 11 is programmed for the TCM access/AHB port, a transfer error will occur (TEIF bit set) If SINCOS < SSIZE and SINC ≠ 00, the result will be unpredictable. Note: SSIZE = 11 (double-word) is forbidden when source is TCM/AHB bus (SBUS=1).

BitField.name: DSIZE
BitField.description: Destination data size These bits are set and cleared by software. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0. Note: If a value of 11 is programmed for the TCM access/AHB port, a transfer error will occur (TEIF bit set) If DINCOS < DSIZE and DINC ≠ 00, the result will be unpredictable. Note: DSIZE = 11 (double-word) is forbidden when destination is TCM/AHB bus (DBUS=1).

BitField.name: PKE
BitField.description: PacK Enable These bit is set and cleared by software. If the Source Size is smaller than the destination, it will be padded according to the PAM value. If the Source data size is larger than the destination one, it will be truncated. The alignment will be done according to the PAM[0] value. This bit is protected and can be written only if EN is 0

BitField.name: PAM
BitField.description: Padding/Alignement Mode These bits are set and cleared by software. Case 1: Source data size smaller than destination data size - 3 options are valid. Case 2: Source data size larger than destination data size. The remainder part is discarded. When PKE = 1 or DSIZE=SSIZE, these bits are ignored. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0

BitField.name: TRGM
BitField.description: Trigger Mode These bits are set and cleared by software. Note: If TRGM is 11 for the current block, all the values loaded at the end of the current block through the linked list mechanism must keep the same value (TRGM=11) and the same SWRM value, otherwise the result is undefined. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.name: SWRM
BitField.description: SW Request Mode This bit is set and cleared by software. If a HW or SW request is currently active, the bit change will be delayed until the current transfer is completed. If the CxMAR contains a valid address, the CxMDR value will also be written @ CxMAR address. This bit is protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.name: BWM
BitField.description: Bufferable Write Mode This bit is set and cleared by software. This bit is protected and can be written only if EN is 0. Note: All MDMA destination accesses are non-cacheable.

Register.name: MDMA_C5BNDTR
Register.description: MDMA Channel x block number of data register

BitField.name: BNDT
BitField.description: block number of data to transfer

BitField.name: BRSUM
BitField.description: Block Repeat Source address Update Mode These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.name: BRDUM
BitField.description: Block Repeat Destination address Update Mode These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.name: BRC
BitField.description: Block Repeat Count This field contains the number of repetitions of the current block (0 to 4095). When the channel is enabled, this register is read-only, indicating the remaining number of blocks, excluding the current one. This register decrements after each complete block transfer. Once the last block transfer has completed, this register can either stay at zero or be reloaded automatically from memory (in Linked List mode - i.e. Link Address valid). These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

Register.name: MDMA_C5SAR
Register.description: MDMA channel x source address register

Register.name: MDMA_C5DAR
Register.description: MDMA channel x destination address register

Register.name: MDMA_C5BRUR
Register.description: MDMA channel x Block Repeat address Update register

Register.name: MDMA_C5LAR
Register.description: MDMA channel x Link Address register

Register.name: MDMA_C5TBR
Register.description: MDMA channel x Trigger and Bus selection Register

BitField.name: SBUS
BitField.description: Source BUS select This bit is protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.name: DBUS
BitField.description: Destination BUS slect This bit is protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

Register.name: MDMA_C5MAR
Register.description: MDMA channel x Mask address register

Register.name: MDMA_C5MDR
Register.description: MDMA channel x Mask Data register

BitField.name: TEIF6
BitField.description: Channel x transfer error interrupt flag This bit is set by hardware. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the corresponding bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

BitField.name: CTCIF6
BitField.description: Channel x Channel Transfer Complete interrupt flag This bit is set by hardware. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the corresponding bit in the DMA_IFCRy register. CTC is set when the last block was transferred and the channel has been automatically disabled. CTC is also set when the channel is suspended, as a result of writing EN bit to 0.

BitField.name: BRTIF6
BitField.description: Channel x block repeat transfer complete interrupt flag This bit is set by hardware. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the corresponding bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

BitField.name: BTIF6
BitField.description: Channel x block transfer complete interrupt flag This bit is set by hardware. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the corresponding bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

Register.name: MDMA_C6IFCR
Register.description: MDMA channel x interrupt flag clear register

BitField.name: CTEIF6
BitField.description: Channel x clear transfer error interrupt flag Writing a 1 into this bit clears TEIFx in the MDMA_ISRy register

BitField.name: CCTCIF6
BitField.description: Clear Channel transfer complete interrupt flag for channel x Writing a 1 into this bit clears CTCIFx in the MDMA_ISRy register

BitField.name: CBRTIF6
BitField.description: Channel x clear block repeat transfer complete interrupt flag Writing a 1 into this bit clears BRTIFx in the MDMA_ISRy register

BitField.name: CBTIF6
BitField.description: Channel x Clear block transfer complete interrupt flag Writing a 1 into this bit clears BTIFx in the MDMA_ISRy register

BitField.name: CLTCIF6
BitField.description: CLear buffer Transfer Complete Interrupt Flag for channel x Writing a 1 into this bit clears TCIFx in the MDMA_ISRy register

Register.name: MDMA_C6ESR
Register.description: MDMA Channel x error status register

BitField.name: TEA
BitField.description: Transfer Error Address These bits are set and cleared by HW, in case of an MDMA data transfer error. It is used in conjunction with TED. This field indicates the 7 LSBits of the address which generated a transfer/access error. It may be used by SW to retrieve the failing address, by adding this value (truncated to the buffer transfer length size) to the current SAR/DAR value. Note: The SAR/DAR current value doesnt reflect this last address due to the FIFO management system. The SAR/DAR are only updated at the end of a (buffer) transfer (of TLEN+1 bytes). Note: It is not set in case of a link data error.

BitField.name: TED
BitField.description: Transfer Error Direction These bit is set and cleared by HW, in case of an MDMA data transfer error.

BitField.name: TELD
BitField.description: Transfer Error Link Data These bit is set by HW, in case of a transfer error while reading the block link data structure. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the CTEIFx bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

BitField.name: TEMD
BitField.description: Transfer Error Mask Data These bit is set by HW, in case of a transfer error while writing the Mask Data. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the CTEIFx bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

BitField.name: ASE
BitField.description: Address/Size Error These bit is set by HW, when the programmed address is not aligned with the data size. TED will indicate whether the problem is on the source or destination. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the CTEIFx bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

BitField.name: BSE
BitField.description: Block Size Error These bit is set by HW, when the block size is not an integer multiple of the data size either for source or destination. TED will indicate whether the problem is on the source or destination. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the CTEIFx bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

Register.name: MDMA_C6CR
Register.description: This register is used to control the concerned channel.

BitField.name: TEIE
BitField.description: Transfer error interrupt enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: CTCIE
BitField.description: Channel Transfer Complete interrupt enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: BRTIE
BitField.description: Block Repeat transfer interrupt enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: BTIE
BitField.description: Block Transfer interrupt enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: TCIE
BitField.description: buffer Transfer Complete interrupt enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: PL
BitField.description: Priority level These bits are set and cleared by software. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.name: SWRQ
BitField.description: SW ReQuest Writing a 1 into this bit sets the CRQAx in MDMA_ISRy register, activating the request on Channel x Note: Either the whole CxCR register or the 8-bit/16-bit register @ Address offset: 0x4E + 0x40 chn may be used for SWRQ activation. In case of a SW request, acknowledge is not generated (neither HW signal, nor CxMAR write access).

Register.name: MDMA_C6TCR
Register.description: This register is used to configure the concerned channel.

BitField.description: Bufferable Write Mode This bit is set and cleared by software. This bit is protected and can be written only if EN is 0. Note: All MDMA destination accesses are non-cacheable.

BitField.description: SW ReQuest Writing a 1 into this bit sets the CRQAx in MDMA_ISRy register, activating the request on Channel x Note: Either the whole CxCR register or the 8-bit/16-bit register @ Address offset: 0x4E + 0x40 chn may be used for SWRQ activation. In case of a SW request, acknowledge is not generated (neither HW signal, nor CxMAR write access).

Register.name: MDMA_C8TCR
Register.description: This register is used to configure the concerned channel.

BitField.name: SINC
BitField.description: Source increment mode These bits are set and cleared by software. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0 Note: When source is AHB (SBUS=1), SINC = 00 is forbidden. In Linked List Mode, at the end of a block (single or last block in repeated block transfer mode), this register will be loaded from memory (from address given by current LAR[31:0] + 0x00).

BitField.name: DINC
BitField.description: Destination increment mode These bits are set and cleared by software. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0 Note: When destination is AHB (DBUS=1), DINC = 00 is forbidden.

BitField.name: SSIZE
BitField.description: Source data size These bits are set and cleared by software. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0 Note: If a value of 11 is programmed for the TCM access/AHB port, a transfer error will occur (TEIF bit set) If SINCOS < SSIZE and SINC ≠ 00, the result will be unpredictable. Note: SSIZE = 11 (double-word) is forbidden when source is TCM/AHB bus (SBUS=1).

BitField.name: DSIZE
BitField.description: Destination data size These bits are set and cleared by software. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0. Note: If a value of 11 is programmed for the TCM access/AHB port, a transfer error will occur (TEIF bit set) If DINCOS < DSIZE and DINC ≠ 00, the result will be unpredictable. Note: DSIZE = 11 (double-word) is forbidden when destination is TCM/AHB bus (DBUS=1).

BitField.name: PKE
BitField.description: PacK Enable These bit is set and cleared by software. If the Source Size is smaller than the destination, it will be padded according to the PAM value. If the Source data size is larger than the destination one, it will be truncated. The alignment will be done according to the PAM[0] value. This bit is protected and can be written only if EN is 0

BitField.name: PAM
BitField.description: Padding/Alignement Mode These bits are set and cleared by software. Case 1: Source data size smaller than destination data size - 3 options are valid. Case 2: Source data size larger than destination data size. The remainder part is discarded. When PKE = 1 or DSIZE=SSIZE, these bits are ignored. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0

BitField.name: TRGM
BitField.description: Trigger Mode These bits are set and cleared by software. Note: If TRGM is 11 for the current block, all the values loaded at the end of the current block through the linked list mechanism must keep the same value (TRGM=11) and the same SWRM value, otherwise the result is undefined. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.name: SWRM
BitField.description: SW Request Mode This bit is set and cleared by software. If a HW or SW request is currently active, the bit change will be delayed until the current transfer is completed. If the CxMAR contains a valid address, the CxMDR value will also be written @ CxMAR address. This bit is protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.name: BWM
BitField.description: Bufferable Write Mode This bit is set and cleared by software. This bit is protected and can be written only if EN is 0. Note: All MDMA destination accesses are non-cacheable.

Register.name: MDMA_C8BNDTR
Register.description: MDMA Channel x block number of data register

BitField.name: BNDT
BitField.description: block number of data to transfer

BitField.name: BRSUM
BitField.description: Block Repeat Source address Update Mode These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.name: BRDUM
BitField.description: Block Repeat Destination address Update Mode These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.name: BRC
BitField.description: Block Repeat Count This field contains the number of repetitions of the current block (0 to 4095). When the channel is enabled, this register is read-only, indicating the remaining number of blocks, excluding the current one. This register decrements after each complete block transfer. Once the last block transfer has completed, this register can either stay at zero or be reloaded automatically from memory (in Linked List mode - i.e. Link Address valid). These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

Register.name: MDMA_C8SAR
Register.description: MDMA channel x source address register

Register.name: MDMA_C8DAR
Register.description: MDMA channel x destination address register

Register.name: MDMA_C8BRUR
Register.description: MDMA channel x Block Repeat address Update register

Register.name: MDMA_C8LAR
Register.description: MDMA channel x Link Address register

Register.name: MDMA_C8TBR
Register.description: MDMA channel x Trigger and Bus selection Register

BitField.name: SBUS
BitField.description: Source BUS select This bit is protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.name: DBUS
BitField.description: Destination BUS slect This bit is protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

Register.name: MDMA_C8MAR
Register.description: MDMA channel x Mask address register

Register.name: MDMA_C8MDR
Register.description: MDMA channel x Mask Data register

BitField.name: TEIF9
BitField.description: Channel x transfer error interrupt flag This bit is set by hardware. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the corresponding bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

BitField.name: CTCIF9
BitField.description: Channel x Channel Transfer Complete interrupt flag This bit is set by hardware. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the corresponding bit in the DMA_IFCRy register. CTC is set when the last block was transferred and the channel has been automatically disabled. CTC is also set when the channel is suspended, as a result of writing EN bit to 0.

BitField.name: BRTIF9
BitField.description: Channel x block repeat transfer complete interrupt flag This bit is set by hardware. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the corresponding bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

BitField.name: BTIF9
BitField.description: Channel x block transfer complete interrupt flag This bit is set by hardware. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the corresponding bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

Register.name: MDMA_C9IFCR
Register.description: MDMA channel x interrupt flag clear register

BitField.name: CTEIF9
BitField.description: Channel x clear transfer error interrupt flag Writing a 1 into this bit clears TEIFx in the MDMA_ISRy register

BitField.name: CCTCIF9
BitField.description: Clear Channel transfer complete interrupt flag for channel x Writing a 1 into this bit clears CTCIFx in the MDMA_ISRy register

BitField.name: CBRTIF9
BitField.description: Channel x clear block repeat transfer complete interrupt flag Writing a 1 into this bit clears BRTIFx in the MDMA_ISRy register

BitField.name: CBTIF9
BitField.description: Channel x Clear block transfer complete interrupt flag Writing a 1 into this bit clears BTIFx in the MDMA_ISRy register

BitField.name: CLTCIF9
BitField.description: CLear buffer Transfer Complete Interrupt Flag for channel x Writing a 1 into this bit clears TCIFx in the MDMA_ISRy register

Register.name: MDMA_C9ESR
Register.description: MDMA Channel x error status register

BitField.name: TEA
BitField.description: Transfer Error Address These bits are set and cleared by HW, in case of an MDMA data transfer error. It is used in conjunction with TED. This field indicates the 7 LSBits of the address which generated a transfer/access error. It may be used by SW to retrieve the failing address, by adding this value (truncated to the buffer transfer length size) to the current SAR/DAR value. Note: The SAR/DAR current value doesnt reflect this last address due to the FIFO management system. The SAR/DAR are only updated at the end of a (buffer) transfer (of TLEN+1 bytes). Note: It is not set in case of a link data error.

BitField.name: TED
BitField.description: Transfer Error Direction These bit is set and cleared by HW, in case of an MDMA data transfer error.

BitField.name: TELD
BitField.description: Transfer Error Link Data These bit is set by HW, in case of a transfer error while reading the block link data structure. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the CTEIFx bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

BitField.name: TEMD
BitField.description: Transfer Error Mask Data These bit is set by HW, in case of a transfer error while writing the Mask Data. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the CTEIFx bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

BitField.name: ASE
BitField.description: Address/Size Error These bit is set by HW, when the programmed address is not aligned with the data size. TED will indicate whether the problem is on the source or destination. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the CTEIFx bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

BitField.name: BSE
BitField.description: Block Size Error These bit is set by HW, when the block size is not an integer multiple of the data size either for source or destination. TED will indicate whether the problem is on the source or destination. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the CTEIFx bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

Register.name: MDMA_C9CR
Register.description: This register is used to control the concerned channel.

BitField.name: TEIE
BitField.description: Transfer error interrupt enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: CTCIE
BitField.description: Channel Transfer Complete interrupt enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: BRTIE
BitField.description: Block Repeat transfer interrupt enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: BTIE
BitField.description: Block Transfer interrupt enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: TCIE
BitField.description: buffer Transfer Complete interrupt enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: PL
BitField.description: Priority level These bits are set and cleared by software. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

In case of a SW request, acknowledge is not generated (neither HW signal, nor CxMAR write access).

BitField.description: Block Repeat transfer interrupt enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: BTIE
BitField.description: Block Transfer interrupt enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: TCIE
BitField.description: buffer Transfer Complete interrupt enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: PL
BitField.description: Priority level These bits are set and cleared by software. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.name: SWRQ
BitField.description: SW ReQuest Writing a 1 into this bit sets the CRQAx in MDMA_ISRy register, activating the request on Channel x Note: Either the whole CxCR register or the 8-bit/16-bit register @ Address offset: 0x4E + 0x40 chn may be used for SWRQ activation. In case of a SW request, acknowledge is not generated (neither HW signal, nor CxMAR write access).

Register.name: MDMA_C11TCR
Register.description: This register is used to configure the concerned channel.

BitField.name: SINC
BitField.description: Source increment mode These bits are set and cleared by software. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0 Note: When source is AHB (SBUS=1), SINC = 00 is forbidden. In Linked List Mode, at the end of a block (single or last block in repeated block transfer mode), this register will be loaded from memory (from address given by current LAR[31:0] + 0x00).

BitField.name: DINC
BitField.description: Destination increment mode These bits are set and cleared by software. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0 Note: When destination is AHB (DBUS=1), DINC = 00 is forbidden.

BitField.name: SSIZE
BitField.description: Source data size These bits are set and cleared by software. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0 Note: If a value of 11 is programmed for the TCM access/AHB port, a transfer error will occur (TEIF bit set) If SINCOS < SSIZE and SINC ≠ 00, the result will be unpredictable. Note: SSIZE = 11 (double-word) is forbidden when source is TCM/AHB bus (SBUS=1).

BitField.name: DSIZE
BitField.description: Destination data size These bits are set and cleared by software. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0. Note: If a value of 11 is programmed for the TCM access/AHB port, a transfer error will occur (TEIF bit set) If DINCOS < DSIZE and DINC ≠ 00, the result will be unpredictable. Note: DSIZE = 11 (double-word) is forbidden when destination is TCM/AHB bus (DBUS=1).

BitField.name: PKE
BitField.description: PacK Enable These bit is set and cleared by software. If the Source Size is smaller than the destination, it will be padded according to the PAM value. If the Source data size is larger than the destination one, it will be truncated. The alignment will be done according to the PAM[0] value. This bit is protected and can be written only if EN is 0

BitField.name: PAM
BitField.description: Padding/Alignement Mode These bits are set and cleared by software. Case 1: Source data size smaller than destination data size - 3 options are valid. Case 2: Source data size larger than destination data size. The remainder part is discarded. When PKE = 1 or DSIZE=SSIZE, these bits are ignored. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0

BitField.name: TRGM
BitField.description: Trigger Mode These bits are set and cleared by software. Note: If TRGM is 11 for the current block, all the values loaded at the end of the current block through the linked list mechanism must keep the same value (TRGM=11) and the same SWRM value, otherwise the result is undefined. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.name: SWRM
BitField.description: SW Request Mode This bit is set and cleared by software. If a HW or SW request is currently active, the bit change will be delayed until the current transfer is completed. If the CxMAR contains a valid address, the CxMDR value will also be written @ CxMAR address. This bit is protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.name: BWM
BitField.description: Bufferable Write Mode This bit is set and cleared by software. This bit is protected and can be written only if EN is 0. Note: All MDMA destination accesses are non-cacheable.

Register.name: MDMA_C11BNDTR
Register.description: MDMA Channel x block number of data register

BitField.name: BNDT
BitField.description: block number of data to transfer

BitField.name: BRSUM
BitField.description: Block Repeat Source address Update Mode These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.name: BRDUM
BitField.description: Block Repeat Destination address Update Mode These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.name: BRC
BitField.description: Block Repeat Count This field contains the number of repetitions of the current block (0 to 4095). When the channel is enabled, this register is read-only, indicating the remaining number of blocks, excluding the current one. This register decrements after each complete block transfer. Once the last block transfer has completed, this register can either stay at zero or be reloaded automatically from memory (in Linked List mode - i.e. Link Address valid). These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

Register.name: MDMA_C11SAR
Register.description: MDMA channel x source address register

Register.name: MDMA_C11DAR
Register.description: MDMA channel x destination address register

Register.name: MDMA_C11BRUR
Register.description: MDMA channel x Block Repeat address Update register

Register.name: MDMA_C11LAR
Register.description: MDMA channel x Link Address register

Register.name: MDMA_C11TBR
Register.description: MDMA channel x Trigger and Bus selection Register

BitField.name: SBUS
BitField.description: Source BUS select This bit is protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.name: DBUS
BitField.description: Destination BUS slect This bit is protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

Register.name: MDMA_C11MAR
Register.description: MDMA channel x Mask address register

Register.name: MDMA_C11MDR
Register.description: MDMA channel x Mask Data register

BitField.name: TEIF12
BitField.description: Channel x transfer error interrupt flag This bit is set by hardware. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the corresponding bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

BitField.name: CTCIF12
BitField.description: Channel x Channel Transfer Complete interrupt flag This bit is set by hardware. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the corresponding bit in the DMA_IFCRy register. CTC is set when the last block was transferred and the channel has been automatically disabled. CTC is also set when the channel is suspended, as a result of writing EN bit to 0.

BitField.name: BRTIF12
BitField.description: Channel x block repeat transfer complete interrupt flag This bit is set by hardware. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the corresponding bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

BitField.name: BTIF12
BitField.description: Channel x block transfer complete interrupt flag This bit is set by hardware. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the corresponding bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

Register.name: MDMA_C12IFCR
Register.description: MDMA channel x interrupt flag clear register

BitField.name: CTEIF12
BitField.description: Channel x clear transfer error interrupt flag Writing a 1 into this bit clears TEIFx in the MDMA_ISRy register

BitField.name: CCTCIF12
BitField.description: Clear Channel transfer complete interrupt flag for channel x Writing a 1 into this bit clears CTCIFx in the MDMA_ISRy register

BitField.name: CBRTIF12
BitField.description: Channel x clear block repeat transfer complete interrupt flag Writing a 1 into this bit clears BRTIFx in the MDMA_ISRy register

BitField.name: CBTIF12
BitField.description: Channel x Clear block transfer complete interrupt flag Writing a 1 into this bit clears BTIFx in the MDMA_ISRy register

BitField.name: CLTCIF12
BitField.description: CLear buffer Transfer Complete Interrupt Flag for channel x Writing a 1 into this bit clears TCIFx in the MDMA_ISRy register

Register.name: MDMA_C12ESR
Register.description: MDMA Channel x error status register

BitField.name: TEA
BitField.description: Transfer Error Address These bits are set and cleared by HW, in case of an MDMA data transfer error. It is used in conjunction with TED. This field indicates the 7 LSBits of the address which generated a transfer/access error. It may be used by SW to retrieve the failing address, by adding this value (truncated to the buffer transfer length size) to the current SAR/DAR value. Note: The SAR/DAR current value doesnt reflect this last address due to the FIFO management system. The SAR/DAR are only updated at the end of a (buffer) transfer (of TLEN+1 bytes). Note: It is not set in case of a link data error.

BitField.name: TED
BitField.description: Transfer Error Direction These bit is set and cleared by HW, in case of an MDMA data transfer error.

BitField.name: TELD
BitField.description: Transfer Error Link Data These bit is set by HW, in case of a transfer error while reading the block link data structure. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the CTEIFx bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

BitField.name: TEMD
BitField.description: Transfer Error Mask Data These bit is set by HW, in case of a transfer error while writing the Mask Data. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the CTEIFx bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

BitField.name: ASE
BitField.description: Address/Size Error These bit is set by HW, when the programmed address is not aligned with the data size. TED will indicate whether the problem is on the source or destination. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the CTEIFx bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

BitField.name: BSE
BitField.description: Block Size Error These bit is set by HW, when the block size is not an integer multiple of the data size either for source or destination. TED will indicate whether the problem is on the source or destination. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the CTEIFx bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

BitField.name: BSE
BitField.description: Block Size Error These bit is set by HW, when the block size is not an integer multiple of the data size either for source or destination. TED will indicate whether the problem is on the source or destination. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the CTEIFx bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

Register.name: MDMA_C14CR
Register.description: This register is used to control the concerned channel.

BitField.name: TEIE
BitField.description: Transfer error interrupt enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: CTCIE
BitField.description: Channel Transfer Complete interrupt enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: BRTIE
BitField.description: Block Repeat transfer interrupt enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: BTIE
BitField.description: Block Transfer interrupt enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: TCIE
BitField.description: buffer Transfer Complete interrupt enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: PL
BitField.description: Priority level These bits are set and cleared by software. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.name: SWRQ
BitField.description: SW ReQuest Writing a 1 into this bit sets the CRQAx in MDMA_ISRy register, activating the request on Channel x Note: Either the whole CxCR register or the 8-bit/16-bit register @ Address offset: 0x4E + 0x40 chn may be used for SWRQ activation. In case of a SW request, acknowledge is not generated (neither HW signal, nor CxMAR write access).

Register.name: MDMA_C14TCR
Register.description: This register is used to configure the concerned channel.

BitField.name: SINC
BitField.description: Source increment mode These bits are set and cleared by software. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0 Note: When source is AHB (SBUS=1), SINC = 00 is forbidden. In Linked List Mode, at the end of a block (single or last block in repeated block transfer mode), this register will be loaded from memory (from address given by current LAR[31:0] + 0x00).

BitField.name: DINC
BitField.description: Destination increment mode These bits are set and cleared by software. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0 Note: When destination is AHB (DBUS=1), DINC = 00 is forbidden.

BitField.name: SSIZE
BitField.description: Source data size These bits are set and cleared by software. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0 Note: If a value of 11 is programmed for the TCM access/AHB port, a transfer error will occur (TEIF bit set) If SINCOS < SSIZE and SINC ≠ 00, the result will be unpredictable. Note: SSIZE = 11 (double-word) is forbidden when source is TCM/AHB bus (SBUS=1).

BitField.name: DSIZE
BitField.description: Destination data size These bits are set and cleared by software. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0. Note: If a value of 11 is programmed for the TCM access/AHB port, a transfer error will occur (TEIF bit set) If DINCOS < DSIZE and DINC ≠ 00, the result will be unpredictable. Note: DSIZE = 11 (double-word) is forbidden when destination is TCM/AHB bus (DBUS=1).

BitField.name: PKE
BitField.description: PacK Enable These bit is set and cleared by software. If the Source Size is smaller than the destination, it will be padded according to the PAM value. If the Source data size is larger than the destination one, it will be truncated. The alignment will be done according to the PAM[0] value. This bit is protected and can be written only if EN is 0

BitField.name: PAM
BitField.description: Padding/Alignement Mode These bits are set and cleared by software. Case 1: Source data size smaller than destination data size - 3 options are valid. Case 2: Source data size larger than destination data size. The remainder part is discarded. When PKE = 1 or DSIZE=SSIZE, these bits are ignored. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0

BitField.name: TRGM
BitField.description: Trigger Mode These bits are set and cleared by software. Note: If TRGM is 11 for the current block, all the values loaded at the end of the current block through the linked list mechanism must keep the same value (TRGM=11) and the same SWRM value, otherwise the result is undefined. These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.name: SWRM
BitField.description: SW Request Mode This bit is set and cleared by software. If a HW or SW request is currently active, the bit change will be delayed until the current transfer is completed. If the CxMAR contains a valid address, the CxMDR value will also be written @ CxMAR address. This bit is protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.name: BWM
BitField.description: Bufferable Write Mode This bit is set and cleared by software. This bit is protected and can be written only if EN is 0. Note: All MDMA destination accesses are non-cacheable.

Register.name: MDMA_C14BNDTR
Register.description: MDMA Channel x block number of data register

BitField.name: BNDT
BitField.description: block number of data to transfer

BitField.name: BRSUM
BitField.description: Block Repeat Source address Update Mode These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.name: BRDUM
BitField.description: Block Repeat Destination address Update Mode These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.name: BRC
BitField.description: Block Repeat Count This field contains the number of repetitions of the current block (0 to 4095). When the channel is enabled, this register is read-only, indicating the remaining number of blocks, excluding the current one. This register decrements after each complete block transfer. Once the last block transfer has completed, this register can either stay at zero or be reloaded automatically from memory (in Linked List mode - i.e. Link Address valid). These bits are protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

Register.name: MDMA_C14SAR
Register.description: MDMA channel x source address register

Register.name: MDMA_C14DAR
Register.description: MDMA channel x destination address register

Register.name: MDMA_C14BRUR
Register.description: MDMA channel x Block Repeat address Update register

Register.name: MDMA_C14LAR
Register.description: MDMA channel x Link Address register

Register.name: MDMA_C14TBR
Register.description: MDMA channel x Trigger and Bus selection Register

BitField.name: SBUS
BitField.description: Source BUS select This bit is protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

BitField.name: DBUS
BitField.description: Destination BUS slect This bit is protected and can be written only if EN is 0.

Register.name: MDMA_C14MAR
Register.description: MDMA channel x Mask address register

Register.name: MDMA_C14MDR
Register.description: MDMA channel x Mask Data register

BitField.name: TEIF15
BitField.description: Channel x transfer error interrupt flag This bit is set by hardware. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the corresponding bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

BitField.name: CTCIF15
BitField.description: Channel x Channel Transfer Complete interrupt flag This bit is set by hardware. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the corresponding bit in the DMA_IFCRy register. CTC is set when the last block was transferred and the channel has been automatically disabled. CTC is also set when the channel is suspended, as a result of writing EN bit to 0.

BitField.name: BRTIF15
BitField.description: Channel x block repeat transfer complete interrupt flag This bit is set by hardware. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the corresponding bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

BitField.name: BTIF15
BitField.description: Channel x block transfer complete interrupt flag This bit is set by hardware. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the corresponding bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

Register.name: MDMA_C15IFCR
Register.description: MDMA channel x interrupt flag clear register

BitField.name: CTEIF15
BitField.description: Channel x clear transfer error interrupt flag Writing a 1 into this bit clears TEIFx in the MDMA_ISRy register

BitField.name: CCTCIF15
BitField.description: Clear Channel transfer complete interrupt flag for channel x Writing a 1 into this bit clears CTCIFx in the MDMA_ISRy register

BitField.name: CBRTIF15
BitField.description: Channel x clear block repeat transfer complete interrupt flag Writing a 1 into this bit clears BRTIFx in the MDMA_ISRy register

BitField.name: CBTIF15
BitField.description: Channel x Clear block transfer complete interrupt flag Writing a 1 into this bit clears BTIFx in the MDMA_ISRy register

BitField.name: CLTCIF15
BitField.description: CLear buffer Transfer Complete Interrupt Flag for channel x Writing a 1 into this bit clears TCIFx in the MDMA_ISRy register

Register.name: MDMA_C15ESR
Register.description: MDMA Channel x error status register

BitField.name: TEA
BitField.description: Transfer Error Address These bits are set and cleared by HW, in case of an MDMA data transfer error. It is used in conjunction with TED. This field indicates the 7 LSBits of the address which generated a transfer/access error. It may be used by SW to retrieve the failing address, by adding this value (truncated to the buffer transfer length size) to the current SAR/DAR value. Note: The SAR/DAR current value doesnt reflect this last address due to the FIFO management system. The SAR/DAR are only updated at the end of a (buffer) transfer (of TLEN+1 bytes). Note: It is not set in case of a link data error.

BitField.name: TED
BitField.description: Transfer Error Direction These bit is set and cleared by HW, in case of an MDMA data transfer error.

BitField.name: TELD
BitField.description: Transfer Error Link Data These bit is set by HW, in case of a transfer error while reading the block link data structure. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the CTEIFx bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

BitField.name: TEMD
BitField.description: Transfer Error Mask Data These bit is set by HW, in case of a transfer error while writing the Mask Data. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the CTEIFx bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

BitField.name: ASE
BitField.description: Address/Size Error These bit is set by HW, when the programmed address is not aligned with the data size. TED will indicate whether the problem is on the source or destination. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the CTEIFx bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

BitField.name: BSE
BitField.description: Block Size Error These bit is set by HW, when the block size is not an integer multiple of the data size either for source or destination. TED will indicate whether the problem is on the source or destination. It is cleared by software writing 1 to the CTEIFx bit in the DMA_IFCRy register.

Register.description: OctoSPI IO Manager Port 1 configuration register

Register.description: OctoSPI IO Manager Port 2 configuration register

BitField.name: LPDS
BitField.description: Low-power Deepsleep with SVOS3 (SVOS4 and SVOS5 always use low-power, regardless of the setting of this bit)

BitField.name: PLS
BitField.description: Programmable voltage detector level selection These bits select the voltage threshold detected by the PVD. Note: Refer to Section Electrical characteristics of the product datasheet for more details.

BitField.name: DBP
BitField.description: Disable backup domain write protection In reset state, the RCC_BDCR register, the RTC registers (including the backup registers), BREN and MOEN bits in PWR_CR2 register, are protected against parasitic write access. This bit must be set to enable write access to these registers.

BitField.name: FLPS
BitField.description: Flash low-power mode in DStop mode This bit allows to obtain the best trade-off between low-power consumption and restart time when exiting from DStop mode. When it is set, the Flash memory enters low-power mode when D1 domain is in DStop mode.

BitField.name: SVOS
BitField.description: System Stop mode voltage scaling selection These bits control the VCORE voltage level in system Stop mode, to obtain the best trade-off between power consumption and performance.

BitField.name: AVDEN
BitField.description: Peripheral voltage monitor on VDDA enable

BitField.name: ALS
BitField.description: Analog voltage detector level selection These bits select the voltage threshold detected by the AVD.

BitField.name: PVDO
BitField.description: Programmable voltage detect output This bit is set and cleared by hardware. It is valid only if the PVD has been enabled by the PVDE bit. Note: since the PVD is disabled in Standby mode, this bit is equal to 0 after Standby or reset until the PVDE bit is set.

BitField.name: ACTVOSRDY
BitField.description: Voltage levels ready bit for currently used VOS and SDLEVEL This bit is set to 1 by hardware when the voltage regulator and the SD converter are both disabled and Bypass mode is selected in PWR control register 3 (PWR_CR3).

BitField.name: ACTVOS
BitField.description: VOS currently applied for VCORE voltage scaling selection. These bits reflect the last VOS value applied to the PMU.

BitField.name: AVDO
BitField.description: Analog voltage detector output on VDDA This bit is set and cleared by hardware. It is valid only if AVD on VDDA is enabled by the AVDEN bit. Note: Since the AVD is disabled in Standby mode, this bit is equal to 0 after Standby or reset until the AVDEN bit is set.

Register.name: PWR_CR2
Register.description: This register is not reset by wakeup from Standby mode, RESET signal and VDD POR. It is only reset by VSW POR and VSWRST reset. This register shall not be accessed when VSWRST bit in RCC_BDCR register resets the VSW domain.After reset, PWR_CR2 register is write-protected. Prior to modifying its content, the DBP bit in PWR_CR1 register must be set to disable the write protection.

BitField.name: BREN
BitField.description: Backup regulator enable When set, the Backup regulator (used to maintain the backup RAM content in Standby and VBAT modes) is enabled. If BREN is reset, the backup regulator is switched off. The backup RAM can still be used in Run and Stop modes. However, its content will be lost in Standby and VBAT modes. If BREN is set, the application must wait till the Backup Regulator Ready flag (BRRDY) is set to indicate that the data written into the SRAM will be maintained in Standby and VBAT modes.

BitField.name: MONEN
BitField.description: VBAT and temperature monitoring enable When set, the VBAT supply and temperature monitoring is enabled.

BitField.name: BRRDY
BitField.description: Backup regulator ready This bit is set by hardware to indicate that the Backup regulator is ready.

BitField.name: TEMPL
BitField.description: Temperature level monitoring versus low threshold

BitField.name: TEMPH
BitField.description: Temperature level monitoring versus high threshold

Register.name: PWR_CR3
Register.description: Reset only by POR only, not reset by wakeup from Standby mode and RESET pad. The lower byte of this register is written once after POR and shall be written before changing VOS level or ck_sys clock frequency. No limitation applies to the upper bytes.Programming data corresponding to an invalid combination of SDLEVEL, SDEXTHP, SDEN, LDOEN and BYPASS bits (see Table9) will be ignored: data will not be written, the written-once mechanism will lock the register and any further write access will be ignored. The default supply configuration will be kept and the ACTVOSRDY bit in PWR control status register 1 (PWR_CSR1) will go on indicating invalid voltage levels. The system shall be power cycled before writing a new value.

Register.name: PWR_CPUCR
Register.description: This register allows controlling CPU1 power.

BitField.name: STOPF
BitField.description: STOP flag This bit is set by hardware and cleared only by any reset or by setting the CPU1 CSSF bit.

BitField.name: SBF
BitField.description: System Standby flag This bit is set by hardware and cleared only by a POR (Power-on Reset) or by setting the CPU1 CSSF bit

BitField.name: CSSF
BitField.description: Clear D1 domain CPU1 Standby, Stop and HOLD flags (always read as 0) This bit is cleared to 0 by hardware.

Register.name: PWR_SRDCR
Register.description: This register allows controlling D3 domain power.Following reset VOSRDY will be read 1 by software

BitField.name: VOSRDY
BitField.description: VOS Ready bit for VCORE voltage scaling output selection. This bit is set to 1 by hardware when Bypass mode is selected in PWR control register 3 (PWR_CR3).

BitField.name: VOS
BitField.description: Voltage scaling selection according to performance These bits control the VCORE voltage level and allow to obtains the best trade-off between power consumption and performance: When increasing the performance, the voltage scaling shall be changed before increasing the system frequency. When decreasing performance, the system frequency shall first be decreased before changing the voltage scaling.

Register.name: PWR_WKUPCR
Register.description: reset only by system reset, not reset by wakeup from Standby mode5 wait states are required when writing this register (when clearing a WKUPF bit in PWR_WKUPFR, the AHB write access will complete after the WKUPF has been cleared).

BitField.name: WKUPC1
BitField.description: Clear Wakeup pin flag for WKUP. These bits are always read as 0.

BitField.name: WKUPC2
BitField.description: Clear Wakeup pin flag for WKUP. These bits are always read as 0.

BitField.name: WKUPC3
BitField.description: Clear Wakeup pin flag for WKUP. These bits are always read as 0.

BitField.name: WKUPC4
BitField.description: Clear Wakeup pin flag for WKUP. These bits are always read as 0.

BitField.name: WKUPC5
BitField.description: Clear Wakeup pin flag for WKUP. These bits are always read as 0.

BitField.name: WKUPC6
BitField.description: Clear Wakeup pin flag for WKUP. These bits are always read as 0.

Register.name: PWR_WKUPFR
Register.description: reset only by system reset, not reset by wakeup from Standby mode

BitField.name: WKUPF1
BitField.description: Wakeup pin WKUPF flag. This bit is set by hardware and cleared only by a Reset pin or by setting the WKUPCn+1 bit in the PWR wakeup clear register (PWR_WKUPCR).

BitField.name: WKUPF2
BitField.description: Wakeup pin WKUPF flag. This bit is set by hardware and cleared only by a Reset pin or by setting the WKUPCn+1 bit in the PWR wakeup clear register (PWR_WKUPCR).

BitField.name: WKUPF3
BitField.description: Wakeup pin WKUPF flag. This bit is set by hardware and cleared only by a Reset pin or by setting the WKUPCn+1 bit in the PWR wakeup clear register (PWR_WKUPCR).

BitField.name: WKUPF4
BitField.description: Wakeup pin WKUPF flag. This bit is set by hardware and cleared only by a Reset pin or by setting the WKUPCn+1 bit in the PWR wakeup clear register (PWR_WKUPCR).

BitField.name: WKUPF5
BitField.description: Wakeup pin WKUPF flag. This bit is set by hardware and cleared only by a Reset pin or by setting the WKUPCn+1 bit in the PWR wakeup clear register (PWR_WKUPCR).

BitField.name: WKUPF6
BitField.description: Wakeup pin WKUPF flag. This bit is set by hardware and cleared only by a Reset pin or by setting the WKUPCn+1 bit in the PWR wakeup clear register (PWR_WKUPCR).

Register.name: PWR_WKUPEPR
Register.description: Reset only by system reset, not reset by wakeup from Standby mode

BitField.name: WKUPEN1
BitField.description: Enable Wakeup Pin WKUPn+1 Each bit is set and cleared by software. Note: An additional wakeup event is detected if WKUPn+1 pin is enabled (by setting the WKUPENn+1 bit) when WKUPn+1 pin level is already high when WKUPPn+1 selects rising edge, or low when WKUPPn+1 selects falling edge.

BitField.name: WKUPEN2
BitField.description: Enable Wakeup Pin WKUPn+1 Each bit is set and cleared by software. Note: An additional wakeup event is detected if WKUPn+1 pin is enabled (by setting the WKUPENn+1 bit) when WKUPn+1 pin level is already high when WKUPPn+1 selects rising edge, or low when WKUPPn+1 selects falling edge.

BitField.name: WKUPEN3
BitField.description: Enable Wakeup Pin WKUPn+1 Each bit is set and cleared by software. Note: An additional wakeup event is detected if WKUPn+1 pin is enabled (by setting the WKUPENn+1 bit) when WKUPn+1 pin level is already high when WKUPPn+1 selects rising edge, or low when WKUPPn+1 selects falling edge.

BitField.name: WKUPEN4
BitField.description: Enable Wakeup Pin WKUPn+1 Each bit is set and cleared by software. Note: An additional wakeup event is detected if WKUPn+1 pin is enabled (by setting the WKUPENn+1 bit) when WKUPn+1 pin level is already high when WKUPPn+1 selects rising edge, or low when WKUPPn+1 selects falling edge.

BitField.name: WKUPEN5
BitField.description: Enable Wakeup Pin WKUPn+1 Each bit is set and cleared by software. Note: An additional wakeup event is detected if WKUPn+1 pin is enabled (by setting the WKUPENn+1 bit) when WKUPn+1 pin level is already high when WKUPPn+1 selects rising edge, or low when WKUPPn+1 selects falling edge.

BitField.name: WKUPEN6
BitField.description: Enable Wakeup Pin WKUPn+1 Each bit is set and cleared by software. Note: An additional wakeup event is detected if WKUPn+1 pin is enabled (by setting the WKUPENn+1 bit) when WKUPn+1 pin level is already high when WKUPPn+1 selects rising edge, or low when WKUPPn+1 selects falling edge.

BitField.name: WKUPP1
BitField.description: Wakeup pin polarity bit for WKUPn-7 These bits define the polarity used for event detection on WKUPn-7 external wakeup pin.

BitField.name: WKUPP2
BitField.description: Wakeup pin polarity bit for WKUPn-7 These bits define the polarity used for event detection on WKUPn-7 external wakeup pin.

BitField.name: WKUPP3
BitField.description: Wakeup pin polarity bit for WKUPn-7 These bits define the polarity used for event detection on WKUPn-7 external wakeup pin.

BitField.name: WKUPP4
BitField.description: Wakeup pin polarity bit for WKUPn-7 These bits define the polarity used for event detection on WKUPn-7 external wakeup pin.

BitField.name: WKUPP5
BitField.description: Wakeup pin polarity bit for WKUPn-7 These bits define the polarity used for event detection on WKUPn-7 external wakeup pin.

BitField.name: WKUPP6
BitField.description: Wakeup pin polarity bit for WKUPn-7 These bits define the polarity used for event detection on WKUPn-7 external wakeup pin.

BitField.name: WKUPPUPD6
BitField.description: Wakeup pin pull configuration for WKUP(truncate(n/2)-7) These bits define the I/O pad pull configuration used when WKUPEN(truncate(n/2)-7) = 1. The associated GPIO port pull configuration shall be set to the same value or to 00. The Wakeup pin pull configuration is kept in Standby mode.
