BitField.name: HSION
BitField.description: HSI clock enable Set and cleared by software. Set by hardware to force the HSI to ON when the product leaves Stop mode, if STOPWUCK = 0 or STOPKERWUCK = 0. Set by hardware to force the HSI to ON when the product leaves Standby mode or in case of a failure of the HSE which is used as the system clock source. This bit cannot be cleared if the HSI is used directly (via SW mux) as system clock, or if the HSI is selected as reference clock for PLL1 with PLL1 enabled (PLL1ON bit set to 1).

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: HSI is OFF

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: HSI is ON (default after reset)

BitField.name: HSIKERON
BitField.description: HSI clock enable in Stop mode Set and reset by software to force the HSI to ON, even in Stop mode, in order to be quickly available as kernel clock for peripherals. This bit has no effect on the value of HSION.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: no effect on HSI (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: HSI is forced to ON even in Stop mode

BitField.name: HSIRDY
BitField.description: HSI clock ready flag Set by hardware to indicate that the HSI oscillator is stable.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: HSI clock is not ready (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: HSI clock is ready

BitField.name: HSIDIV
BitField.description: HSI clock divider Set and reset by software. These bits allow selecting a division ratio in order to configure the wanted HSI clock frequency. The HSIDIV cannot be changed if the HSI is selected as reference clock for at least one enabled PLL (PLLxON bit set to 1). In that case, the new HSIDIV value is ignored.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: division by 1, hsi(_ker)_ck = 64 MHz (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: division by 2, hsi(_ker)_ck = 32 MHz

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: division by 4, hsi(_ker)_ck = 16 MHz

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: division by 8, hsi(_ker)_ck = 8 MHz

BitField.name: HSIDIVF
BitField.description: HSI divider flag Set and reset by hardware. As a write operation to HSIDIV has not an immediate effect on the frequency, this flag indicates the current status of the HSI divider. HSIDIVF goes immediately to 0 when HSIDIV value is changed, and is set back to 1 when the output frequency matches the value programmed into HSIDIV. clock setting is completed)

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: new division ratio not yet propagated to hsi(_ker)_ck (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: hsi(_ker)_ck clock frequency reflects the new HSIDIV value (default register value when the

BitField.name: CSION
BitField.description: CSI clock enable Set and reset by software to enable/disable CSI clock for system and/or peripheral. Set by hardware to force the CSI to ON when the system leaves Stop mode, if STOPWUCK = 1 or STOPKERWUCK = 1. This bit cannot be cleared if the CSI is used directly (via SW mux) as system clock, or if the CSI is selected as reference clock for PLL1 with PLL1 enabled (PLL1ON bit set to 1).

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: CSI is OFF (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: CSI is ON

BitField.name: CSIRDY
BitField.description: CSI clock ready flag Set by hardware to indicate that the CSI oscillator is stable. This bit is activated only if the RC is enabled by CSION (it is not activated if the CSI is enabled by CSIKERON or by a peripheral request).

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: CSI clock is not ready (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: CSI clock is ready

BitField.name: CSIKERON
BitField.description: CSI clock enable in Stop mode Set and reset by software to force the CSI to ON, even in Stop mode, in order to be quickly available as kernel clock for some peripherals. This bit has no effect on the value of CSION.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: no effect on CSI (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: CSI is forced to ON even in Stop mode

BitField.name: HSI48ON
BitField.description: HSI48 clock enable Set by software and cleared by software or by the hardware when the system enters to Stop or Standby mode.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: HSI48 is OFF (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: HSI48 is ON

BitField.name: HSI48RDY
BitField.description: HSI48 clock ready flag Set by hardware to indicate that the HSI48 oscillator is stable.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: HSI48 clock is not ready (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: HSI48 clock is ready

BitField.name: CPUCKRDY
BitField.description: CPU related clocks ready flag Set by hardware to indicate that the CPU related clocks (CPU, APB3, AXI bus matrix and related memories) are available.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: CPU related clocks are not available (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: CPU related clocks are available

BitField.name: CDCKRDY
BitField.description: CPU domain clocks ready flag Set by hardware to indicate that the following CPU domain clocks are available: APB1, APB2, AHB bus matrix.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: CPU domain clocks are not available (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: CPU domain clocks are available

BitField.name: HSEON
BitField.description: HSE clock enable Set and cleared by software. Cleared by hardware to stop the HSE when entering Stop or Standby mode. This bit cannot be cleared if the HSE is used directly (via SW mux) as system clock, or if the HSE is selected as reference clock for PLL1 with PLL1 enabled (PLL1ON bit set to 1).

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: HSE is OFF (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: HSE is ON

BitField.name: HSERDY
BitField.description: HSE clock ready flag Set by hardware to indicate that the HSE oscillator is stable.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: HSE clock is not ready (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: HSE clock is ready

BitField.name: HSEBYP
BitField.description: HSE clock bypass Set and cleared by software to bypass the oscillator with an external clock. The external clock must be enabled with the HSEON bit to be used by the device. The HSEBYP bit can be written only if the HSE oscillator is disabled.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: HSE oscillator not bypassed (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: HSE oscillator bypassed with an external clock

BitField.name: HSECSSON
BitField.description: HSE clock security system enable Set by software to enable clock security system on HSE. This bit is Ã¢Â€Âœset onlyÃ¢Â€Â (disabled by a system reset or when the system enters in Standby mode). When HSECSSON is set, the clock detector is enabled by hardware when the HSE is ready and disabled by hardware if an oscillator failure is detected.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: CSS on HSE OFF (clock detector OFF) (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: CSS on HSE ON (clock detector ON if the HSE oscillator is stable, OFF if not).

BitField.name: HSEEXT
BitField.description: external high speed clock type in Bypass mode Set and reset by software to select the external clock type (analog or digital). The external clock must be enabled with the HSEON bit to be used by the device. The HSEEXT bit can be written only if the HSE oscillator is disabled.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: HSE in analog mode (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: HSE in digital mode

BitField.name: PLL1ON
BitField.description: PLL1 enable Set and cleared by software to enable PLL1. Cleared by hardware when entering Stop or Standby mode. Note that the hardware prevents writing this bit to 0, if the PLL1 output is used as the system clock.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: PLL1 OFF (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: PLL1 ON

BitField.name: PLL1RDY
BitField.description: PLL1 clock ready flag Set by hardware to indicate that the PLL1 is locked.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: PLL1 unlocked (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: PLL1 locked

BitField.name: PLL2ON
BitField.description: PLL2 enable Set and cleared by software to enable PLL2. Cleared by hardware when entering Stop or Standby mode.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: PLL2 OFF (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: PLL2 ON

BitField.name: PLL2RDY
BitField.description: PLL2 clock ready flag Set by hardware to indicate that the PLL2 is locked.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: PLL2 unlocked (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: PLL2 locked

BitField.name: PLL3ON
BitField.description: PLL3 enable Set and cleared by software to enable PLL3. Cleared by hardware when entering Stop or Standby mode.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: PLL3 OFF (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: PLL3 ON

BitField.name: PLL3RDY
BitField.description: PLL3 clock ready flag Set by hardware to indicate that the PLL3 is locked.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: PLL3 unlocked (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: PLL3 locked

BitField.name: HSICAL
BitField.description: HSI clock calibration Set by hardware by option byte loading during system reset nreset. Adjusted by software through trimming bits HSITRIM. This field represents the sum of engineering option byte calibration value and HSITRIM bits value.

BitField.name: HSITRIM
BitField.description: HSI clock trimming Set by software to adjust calibration. HSITRIM field is added to the engineering option bytes loaded during reset phase (FLASH_HSI_opt) in order to form the calibration trimming value. HSICALÃ‚Â =Ã‚Â HSITRIMÃ‚Â +Ã‚Â FLASH_HSI_opt. Note: The reset value of the field is 0x40.

BitField.name: HSI48CAL
BitField.description: Internal RC 48 MHz clock calibration Set by hardware by option byte loading during system reset nreset. Read-only.

BitField.name: CSICAL
BitField.description: CSI clock calibration Set by hardware by option byte loading during system reset nreset. Adjusted by software through trimming bits CSITRIM. This field represents the sum of engineering option byte calibration value and CSITRIM bits value.

BitField.name: CSITRIM
BitField.description: CSI clock trimming Set by software to adjust calibration. CSITRIM field is added to the engineering option bytes loaded during reset phase (FLASH_CSI_opt) in order to form the calibration trimming value. CSICALÃ‚Â =Ã‚Â CSITRIMÃ‚Â +Ã‚Â FLASH_CSI_opt. Note: The reset value of the field is 0x20.

BitField.name: SW
BitField.description: system clock and trace clock switch Set and reset by software to select system clock and trace clock sources (sys_ck and traceclk). Set by hardware in order to: force the selection of the HSI or CSI (depending on STOPWUCK selection) when leaving a system Stop mode force the selection of the HSI in case of failure of the HSE when used directly or indirectly as system clock others: reserved

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: HSI selected as system clock (hsi_ck) (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: CSI selected as system clock (csi_ck)

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: HSE selected as system clock (hse_ck)

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: PLL1 selected as system clock (pll1_p_ck for sys_ck, pll1_r_ck for traceclk)

BitField.name: SWS
BitField.description: system clock switch status Set and reset by hardware to indicate which clock source is used as system clock. others: reserved

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: HSI used as system clock (hsi_ck) (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: CSI used as system clock (csi_ck)

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: HSE used as system clock (hse_ck)

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: PLL1 used as system clock (pll1_p_ck)

BitField.name: STOPWUCK
BitField.description: system clock selection after a wake up from system Stop Set and reset by software to select the system wakeup clock from system Stop. The selected clock is also used as emergency clock for the clock security system (CSS) on HSE. See for details. STOPWUCK must not be modified when CSS is enabled (by HSECSSON bit) and the system clock is HSE (SWSÃ‚Â =Ã‚Â 10) or a switch on HSE is requested (SWÃ‚Â =10).

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: HSI selected as wake up clock from system Stop (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: CSI selected as wake up clock from system Stop

BitField.name: STOPKERWUCK
BitField.description: kernel clock selection after a wake up from system Stop Set and reset by software to select the kernel wakeup clock from system Stop. See for details.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: HSI selected as wake up clock from system Stop (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: CSI selected as wake up clock from system Stop

BitField.name: RTCPRE
BitField.description: HSE division factor for RTC clock Set and cleared by software to divide the HSE to generate a clock for RTC. Caution: The software must set these bits correctly to ensure that the clock supplied to the RTC is lower than 1Ã‚Â MHz. These bits must be configured if needed before selecting the RTC clock source. ...

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: no clock (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: no clock

BitField.name: TIMPRE
BitField.description: timers clocks prescaler selection This bit is set and reset by software to control the clock frequency of all the timers connected to APB1 and APB2 domains. Refer to for more details.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The timers kernel clock is equal to rcc_hclk1 if CDPPRE1 or CDPPRE2 corresponds to a division by 1 or 2, else it is equal to 2 x Frcc_pclk1 or 2 x Frcc_pclk2 (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The timers kernel clock is equal to 2 x Frcc_pclk1 or 2 x Frcc_pclk2 if CDPPRE1 or CDPPRE2 corresponds to a division by 1, 2or 4, else it is equal to 4 x Frcc_pclk1 or 4 x Frcc_pclk2.

BitField.name: MCO1PRE
BitField.description: MCO1 prescaler Set and cleared by software to configure the prescaler of the MCO1. Modification of this prescaler may generate glitches on MCO1. It is highly recommended to change this prescaler only after reset, before enabling the external oscillators and the PLLs. ...

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: prescaler disabled (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: division by 1 (bypass)

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: division by 2

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: division by 3

Enum.name: B_0x4
Enum.description: division by 4

Enum.name: B_0xF
Enum.description: division by 15

BitField.name: MCO1SEL
BitField.description: Microcontroller clock output 1 Set and cleared by software. Clock source selection may generate glitches on MCO1. It is highly recommended to configure these bits only after reset, before enabling the external oscillators and the PLLs. others: reserved

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: HSI clock selected (hsi_ck) (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: LSE oscillator clock selected (lse_ck)

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: HSE clock selected (hse_ck)

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: PLL1 clock selected (pll1_q_ck)

Enum.name: B_0x4
Enum.description: HSI48 clock selected (hsi48_ck)

BitField.name: MCO2PRE
BitField.description: MCO2 prescaler Set and cleared by software to configure the prescaler of the MCO2. Modification of this prescaler may generate glitches on MCO2. It is highly recommended to change this prescaler only after reset, before enabling the external oscillators and the PLLs. ...

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: prescaler disabled (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: division by 1 (bypass)

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: division by 2

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: division by 3

Enum.name: B_0x4
Enum.description: division by 4

Enum.name: B_0xF
Enum.description: division by 15

BitField.name: MCO2SEL
BitField.description: microcontroller clock output 2 Set and cleared by software. Clock source selection may generate glitches on MCO2. It is highly recommended to configure these bits only after reset, before enabling the external oscillators and the PLLs. others: reserved

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: system clock selected (sys_ck) (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: PLL2 oscillator clock selected (pll2_p_ck)

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: HSE clock selected (hse_ck)

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: PLL1 clock selected (pll1_p_ck)

Enum.name: B_0x4
Enum.description: CSI clock selected (csi_ck)

Enum.name: B_0x5
Enum.description: LSI clock selected (lsi_ck)

BitField.name: HPRE
BitField.description: CPU domain AHB prescaler Set and reset by software to control the division factor of rcc_hclk3 and rcc_aclk. Changing this division ratio has an impact on the frequency of all bus matrix clocks. 0xxx: rcc_hclk3 = sys_cdcpre_ck (default after reset) Note: The clocks are divided by the new prescaler factor from1 to 16 periods of the slowest APB clock among rcc_pclk[4:1] after HPRE update. Note: Note also that rcc_hclk3 = rcc_aclk.

Enum.name: B_0x8
Enum.description: rcc_hclk3 = sys_cdcpre_ck / 2

Enum.name: B_0x9
Enum.description: rcc_hclk3 = sys_cdcpre_ck / 4

Enum.name: B_0xA
Enum.description: rcc_hclk3 = sys_cdcpre_ck / 8

Enum.name: B_0xB
Enum.description: rcc_hclk3 = sys_cdcpre_ck / 16

Enum.name: B_0xC
Enum.description: rcc_hclk3 = sys_cdcpre_ck / 64

Enum.name: B_0xD
Enum.description: rcc_hclk3 = sys_cdcpre_ck / 128

Enum.name: B_0xE
Enum.description: rcc_hclk3 = sys_cdcpre_ck / 256

Enum.name: B_0xF
Enum.description: rcc_hclk3 = sys_cdcpre_ck / 512

BitField.name: CDPPRE
BitField.description: CPU domain APB3 prescaler Set and reset by software to control the division factor of rcc_pclk3. The clock is divided by the new prescaler factor from 1 to 16 cycles of rcc_hclk3 after CDPPRE write. 0xx: rcc_pclk3 = rcc_hclk3 (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x4
Enum.description: rcc_pclk3 = rcc_hclk3 / 2

Enum.name: B_0x5
Enum.description: rcc_pclk3 = rcc_hclk3 / 4

Enum.name: B_0x6
Enum.description: rcc_pclk3 = rcc_hclk3 / 8

Enum.name: B_0x7
Enum.description: rcc_pclk3 = rcc_hclk3 / 16

BitField.name: CDCPRE
BitField.description: CPU domain core prescaler Set and reset by software to control the CPU domain CPU clock division factor. Changing this division ratio has an impact on the frequency of the CPU clock and all bus matrix clocks. After changing this prescaler value, it takes up to 16 periods of the slowest APB clock before the new division ratio is taken into account. The application can check if the new division factor is taken into account by reading back this register. 0xxx: sys_ck not divided (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x8
Enum.description: sys_ck divided by 2

Enum.name: B_0x9
Enum.description: sys_ck divided by 4

Enum.name: B_0xA
Enum.description: sys_ck divided by 8

Enum.name: B_0xB
Enum.description: sys_ck divided by 16

Enum.name: B_0xC
Enum.description: sys_ck divided by 64

Enum.name: B_0xD
Enum.description: sys_ck divided by 128

Enum.name: B_0xE
Enum.description: sys_ck divided by 256

Enum.name: B_0xF
Enum.description: sys_ck divided by 512

BitField.name: CDPPRE1
BitField.description: CPU domain APB1 prescaler Set and reset by software to control the CPU domain APB1 clock division factor. The clock is divided by the new prescaler factor from 1 to 16 cycles of rcc_hclk1 after CDPPRE1 write. 0xx: rcc_pclk1 = rcc_hclk1 (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x4
Enum.description: rcc_pclk1 = rcc_hclk1 / 2

Enum.name: B_0x5
Enum.description: rcc_pclk1 = rcc_hclk1 / 4

Enum.name: B_0x6
Enum.description: rcc_pclk1 = rcc_hclk1 / 8

Enum.name: B_0x7
Enum.description: rcc_pclk1 = rcc_hclk1 / 16

BitField.name: CDPPRE2
BitField.description: CPU domain APB2 prescaler Set and reset by software to control the CPU domain APB2 clock division factor. The clock is divided by the new prescaler factor from 1 to 16 cycles of rcc_hclk1 after CDPPRE2 write. 0xx: rcc_pclk2 = rcc_hclk1 (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x4
Enum.description: rcc_pclk2 = rcc_hclk1 / 2

Enum.name: B_0x5
Enum.description: rcc_pclk2 = rcc_hclk1 / 4

Enum.name: B_0x6
Enum.description: rcc_pclk2 = rcc_hclk1 / 8

Enum.name: B_0x7
Enum.description: rcc_pclk2 = rcc_hclk1 / 16

BitField.name: SRDPPRE
BitField.description: SmartRun domain APB4 prescaler Set and reset by software to control the SmartRun domain APB4 clock division factor. The clock is divided by the new prescaler factor from 1 to 16 cycles of rcc_hclk4 after SRDPPRE write. 0xx: rcc_pclk4 = rcc_hclk4 (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x4
Enum.description: rcc_pclk4 = rcc_hclk4 / 2

Enum.name: B_0x5
Enum.description: rcc_pclk4 = rcc_hclk4 / 4

Enum.name: B_0x6
Enum.description: rcc_pclk4 = rcc_hclk4 / 8

Enum.name: B_0x7
Enum.description: rcc_pclk4 = rcc_hclk4 / 16

BitField.name: PLLSRC
BitField.description: DIVMx and PLLs clock source selection Set and reset by software to select the PLL clock source. These bits can be written only when all PLLs are disabled. In order to save power, when no PLL is used, the value of PLLSRC must be set to '11Ã¢Â€Â™.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: HSI selected as PLL clock (hsi_ck) (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: CSI selected as PLL clock (csi_ck)

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: HSE selected as PLL clock (hse_ck)

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: no clock send to DIVMx divider and PLLs

BitField.name: DIVM1
BitField.description: prescaler for PLL1 Set and cleared by software to configure the prescaler of the PLL1. The hardware does not allow any modification of this prescaler when PLL1 is enabled (PLL1ONÃ‚Â =Ã‚Â 1). In order to save power when PLL1 is not used, the value of DIVM1 must be set to 0. ... ...

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: prescaler disabled

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: division by 1 (bypass)

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: division by 2

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: division by 3

Enum.name: B_0x20
Enum.description: division by 32 (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x3F
Enum.description: division by 63

BitField.name: DIVM2
BitField.description: prescaler for PLL2 Set and cleared by software to configure the prescaler of the PLL2. The hardware does not allow any modification of this prescaler when PLL2 is enabled (PLL2ONÃ‚Â =Ã‚Â 1). In order to save power when PLL2 is not used, the value of DIVM2 must be set to 0. ... ...

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: prescaler disabled

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: division by 1 (bypass)

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: division by 2

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: division by 3

Enum.name: B_0x20
Enum.description: division by 32 (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x3F
Enum.description: division by 63

BitField.name: DIVM3
BitField.description: prescaler for PLL3 Set and cleared by software to configure the prescaler of the PLL3. The hardware does not allow any modification of this prescaler when PLL3 is enabled (PLL3ONÃ‚Â =Ã‚Â 1). In order to save power when PLL3 is not used, the value of DIVM3 must be set to 0. ... ...

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: prescaler disabled (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: division by 1 (bypass)

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: division by 2

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: division by 3

Enum.name: B_0x20
Enum.description: division by 32 (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x3F
Enum.description: division by 63

BitField.name: PLL1FRACEN
BitField.description: PLL1 fractional latch enable Set and reset by software to latch the content of FRACN1 into the sigma-delta modulator. In order to latch the FRACN1 value into the sigma-delta modulator, PLL1FRACEN must be set to 0, then set to 1. The transition 0 to 1 transfers the content of FRACN1 into the modulator. Refer to for additional information.

BitField.name: PLL1VCOSEL
BitField.description: PLL1 VCO selection Set and reset by software to select the proper VCO frequency range used for PLL1. These bits must be written before enabling the PLL1.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: wide VCO range from 128 to 560 MHz (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: medium VCO range from 150 to 420 MHz

BitField.name: PLL1RGE
BitField.description: PLL1 input frequency range Set and reset by software to select the proper reference frequency range used for PLL1. This bit must be written before enabling the PLL1.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: PLL1 input (ref1_ck) clock range frequency between 1 and 2 MHz (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: PLL1 input (ref1_ck) clock range frequency between 2 and 4 MHz

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: PLL1 input (ref1_ck) clock range frequency between 4 and 8 MHz

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: PLL1 input (ref1_ck) clock range frequency between 8 and 16 MHz

BitField.name: PLL2FRACEN
BitField.description: PLL2 fractional latch enable Set and reset by software to latch the content of FRACN2 into the sigma-delta modulator. In order to latch the FRACN2 value into the sigma-delta modulator, PLL2FRACEN must be set to 0, then set to 1. The transition 0 to 1 transfers the content of FRACN2 into the modulator. Refer to for additional information.

BitField.name: PLL2VCOSEL
BitField.description: PLL2 VCO selection Set and reset by software to select the proper VCO frequency range used for PLL2. This bit must be written before enabling the PLL2.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: wide VCO range 128 to 560 MHz (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: medium VCO range 150 to 420 MHz

BitField.name: PLL2RGE
BitField.description: PLL2 input frequency range Set and reset by software to select the proper reference frequency range used for PLL2. These bits must be written before enabling the PLL2.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: PLL2 input (ref2_ck) clock range frequency between 1 and 2 MHz (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: PLL2 input (ref2_ck) clock range frequency between 2 and 4 MHz

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: PLL2 input (ref2_ck) clock range frequency between 4 and 8 MHz

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: PLL2 input (ref2_ck) clock range frequency between 8 and 16 MHz

BitField.name: PLL3FRACEN
BitField.description: PLL3 fractional latch enable Set and reset by software to latch the content of FRACN3 into the sigma-delta modulator. In order to latch the FRACN3 value into the sigma-delta modulator, PLL3FRACEN must be set to 0, then set to 1. The transition 0 to 1 transfers the content of FRACN3 into the modulator. Refer to for additional information.

BitField.name: PLL3VCOSEL
BitField.description: PLL3 VCO selection Set and reset by software to select the proper VCO frequency range used for PLL3. This bit must be written before enabling the PLL3.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: wide VCO range 128 to 560 MHz (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: medium VCO range 150 to 420 MHz

BitField.name: PLL3RGE
BitField.description: PLL3 input frequency range Set and reset by software to select the proper reference frequency range used for PLL3. These bits must be written before enabling the PLL3.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: PLL3 input (ref3_ck) clock range frequency between 1 and 2 MHz (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: PLL3 input (ref3_ck) clock range frequency between 2 and 4 MHz

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: PLL3 input (ref3_ck) clock range frequency between 4 and 8 MHz

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: PLL3 input (ref3_ck) clock range frequency between 8 and 16 MHz

BitField.name: DIVP1EN
BitField.description: PLL1 DIVP divider output enable Set and reset by software to enable the pll1_p_ck output of the PLL1. This bit can be written only when the PLL1 is disabled (PLL1ON = 0 and PLL1RDY = 0). In order to save power, when the pll1_p_ck output of the PLL1 is not used, the pll1_p_ck must be disabled.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: pll1_p_ck output disabled

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: pll1_p_ck output enabled (default after reset)

BitField.name: DIVQ1EN
BitField.description: PLL1 DIVQ divider output enable Set and reset by software to enable the pll1_q_ck output of the PLL1. In order to save power, when the pll1_q_ck output of the PLL1 is not used, the pll1_q_ck must be disabled. This bit can be written only when the PLL1 is disabled (PLL1ON = 0 and PLL1RDY = 0).

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: pll1_q_ck output disabled

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: pll1_q_ck output enabled (default after reset)

BitField.name: DIVR1EN
BitField.description: PLL1 DIVR divider output enable Set and reset by software to enable the pll1_r_ck output of the PLL1. To save power, DIVR3EN and DIVR3 bits must be set to 0 when the pll3_r_ck is not used. This bit can be written only when the PLL1 is disabled (PLL1ON = 0 and PLL1RDY = 0).

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: pll1_r_ck output disabled

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: pll1_r_ck output enabled (default after reset)

BitField.name: DIVP2EN
BitField.description: PLL2 DIVP divider output enable Set and reset by software to enable the pll2_p_ck output of the PLL2. This bit can be written only when the PLL2 is disabled (PLL2ON = 0 and PLL2RDY = 0). To save power, DIVR3EN and DIVR3 bits must be set to 0 when the pll3_r_ck is not used.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: pll2_p_ck output disabled

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: pll2_p_ck output enabled (default after reset)

BitField.name: DIVQ2EN
BitField.description: PLL2 DIVQ divider output enable Set and reset by software to enable the pll2_q_ck output of the PLL2. To save power, DIVR3EN and DIVR3 bits must be set to 0 when the pll3_r_ck is not used. This bit can be written only when the PLL2 is disabled (PLL2ON = 0 and PLL2RDY = 0).

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: pll2_q_ck output disabled

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: pll2_q_ck output enabled (default after reset)

BitField.name: DIVR2EN

Enum.name: B_0x0

Enum.name: B_0x1

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: pll3_p_ck output disabled

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: pll3_p_ck output enabled (default after reset)

BitField.name: DIVQ3EN
BitField.description: PLL3 DIVQ divider output enable Set and reset by software to enable the pll3_q_ck output of the PLL3. To save power, DIVR3EN and DIVR3 bits must be set to 0 when the pll3_r_ck is not used. This bit can be written only when the PLL3 is disabled (PLL3ON = 0 and PLL3RDY = 0).

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: pll3_q_ck output disabled

Enum.name: B_0x1

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: pll3_r_ck output disabled

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: pll3_r_ck output enabled (default after reset)

BitField.name: DIVN1
BitField.description: multiplication factor for PLL1 VCO Set and reset by software to control the multiplication factor of the VCO. These bits can be written only when the PLL is disabled (PLL1ON = PLL1RDY = 0). ..........: not used ... ... Others: wrong configurations The software must set correctly these bits to insure that the VCO output frequency is between its valid frequency range, that is: 128 to 560Ã‚Â MHz if PLL1VCOSEL = 0 150 to 420Ã‚Â MHz if PLL1VCOSEL = 1 VCO output frequency = Fref1_ck x DIVN1, when fractional value 0 has been loaded into FRACN1, with: DIVN1 between 8 and 420 The input frequency Fref1_ck must be between 1 and 16Ã‚Â MHz.

Enum.name: B_0x6
Enum.description: wrong configuration

Enum.name: B_0x7
Enum.description: DIVN1 = 8

Enum.name: B_0x80
Enum.description: DIVN1 = 129 (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1A3
Enum.description: DIVN1 = 420

BitField.name: DIVP1
BitField.description: PLL1 DIVP division factor Set and reset by software to control the frequency of the pll1_p_ck clock. These bits can be written only when the PLL1 is disabled (PLL1ON = 0 and PLL1RDY = 0). Note that odd division factors are not allowed. ...

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: not allowed

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: pll1_p_ck = vco1_ck / 2 (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: not allowed

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: pll1_p_ck = vco1_ck / 4

Enum.name: B_0x7F
Enum.description: pll1_p_ck = vco1_ck / 128

BitField.name: DIVQ1
BitField.description: PLL1 DIVQ division factor Set and reset by software to control the frequency of the pll1_q_ck clock. These bits can be written only when the PLL1 is disabled (PLL1ON = 0 and PLL1RDY = 0). ...

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: pll1_q_ck = vco1_ck

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: pll1_q_ck = vco1_ck / 2 (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: pll1_q_ck = vco1_ck / 3

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: pll1_q_ck = vco1_ck / 4

Enum.name: B_0x7F
Enum.description: pll1_q_ck = vco1_ck / 128

BitField.name: DIVR1
BitField.description: PLL1 DIVR division factor Set and reset by software to control the frequency of the pll1_r_ck clock. These bits can be written only when the PLL1 is disabled (PLL1ON = 0 and PLL1RDY = 0). ...

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: pll1_r_ck = vco1_ck

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: pll1_r_ck = vco1_ck / 2 (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: pll1_r_ck = vco1_ck / 3

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: pll1_r_ck = vco1_ck / 4

Enum.name: B_0x7F
Enum.description: pll1_r_ck = vco1_ck / 128

BitField.name: FRACN1
BitField.description: fractional part of the multiplication factor for PLL1 VCO Set and reset by software to control the fractional part of the multiplication factor of the VCO. These bits can be written at any time, allowing dynamic fine-tuning of the PLL1 VCO. The software must set correctly these bits to insure that the VCO output frequency is between its valid frequency range, that is: 128 to 560Ã‚Â MHz if PLL1VCOSEL = 0 150 to 420Ã‚Â MHz if PLL1VCOSEL = 1 VCO output frequency = Fref1_ck x (DIVN1 + (FRACN1 / 213)), with DIVN1 between 8 and 420 FRACN1 can be between 0 and 213- 1 The input frequency Fref1_ck must be between 1 and 16 MHz. To change the FRACN value on-the-fly even if the PLL is enabled, the application must proceed as follows: Set the bit PLL1FRACEN to 0. Write the new fractional value into FRACN1. Set the bit PLL1FRACEN to 1.

BitField.name: DIVN2
BitField.description: multiplication factor for PLL2 VCO Set and reset by software to control the multiplication factor of the VCO. These bits can be written only when the PLL is disabled (PLL2ON = PLL2RDY = 0). ..........: not used ... ... Others: wrong configurations The software must set correctly these bits to insure that the VCO output frequency is between its valid frequency range, that is: 128 to 560Ã‚Â MHz if PLL2VCOSEL = 0 150 to 420Ã‚Â MHz if PLL2VCOSEL = 1 VCO output frequency = Fref2_ck x DIVN2, when fractional value 0 has been loaded into FRACN2, with DIVN2 between 8 and 420 The input frequency Fref2_ck must be between 1 and 16MHz.

Enum.name: B_0x7
Enum.description: DIVN2 = 8

Enum.name: B_0x80
Enum.description: DIVN2 = 129 (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1A3
Enum.description: DIVN2 = 420

Register.name: RCC_CDCCIP1R
Register.description: RCC CPU domain kernel clock configuration register

BitField.name: SAI1SEL
BitField.description: SAI1 and DFSDM1 kernel Aclk clock source selection Set and reset by software. If the selected clock is the external clock and this clock is stopped, it isnot be possible to switch to another clock. Refer to for additional information. Note: DFSDM1 clock source selection is done by DFSDM1SEL. others: reserved, the kernel clock is disabled Note: I2S_CKIN is an external clock taken from a pin.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: pll1_q_ck selected as SAI1 and DFSDM1 Aclk kernel clock (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: pll2_p_ck selected as SAI1 and DFSDM1 Aclk kernel clock

Enum.description: pll3_p_ck selected as SAI1 and DFSDM1 Aclk kernel clock

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: I2S_CKIN selected as SAI1 and DFSDM1 Aclk kernel clock

Enum.name: B_0x4
Enum.description: per_ck selected as SAI1 and DFSDM1 Aclk kernel clock

BitField.name: SAI2ASEL
BitField.description: SAI2 kernel clock source A selection Set and reset by software. If the selected clock is the external clock and this clock is stopped, it is not be possible to switch to another clock. Refer to for additional information. others: reserved, the kernel clock is disabled Note: I2S_CKIN is an external clock taken from a pin. spdifrx_symb_ck is the symbol clock generated by the SPDIFRX (see ).

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: clock ready interrupt caused by the LSI

BitField.name: LSEON
BitField.description: LSE oscillator enabled Set and reset by software.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: LSE oscillator OFF (default after Backup domain reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: LSE oscillator ON

BitField.name: LSERDY
BitField.description: LSE oscillator ready Set and reset by hardware to indicate when the LSE is stable. This bit needs 6 cycles of lse_ck clock to fall down after LSEON has been set to 0.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: LSE oscillator not ready (default after Backup domain reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: LSE oscillator ready

BitField.name: LSEBYP
BitField.description: LSE oscillator bypass Set and reset by software to bypass oscillator in debug mode. This bit must not be written when the LSE is enabled (by LSEON) or ready (LSERDY = 1)

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: LSE oscillator not bypassed (default after Backup domain reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: LSE oscillator bypassed

BitField.name: LSEDRV
BitField.description: LSE oscillator driving capability Set by software to select the driving capability of the LSE oscillator.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: lowest drive (default after Backup domain reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: medium-low drive

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: medium-high drive

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: highest drive

BitField.name: LSECSSON
BitField.description: LSE clock security system enable Set by software to enable the clock security system on 32 kHz oscillator. LSECSSON must be enabled after LSE is enabled (LSEON enabled) and ready (LSERDY set by hardware) and after RTCSEL is selected. Once enabled, this bit cannot be disabled, except after a LSE failure detection (LSECSSD = 1). In that case the software must disable LSECSSON.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: CSS on 32 kHz oscillator OFF (default after Backup domain reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: CSS on 32 kHz oscillator ON

BitField.name: LSECSSD
BitField.description: LSE clock security system failure detection Set by hardware to indicate when a failure has been detected by the clock security system on the external 32 kHz oscillator.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: no failure detected on 32 kHz oscillator (default after Backup domain reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: failure detected on 32 kHz oscillator

BitField.name: LSEEXT
BitField.description: low-speed external clock type in Bypass mode Set and reset by software to select the external clock type (analog or digital). The external clock must be enabled with the LSEON bit, to be used by the device. The LSEEXT bit can be written only if the LSE oscillator is disabled.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: LSE in analog mode (default after Backup domain reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: LSE in digital mode (do not use if RTC is active).

BitField.name: RTCSEL
BitField.description: RTC clock source selection Set by software to select the clock source for the RTC. These bits can be written only one time (except in case of failure detection on LSE). These bits must be written before LSECSSON is enabled. The VSWRST bit can be used to reset them, then it can be written one time again. If HSE is selected as RTC clock, this clock is lost when the system is in Stop mode or in case of a pin reset (NRST).

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: no clock (default after Backup domain reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: LSE selected as RTC clock

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: LSI selected as RTC clock

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: HSE divided by RTCPRE value selected as RTC clock

BitField.name: RTCEN
BitField.description: RTC clock enable Set and reset by software.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: rtc_ck disabled (default after Backup domain reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: rtc_ck enabled

BitField.name: VSWRST
BitField.description: VSwitch domain software reset Set and reset by software.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: reset not activated (default after Backup domain reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: resets the entire VSW domain

Register.name: RCC_CSR
Register.description: RCC clock control and status register

BitField.name: LSION
BitField.description: LSI oscillator enable Set and reset by software.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: LSI is OFF (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: LSI is ON

BitField.name: LSIRDY
BitField.description: LSI oscillator ready Set and reset by hardware to indicate when the low-speed internal RC oscillator is stable. This bit needs 3 cycles of lsi_ck clock to fall down after LSION has been set to 0. This bit can be set even when LSION is not enabled if there is a request for LSI clock by the clock security system on LSE or by the low-speed watchdog or by the RTC.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: LSI clock is not ready (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: LSI clock is ready

Register.name: RCC_SRDAMR
Register.description: RCC SmartRun domain Autonomous mode register

BitField.name: BDMA2AMEN
BitField.description: SmartRun domain DMA and DMAMUX Autonomous mode enable Set and reset by software. Refer to for additional information.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: BDMA2 and DMAMUX2 peripheral clocks disabled when the CPU is in CStop (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: BDMA2 and DMAMUX2 peripheral clocks enabled when the SmartRun domain is in Run.

BitField.name: GPIOAMEN
BitField.description: GPIO Autonomous mode enable Set and reset by software. Refer to for additional information.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: GPIO peripheral clocks disabled when the CPU is in CStop (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: GPIO peripheral clocks enabled when the SmartRun domain is in Run.

BitField.name: LPUART1AMEN
BitField.description: LPUART1 Autonomous mode enable Set and reset by software. Refer to for additional information.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: LPUART1 peripheral clocks disabled when the CPU is in CStop (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: LPUART1 peripheral clocks enabled when the SmartRun domain is in Run mode. Kernel clock is enabled when the SmartRun domain is in Stop mode.

BitField.name: SPI6AMEN
BitField.description: SPI6 Autonomous mode enable Set and reset by software. Refer to for additional information.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: SPI6 peripheral clocks disabled when the CPU is in CStop (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: SPI6 peripheral clocks enabled when the SmartRun domain is in Run mode. Kernel clock is enabled when the SmartRun domain is in Stop mode.

BitField.name: I2C4AMEN
BitField.description: I2C4 Autonomous mode enable Set and reset by software. Refer to for additional information.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: I2C4 peripheral clocks disabled when the CPU is in CStop (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: I2C4 peripheral clocks enabled when the SmartRun domain is in Run mode. Kernel clock is enabled when the SmartRun domain is in Stop mode.

BitField.name: LPTIM2AMEN
BitField.description: LPTIM2 Autonomous mode enable Set and reset by software. Refer to for additional information

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: LPTIM2 peripheral clocks are disabled when the CPU is in CStop (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: LPTIM2 peripheral clocks enabled when the SmartRun domain is in Run mode. Kernel clock is enabled when the SmartRun domain is in Stop mode.

BitField.name: LPTIM3AMEN
BitField.description: LPTIM3 Autonomous mode enable Set and reset by software. Refer to for additional information.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: LPTIM3 peripheral clocks disabled when the CPU is in CStop (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: LPTIM3 peripheral clocks enabled when the SmartRun domain is in Run mode. Kernel clock is enabled when the SmartRun domain is in Stop mode.

BitField.name: DAC2AMEN
BitField.description: DAC2 (containing one converter) Autonomous mode enable Set and reset by software. Refer to for additional information.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: DAC2 peripheral clocks disabled when the CPU is in CStop (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: DAC2 peripheral clocks enabled when the SmartRun domain is in Run.

BitField.name: COMP12AMEN
BitField.description: COMP1 and 2 Autonomous mode enable Set and reset by software. Refer to for additional information.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: COMP1 and 2 peripheral clocks disabled when the CPU is in CStop (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: COMP1 and 2 peripheral clocks enabled when the SmartRun domain is in Run.

BitField.name: VREFAMEN
BitField.description: VREF Autonomous mode enable Set and reset by software. Refer to for additional information.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: VREF clocks disabled when the CPU is in CStop (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: VREF clocks enabled when the SmartRun domain is in Run or Stop mode.

BitField.name: RTCAMEN
BitField.description: RTC Autonomous mode enable Set and reset by software. Refer to for additional information.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: RTC bus clocks disabled when the CPU is in CStop (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: RTC bus clocks enabled when the SmartRun domain is in Run.

BitField.name: DTSAMEN
BitField.description: Digital temperature sensor Autonomous mode enable Set and reset by software. Refer to for additional information.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: DTS clocks disabled when the CPU is in CStop (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: DTS clocks enabled when the SmartRun domain is in Run.

BitField.name: DFSDM2AMEN
BitField.description: DFSDM2 Autonomous mode enable Set and reset by software. Refer to for additional information.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: DFSDM2 clock disabled when the CPU is in CStop (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: DFSDM2 peripheral clocks enabled when the SmartRun domain is in Run mode. Kernel clock enabled when the SmartRun domain is in Stop mode.

BitField.name: BKPRAMAMEN
BitField.description: Backup RAM Autonomous mode enable Set and reset by software. Refer to for additional information.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Backup RAM clock disabled when the CPU is in CStop (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Backup RAM clock enabling is controlled by the SmartRun domain state.

BitField.name: SRDSRAMAMEN
BitField.description: SmartRun domain SRAM Autonomous mode enable Set and reset by software. Refer to for additional information.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: SRDSRAM clock disabled when the CPU is in CStop (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: SRDSRAM bus clock enabled when the SmartRun domain is in Run.

Register.name: RCC_CKGAENR
Register.description: RCC AXI clocks gating enable register

BitField.name: AXICKG
BitField.description: AXI interconnect matrix clock gating This bit is set and reset by software.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The clock gating is disabled. The clock is always enabled

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The clock gating is enabled. The AXI interconnect matrix clock is enabled on bus transaction request.

BitField.name: AHBCKG
BitField.description: AXI master AHB clock gating This bit is set and reset by software.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The clock gating is disabled. The clock is always enabled.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The clock gating is enabled. The AXI matrix master AHB clock is enabled on bus transaction request.

BitField.name: CPUCKG
BitField.description: AXI master CPU clock gating This bit is set and reset by software.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The clock gating is disabled. The clock is always enabled.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The clock gating is enabled. The AXI matrix master CPU clock is enabled on bus transaction request.

BitField.name: SDMMCCKG
BitField.description: AXI master SDMMC clock gating This bit is set and reset by software.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The clock gating is disabled. The clock is always enabled.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The clock gating is enabled. The AXI matrix master SDMMC clock is enabled on bus transaction request.

BitField.name: MDMACKG
BitField.description: AXI master MDMA clock gating This bit is set and reset by software.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The clock gating is disabled. The clock is always enabled

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The clock gating is enabled. The AXI matrix master MDMA clock is enabled on bus transaction request.

BitField.name: DMA2DCKG
BitField.description: AXI master DMA2D clock gating This bit is set and reset by software.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The clock gating is disabled. The clock is always enabled

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The clock gating is enabled. The AXI matrix master DMA2D clock is enabled on bus transaction request.

BitField.name: LTDCCKG
BitField.description: AXI master LTDC clock gating This bit is set and reset by software.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The clock gating is disabled. The clock is always enabled.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The clock gating is enabled. The AXI matrix master LTDC clock is enabled on bus transaction request.

BitField.name: GFXMMUMCKG
BitField.description: AXI master GFXMMU clock gating This bit is set and reset by software.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The clock gating is disabled. The clock is always enabled

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The clock gating is enabled. The AXI matrix master GFXMMU clock is enabled on bus transaction request.

BitField.name: AHB12CKG
BitField.description: AXI slave AHB12 clock gating This bit is set and reset by software.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The clock gating is disabled. The clock is always enabled

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The clock gating is enabled. The AXI matrix slave AHB12 clock is enabled on bus transaction request.

BitField.name: AHB34CKG
BitField.description: AXI slave AHB34 clock gating This bit is set and reset by software.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The clock gating is disabled. The clock is always enabled

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The clock gating is enabled. The AXI matrix slave AHB34 clock is enabled on bus transaction request.

BitField.name: FLIFTCKG
BitField.description: AXI slave Flash interface (FLIFT) clock gating This bit is set and reset by software.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The clock gating is disabled. The clock is always enabled.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The clock gating is enabled. The AXI matrix slave FLIFT clock is enabled on bus transaction request.

BitField.name: OCTOSPI2CKG
BitField.description: AXI slave OCTOSPI2 clock gating This bit is set and reset by software.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The clock gating is disabled. The clock is always enabled.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The clock gating is enabled. The AXI matrix slave OCTOSPI2 clock is enabled on bus transaction request.

BitField.name: FMCCKG
BitField.description: AXI slave FMC clock gating This bit is set and reset by software.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The clock gating is disabled. The clock is always enabled.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The clock gating is enabled. The AXI matrix slave FMC clock is enabled on bus transaction request.

BitField.name: OCTOSPI1CKG
BitField.description: AXI slave OCTOSPI1 clock gating This bit is set and reset by software.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The clock gating is disabled. The clock is always enabled.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The clock gating is enabled. The AXI matrix slave OCTOSPI1 clock is enabled on bus transaction request.

BitField.name: AXIRAM1CKG
BitField.description: AXI slave SRAM1 clock gating This bit is set and reset by software.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The clock gating is disabled. The clock is always enabled.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The clock gating is enabled. The AXI matrix slave SRAM1 clock is enabled on bus transaction request.

BitField.name: AXIRAM2CKG
BitField.description: AXI matrix slave SRAM2 clock gating This bit is set and reset by software.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The clock gating is disabled. The clock is always enabled.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The clock gating is enabled. The AXI matrix slave SRAM2 clock is enabled on bus transaction request.

BitField.name: AXIRAM3CKG
BitField.description: AXI matrix slave SRAM3 clock gating This bit is set and reset by software.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The clock gating is disabled. The clock is always enabled.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The clock gating is enabled. The AXI matrix slave SRAM3 clock is enabled on bus transaction request.

BitField.name: GFXMMUSCKG
BitField.description: AXI matrix slave GFXMMU clock gating This bit is set and reset by software.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The clock gating is disabled. The clock is always enabled

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The clock gating is enabled. The AXI matrix slave GFXMMU clock is enabled on bus transaction request.

BitField.name: ECCRAMCKG
BitField.description: RAM error code correction (ECC) clock gating This bit is set and reset by software.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The clock gating is disabled. The clock is always enabled.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The clock gating is enabled. The ECC clock is enabled only during a RAM access.

BitField.name: EXTICKG
BitField.description: EXTI clock gating This bit is set and reset by software.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The clock gating is disabled. The clock is always enabled.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The clock gating is enabled. The clock is enabled after an event detection and stopped again when the event flag is cleared.

BitField.name: JTAGCKG
BitField.description: JTAG automatic clock gating This bit is set and reset by software.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The clock gating is disabled. The clock is always enabled.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The clock gating is enabled. The clock is disabled except if a JTAG connection has been detected

BitField.name: RMVF
BitField.description: remove reset flag Set and reset by software to reset the value of the reset flags.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: reset of the reset flags not activated (default after power-on reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: resets the value of the reset flags

BitField.name: CDRSTF
BitField.description: CPU domain power-switch reset flag Reset by software by writing the RMVF bit. Set by hardware when a the CPU domain exits from DStop or after of power-on reset. Set also when the CPU domain exists DStop2 but only when a pad reset has occurred during DStop2 (PINRST bit also set by hardware)

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: no CPU domain power-switch reset occurred

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: CPU domain power-switch (ePOD2) reset occurred (default after power-on reset)

BitField.name: BORRSTF
BitField.description: BOR reset flag Reset by software by writing the RMVF bit. Set by hardware when a BOR reset occurs (pwr_bor_rst).

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: no BOR reset occurred

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: BOR reset occurred (default after power-on reset)

BitField.name: PINRSTF
BitField.description: pin reset flag (NRST) Reset by software by writing the RMVF bit. Set by hardware when a reset from pin occurs.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: no reset from pin occurred

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: reset from pin occurred (default after power-on reset)

BitField.name: PORRSTF
BitField.description: POR/PDR reset flag Reset by software by writing the RMVF bit. Set by hardware when a POR/PDR reset occurs.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: no POR/PDR reset occurred

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: POR/PDR reset occurred (default after power-on reset)

BitField.name: SFTRSTF
BitField.description: system reset from CPU reset flag Reset by software by writing the RMVF bit. Set by hardware when the system reset is due to CPU.The CPU can generate a system reset by writing SYSRESETREQ bit of AIRCR register of the core M7.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: no CPU software reset occurred (default after power-on reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: a system reset has been generated by the CPU

BitField.name: IWDGRSTF
BitField.description: independent watchdog reset flag Reset by software by writing the RMVF bit. Set by hardware when an independent watchdog reset occurs.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: no independent watchdog reset occurred (default after power-on reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: independent watchdog reset occurred

BitField.name: WWDGRSTF
BitField.description: window watchdog reset flag Reset by software by writing the RMVF bit. Set by hardware when a window watchdog reset occurs.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: no window watchdog reset occurred from WWDG (default after power-on reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: window watchdog reset occurred from WWDG

BitField.name: LPWRRSTF
BitField.description: reset due to illegal CD DStop or CD DStop2 or CPU CStop flag Reset by software by writing the RMVF bit. Set by hardware when the CPU domain goes erroneously in DStop or DStop2, or when the CPU goes erroneously in CStop.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: no illegal reset occurred (default after power-on reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: illegal CD DStop or CD DStop2 or CPU CStop reset occurred

BitField.name: AHBSRAM1EN
BitField.description: AHBSRAM1 block enable Set and reset by software. When set, this bit indicates that the SRAM1 is allocated by the CPU. It causes the CPU domain to take into account also the CPU operation modes, keeping the CPU domain in DRun when the CPU is in CRun.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: AHBSRAM1 interface clock is disabled. (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: AHBSRAM1 interface clock is enabled.

BitField.name: AHBSRAM2EN
BitField.description: AHBSRAM2 block enable Set and reset by software. When set, this bit indicates that the SRAM2 is allocated by the CPU. It causes the CPU domain to take into account also the CPU operation modes, keeping the CPU domain in DRun when the CPU is in CRun.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: AHBSRAM2 interface clock is disabled. (default after reset)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: AHBSRAM2 interface clock is enabled.

BitField.name: CED
BitField.description: Clock error detection Note: The clock error detection can be used only when ck_rc48 or ck_pll1_q (ck_pll1_q = 48MHz) source is selected otherwise, CED bit must be equal to 1. The clock error detection cannot be enabled nor disabled on the fly when RNG peripheral is enabled, to enable or disable CED the RNG must be disabled.

BitField.name: DRDY
BitField.description: Data ready Note: If IE=1 in RNG_CR, an interrupt is generated when DRDY=1. It can rise when the peripheral is disabled. When the output buffer becomes empty (after reading RNG_DR), this bit returns to 0 until a new random value is generated.

BitField.name: CECS
BitField.description: Clock error current status Note: This bit is meaningless if CED (Clock error detection) bit in RNG_CR is equal to 1.

BitField.name: SECS
BitField.description: Seed error current status ** More than 64 consecutive bits at the same value (0 or 1) ** More than 32 consecutive alternances of 0 and 1 (0101010101...01)

BitField.name: CEIS
BitField.description: Clock error interrupt status This bit is set at the same time as CECS. It is cleared by writing it to 0. An interrupt is pending if IE = 1 in the RNG_CR register. Note: This bit is meaningless if CED (Clock error detection) bit in RNG_CR is equal to 1.

BitField.name: SEIS
BitField.description: Seed error interrupt status This bit is set at the same time as SECS. It is cleared by writing it to 0. ** More than 64 consecutive bits at the same value (0 or 1) ** More than 32 consecutive alternances of 0 and 1 (0101010101...01) An interrupt is pending if IE = 1 in the RNG_CR register.

Register.name: RNG_DR
Register.description: The RNG_DR register is a read-only register that delivers a 32-bit random value when read. The content of this register is valid when DRDY= 1, even if RNGEN=0.

BitField.name: RNDATA
BitField.description: Random data 32-bit random data which are valid when DRDY=1.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: AM or 24-hour format

BitField.name: SS
BitField.description: Sub second value SS[15:0] is the value in the synchronous prescaler counter. The fraction of a second is given by the formula below: Second fraction = (PREDIV_S - SS) / (PREDIV_S + 1) Note: SS can be larger than PREDIV_S only after a shift operation. In that case, the correct time/date is one second less than as indicated by RTC_TR/RTC_DR.

Register.name: RTC_ICSR
Register.description: RTC initialization control and status register

BitField.name: ALRAWF
BitField.description: Alarm A write flag This bit is set by hardware when alarm A values can be changed, after the ALRAE bit has been set to 0 in RTC_CR. It is cleared by hardware in initialization mode.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Alarm A update not allowed

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Alarm A update allowed

BitField.name: ALRBWF
BitField.description: Alarm B write flag This bit is set by hardware when alarm B values can be changed, after the ALRBE bit has been set to 0 in RTC_CR. It is cleared by hardware in initialization mode.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Alarm B update not allowed

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Alarm B update allowed

BitField.name: WUTWF
BitField.description: Wakeup timer write flag This bit is set by hardware when WUT value can be changed, after the WUTE bit has been set to 0 in RTC_CR. It is cleared by hardware in initialization mode.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Wakeup timer configuration update not allowed except in initialization mode

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Wakeup timer configuration update allowed

BitField.name: SHPF
BitField.description: Shift operation pending This flag is set by hardware as soon as a shift operation is initiated by a write to the RTC_SHIFTR register. It is cleared by hardware when the corresponding shift operation has been executed. Writing to the SHPF bit has no effect.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No shift operation is pending

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: A shift operation is pending

BitField.name: INITS
BitField.description: Initialization status flag This bit is set by hardware when the calendar year field is different from 0 (Backup domain reset state).

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Calendar has not been initialized

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Calendar has been initialized

BitField.name: RSF
BitField.description: Registers synchronization flag This bit is set by hardware each time the calendar registers are copied into the shadow registers (RTC_SSRx, RTC_TRx and RTC_DRx). This bit is cleared by hardware in initialization mode, while a shift operation is pending (SHPF = 1), or when in bypass shadow register mode (BYPSHAD = 1). This bit can also be cleared by software. It is cleared either by software or by hardware in initialization mode.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Calendar shadow registers not yet synchronized

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Calendar shadow registers synchronized

BitField.name: INITF
BitField.description: Initialization flag When this bit is set to 1, the RTC is in initialization state, and the time, date and prescaler registers can be updated.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Calendar registers update is not allowed

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Calendar registers update is allowed

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Free running mode

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Initialization mode used to program time and date register (RTC_TR and RTC_DR), and prescaler register (RTC_PRER). Counters are stopped and start counting from the new value when INIT is reset.

BitField.name: RECALPF
BitField.description: Recalibration pending Flag The RECALPF status flag is automatically set to 1 when software writes to the RTC_CALR register, indicating that the RTC_CALR register is blocked. When the new calibration settings are taken into account, this bit returns to 0. Refer to .

BitField.name: PREDIV_S
BitField.description: Synchronous prescaler factor This is the synchronous division factor: ck_spre frequency = ck_apre frequency/(PREDIV_S+1)

BitField.name: PREDIV_A
BitField.description: Asynchronous prescaler factor This is the asynchronous division factor: ck_apre frequency = RTCCLK frequency/(PREDIV_A+1)

BitField.name: WUT
BitField.description: Wakeup auto-reload value bits When the wakeup timer is enabled (WUTE set to 1), the WUTF flag is set every (WUT[15:0]Ã‚Â +Ã‚Â 1) ck_wut cycles. The ck_wut period is selected through WUCKSEL[2:0] bits of the RTC_CR register. When WUCKSEL[2] = 1, the wakeup timer becomes 17-bits and WUCKSEL[1] effectively becomes WUT[16] the most-significant bit to be reloaded into the timer. The first assertion of WUTF occurs between WUT and (WUT + 1) ck_wut cycles after WUTE is set. Setting WUT[15:0] to 0x0000 with WUCKSEL[2:0] = 011 (RTCCLK/2) is forbidden.

BitField.name: WUCKSEL
BitField.description: ck_wut wakeup clock selection 10x: ck_spre (usually 1Ã‚Â Hz) clock is selected 11x: ck_spre (usually 1Ã‚Â Hz) clock is selected and 216Ã‚Â is added to the WUT counter value

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: RTC/16 clock is selected

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: RTC/8 clock is selected

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: RTC/4 clock is selected

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: RTC/2 clock is selected

BitField.name: TSEDGE
BitField.description: Timestamp event active edge TSE must be reset when TSEDGE is changed to avoid unwanted TSF setting.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: RTC_TS input rising edge generates a timestamp event

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: RTC_TS input falling edge generates a timestamp event

BitField.name: REFCKON
BitField.description: RTC_REFIN reference clock detection enable (50 or 60Ã‚Â Hz) Note: PREDIV_S must be 0x00FF.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: RTC_REFIN detection disabled

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: RTC_REFIN detection enabled

BitField.name: BYPSHAD
BitField.description: Bypass the shadow registers Note: If the frequency of the APB1 clock is less than seven times the frequency of RTCCLK, BYPSHAD must be set to 1.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Calendar values (when reading from RTC_SSR, RTC_TR, and RTC_DR) are taken from the shadow registers, which are updated once every two RTCCLK cycles.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Calendar values (when reading from RTC_SSR, RTC_TR, and RTC_DR) are taken directly from the calendar counters.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: 24 hour/day format

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: AM/PM hour format

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Alarm A disabled

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Alarm A enabled

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Alarm B disabled

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Alarm B enabled

BitField.name: WUTE
BitField.description: Wakeup timer enable Note: When the wakeup timer is disabled, wait for WUTWF=1 before enabling it again.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Wakeup timer disabled

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Wakeup timer enabled

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: timestamp disable

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: timestamp enable

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Alarm A interrupt disabled

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Alarm A interrupt enabled

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Alarm B interrupt disable

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Alarm B interrupt enable

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Wakeup timer interrupt disabled

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Wakeup timer interrupt enabled

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Timestamp interrupt disable

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Timestamp interrupt enable

BitField.name: ADD1H
BitField.description: Add 1 hour (summer time change) When this bit is set outside initialization mode, 1 hour is added to the calendar time. This bit is always read as 0.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No effect

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Adds 1 hour to the current time. This can be used for summer time change

BitField.name: SUB1H
BitField.description: Subtract 1 hour (winter time change) When this bit is set outside initialization mode, 1 hour is subtracted to the calendar time if the current hour is not 0. This bit is always read as 0. Setting this bit has no effect when current hour is 0.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No effect

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Subtracts 1 hour to the current time. This can be used for winter time change.

BitField.name: BKP
BitField.description: Backup This bit can be written by the user to memorize whether the daylight saving time change has been performed or not.

BitField.name: COSEL
BitField.description: Calibration output selection When COE = 1, this bit selects which signal is output on CALIB. These frequencies are valid for RTCCLK at 32.768Ã‚Â kHz and prescalers at their default values (PREDIV_A = 127 and PREDIV_S = 255). Refer to .

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Calibration output is 512 Hz

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Calibration output is 1 Hz

BitField.name: POL
BitField.description: Output polarity This bit is used to configure the polarity of TAMPALRM output.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The pin is high when ALRAF/ALRBF/WUTF is asserted (depending on OSEL[1:0]), or when a TAMPxF/ITAMPxF is asserted (if TAMPOE = 1).

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The pin is low when ALRAF/ALRBF/WUTF is asserted (depending on OSEL[1:0]), or when a TAMPxF/ITAMPxF is asserted (if TAMPOE = 1).

BitField.name: OSEL
BitField.description: Output selection These bits are used to select the flag to be routed to TAMPALRM output.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Output disabled

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Alarm A output enabled

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: Alarm B output enabled

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: Wakeup output enabled

BitField.name: COE
BitField.description: Calibration output enable This bit enables the CALIB output

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Calibration output disabled

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Calibration output enabled

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: internal event timestamp disabled

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: internal event timestamp enabled

BitField.name: TAMPTS
BitField.description: Activate timestamp on tamper detection event TAMPTS is valid even if TSE = 0 in the RTC_CR register. Timestamp flag is set after the tamper flags, therefore if TAMPTS and TSIE are set, it is recommended to disable the tamper interrupts in order to avoid servicing 2 interrupts.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Tamper detection event does not cause a RTC timestamp to be saved

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Save RTC timestamp on tamper detection event

BitField.name: TAMPOE
BitField.description: Tamper detection output enable on TAMPALRM

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The tamper flag is not routed on TAMPALRM

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The tamper flag is routed on TAMPALRM, combined with the signal provided by OSEL and with the polarity provided by POL.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No pull-up is applied on TAMPALRM output

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: A pull-up is applied on TAMPALRM output

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: TAMPALRM is push-pull output

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: TAMPALRM is open-drain output

BitField.name: OUT2EN
BitField.description: RTC_OUT2 output enable Setting this bit allows to remap the RTC outputs on RTC_OUT2 as follows: OUT2EN = 0: RTC output 2 disable If OSEL Ã¢Â‰Â 00 or TAMPOE = 1: TAMPALRM is output on RTC_OUT1 If OSEL = 00 and TAMPOE = 0 and COE = 1: CALIB is output on RTC_OUT1 OUT2EN = 1: RTC output 2 enable If (OSEL Ã¢Â‰Â 00 or TAMPOE = 1) and COE = 0: TAMPALRM is output on RTC_OUT2 If OSEL = 00 and TAMPOE = 0 and COE = 1: CALIB is output on RTC_OUT2 If (OSELÃ¢Â‰Â 00 or TAMPOE = 1) and COE = 1: CALIB is output on RTC_OUT2 and TAMPALRM is output on RTC_OUT1.

BitField.name: KEY
BitField.description: Write protection key This byte is written by software. Reading this byte always returns 0x00. Refer to for a description of how to unlock RTC register write protection.

BitField.name: CALM
BitField.description: Calibration minus The frequency of the calendar is reduced by masking CALM out of 220 RTCCLK pulses (32 seconds if the input frequency is 32768Ã‚Â Hz). This decreases the frequency of the calendar with a resolution of 0.9537Ã‚Â ppm. To increase the frequency of the calendar, this feature should be used in conjunction with CALP. See .

BitField.name: CALW16
BitField.description: Use a 16-second calibration cycle period When CALW16 is set to 1, the 16-second calibration cycle period is selected. This bit must not be set to 1 if CALW8 = 1. Note: CALM[0] is stuck at 0 when CALW16 = 1. Refer to calibration.

BitField.name: CALW8
BitField.description: Use an 8-second calibration cycle period When CALW8 is set to 1, the 8-second calibration cycle period is selected. Note: CALM[1:0] are stuck at 00 when CALW8 = 1. Refer to digital calibration.

BitField.name: CALP
BitField.description: Increase frequency of RTC by 488.5Ã‚Â ppm This feature is intended to be used in conjunction with CALM, which lowers the frequency of the calendar with a fine resolution. if the input frequency is 32768Ã‚Â Hz, the number of RTCCLK pulses added during a 32-second window is calculated as follows: (512 ÃƒÂ— CALP) - CALM. Refer to .

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No RTCCLK pulses are added.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: One RTCCLK pulse is effectively inserted every 211 pulses (frequency increased by 488.5Ã‚Â ppm).

BitField.name: SUBFS
BitField.description: Subtract a fraction of a second These bits are write only and is always read as zero. Writing to this bit has no effect when a shift operation is pending (when SHPF = 1, in RTC_ICSR). The value which is written to SUBFS is added to the synchronous prescaler counter. Since this counter counts down, this operation effectively subtracts from (delays) the clock by: Delay (seconds) = SUBFS / (PREDIV_S + 1) A fraction of a second can effectively be added to the clock (advancing the clock) when the ADD1S function is used in conjunction with SUBFS, effectively advancing the clock by: Advance (seconds) = (1 - (SUBFS / (PREDIV_S + 1))). Note: Writing to SUBFS causes RSF to be cleared. Software can then wait until RSF = 1 to be sure that the shadow registers have been updated with the shifted time.

BitField.name: ADD1S
BitField.description: Add one second This bit is write only and is always read as zero. Writing to this bit has no effect when a shift operation is pending (when SHPF = 1, in RTC_ICSR). This function is intended to be used with SUBFS (see description below) in order to effectively add a fraction of a second to the clock in an atomic operation.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No effect

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Add one second to the clock/calendar

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: AM or 24-hour format

BitField.name: SS
BitField.description: Sub second value SS[15:0] is the value of the synchronous prescaler counter when the timestamp event occurred.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Alarm A set if the seconds match

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Seconds don't care in alarm A comparison

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Alarm A set if the minutes match

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Minutes don't care in alarm A comparison

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: AM or 24-hour format

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Alarm A set if the hours match

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Hours don't care in alarm A comparison

BitField.name: DU
BitField.description: Date units or day in BCD format

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: DU[3:0] represents the date units

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: DU[3:0] represents the week day. DT[1:0] is don't care.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Alarm A set if the date/day match

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Date/day don't care in alarm A comparison

Register.name: RTC_ALRMASSR
Register.description: RTC alarm A sub second register

BitField.name: SS
BitField.description: Sub seconds value This value is compared with the contents of the synchronous prescaler counter to determine if alarm A is to be activated. Only bits 0 up MASKSS-1 are compared.

BitField.name: MASKSS
BitField.description: Mask the most-significant bits starting at this bit 2: SS[14:2] are don't care in alarm A comparison. Only SS[1:0] are compared. 3: SS[14:3] are don't care in alarm A comparison. Only SS[2:0] are compared. ... 12: SS[14:12] are don't care in alarm A comparison. SS[11:0] are compared. 13: SS[14:13] are don't care in alarm A comparison. SS[12:0] are compared. 14: SS[14] is don't care in alarm A comparison. SS[13:0] are compared. 15: All 15 SS bits are compared and must match to activate alarm. The overflow bits of the synchronous counter (bits 15) is never compared. This bit can be different from 0 only after a shift operation. Note: The overflow bits of the synchronous counter (bits 15) is never compared. This bit can be different from 0 only after a shift operation.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No comparison on sub seconds for alarm A. The alarm is set when the seconds unit is incremented (assuming that the rest of the fields match).

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: SS[14:1] are don't care in alarm A comparison. Only SS[0] is compared.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Alarm B set if the seconds match

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Seconds don't care in alarm B comparison

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Alarm B set if the minutes match

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Minutes don't care in alarm B comparison

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: AM or 24-hour format

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Alarm B set if the hours match

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Hours don't care in alarm B comparison

BitField.name: DU
BitField.description: Date units or day in BCD format

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: DU[3:0] represents the date units

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: DU[3:0] represents the week day. DT[1:0] is don't care.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Alarm B set if the date and day match

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Date and day don't care in alarm B comparison

Register.name: RTC_ALRMBSSR
Register.description: RTC alarm B sub second register

BitField.name: SS
BitField.description: Sub seconds value This value is compared with the contents of the synchronous prescaler counter to determine if alarm B is to be activated. Only bits 0 up to MASKSS-1 are compared.

BitField.name: MASKSS
