BitField.description: Configures how the processor enters Thread mode

Register.name: SHCSR
Register.description: System handler control and state register

BitField.name: MEMFAULTACT
BitField.description: Memory management fault exception active bit

BitField.name: MEMFAULTPENDED
BitField.description: Memory management fault exception pending bit

BitField.name: UNSTKERR
BitField.description: Bus fault on unstacking for a return from exception

BitField.name: STKERR
BitField.description: Bus fault on stacking for exception entry

BitField.name: LSPERR
BitField.description: Bus fault on floating-point lazy state preservation

BitField.name: BFARVALID
BitField.description: Bus Fault Address Register (BFAR) valid flag

BitField.name: PWRCTRL
BitField.description: SDMMC state control bits. These bits can only be written when the SDMMC is not in the power-on state (PWRCTRL?11). These bits are used to define the functional state of the SDMMC signals: Any further write will be ignored, PWRCTRL value will keep 11.

BitField.name: VSWITCH
BitField.description: Voltage switch sequence start. This bit is used to start the timing critical section of the voltage switch sequence:

BitField.name: VSWITCHEN
BitField.description: Voltage switch procedure enable. This bit can only be written by firmware when CPSM is disabled (CPSMEN = 0). This bit is used to stop the SDMMC_CK after the voltage switch command response:

BitField.name: DIRPOL
BitField.description: Data and command direction signals polarity selection. This bit can only be written when the SDMMC is in the power-off state (PWRCTRL = 00).

Register.name: SDMMC_CLKCR
Register.description: The SDMMC_CLKCR register controls the SDMMC_CK output clock, the SDMMC_RX_CLK receive clock, and the bus width.

BitField.name: CLKDIV
BitField.description: Clock divide factor This bit can only be written when the CPSM and DPSM are not active (CPSMACT = 0 and DPSMACT = 0). This field defines the divide factor between the input clock (SDMMCCLK) and the output clock (SDMMC_CK): SDMMC_CK frequency = SDMMCCLK / [2 * CLKDIV]. 0xx: etc.. xxx: etc..

BitField.name: PWRSAV
BitField.description: Power saving configuration bit This bit can only be written when the CPSM and DPSM are not active (CPSMACT = 0 and DPSMACT = 0) For power saving, the SDMMC_CK clock output can be disabled when the bus is idle by setting PWRSAV:

BitField.name: WIDBUS
BitField.description: Wide bus mode enable bit This bit can only be written when the CPSM and DPSM are not active (CPSMACT = 0 and DPSMACT = 0)

BitField.name: NEGEDGE
BitField.description: SDMMC_CK dephasing selection bit for data and Command. This bit can only be written when the CPSM and DPSM are not active (CPSMACT = 0 and DPSMACT = 0). When clock division = 1 (CLKDIV = 0), this bit has no effect. Data and Command change on SDMMC_CK falling edge. When clock division >1 (CLKDIV > 0) & DDR = 0: - SDMMC_CK edge occurs on SDMMCCLK rising edge. When clock division >1 (CLKDIV > 0) & DDR = 1: - Data changed on the SDMMCCLK falling edge succeeding a SDMMC_CK edge. - SDMMC_CK edge occurs on SDMMCCLK rising edge. - Data changed on the SDMMC_CK falling edge succeeding a SDMMC_CK edge. - SDMMC_CK edge occurs on SDMMCCLK rising edge.

BitField.name: HWFC_EN
BitField.description: Hardware flow control enable This bit can only be written when the CPSM and DPSM are not active (CPSMACT = 0 and DPSMACT = 0) When Hardware flow control is enabled, the meaning of the TXFIFOE and RXFIFOF flags change, please see SDMMC status register definition in Section56.8.11.

BitField.name: DDR
BitField.description: Data rate signaling selection This bit can only be written when the CPSM and DPSM are not active (CPSMACT = 0 and DPSMACT = 0) DDR rate shall only be selected with 4-bit or 8-bit wide bus mode. (WIDBUS > 00). DDR = 1 has no effect when WIDBUS = 00 (1-bit wide bus). DDR rate shall only be selected with clock division >1. (CLKDIV > 0)

BitField.name: BUSSPEED
BitField.description: Bus speed mode selection between DS, HS, SDR12, SDR25 and SDR50, DDR50, SDR104. This bit can only be written when the CPSM and DPSM are not active (CPSMACT = 0 and DPSMACT = 0)

BitField.name: SELCLKRX
BitField.description: Receive clock selection. These bits can only be written when the CPSM and DPSM are not active (CPSMACT = 0 and DPSMACT = 0)

Register.name: SDMMC_ARGR
Register.description: The SDMMC_ARGR register contains a 32-bit command argument, which is sent to a card as part of a command message.

BitField.name: CMDARG
BitField.description: Command argument. These bits can only be written by firmware when CPSM is disabled (CPSMEN = 0). Command argument sent to a card as part of a command message. If a command contains an argument, it must be loaded into this register before writing a command to the command register.

Register.name: SDMMC_CMDR
Register.description: The SDMMC_CMDR register contains the command index and command type bits. The command index is sent to a card as part of a command message. The command type bits control the command path state machine (CPSM).

BitField.name: CMDINDEX
BitField.description: Command index. This bit can only be written by firmware when CPSM is disabled (CPSMEN = 0). The command index is sent to the card as part of a command message.

BitField.name: CMDTRANS
BitField.description: The CPSM treats the command as a data transfer command, stops the interrupt period, and signals DataEnable to the DPSM This bit can only be written by firmware when CPSM is disabled (CPSMEN = 0). If this bit is set, the CPSM issues an end of interrupt period and issues DataEnable signal to the DPSM when the command is sent.

BitField.name: CMDSTOP
BitField.description: The CPSM treats the command as a Stop Transmission command and signals Abort to the DPSM. This bit can only be written by firmware when CPSM is disabled (CPSMEN = 0). If this bit is set, the CPSM issues the Abort signal to the DPSM when the command is sent.

BitField.name: WAITRESP
BitField.description: Wait for response bits. This bit can only be written by firmware when CPSM is disabled (CPSMEN = 0). They are used to configure whether the CPSM is to wait for a response, and if yes, which kind of response.

BitField.name: WAITINT
BitField.description: CPSM waits for interrupt request. If this bit is set, the CPSM disables command timeout and waits for an card interrupt request (Response). If this bit is cleared in the CPSM Wait state, will cause the abort of the interrupt mode.

BitField.name: WAITPEND
BitField.description: CPSM Waits for end of data transfer (CmdPend internal signal) from DPSM. This bit when set, the CPSM waits for the end of data transfer trigger before it starts sending a command. WAITPEND is only taken into account when DTMODE = MMC stream data transfer, WIDBUS = 1-bit wide bus mode, DPSMACT = 1 and DTDIR = from host to card.

BitField.name: CPSMEN
BitField.description: Command path state machine (CPSM) Enable bit This bit is written 1 by firmware, and cleared by hardware when the CPSM enters the Idle state. If this bit is set, the CPSM is enabled. When DTEN = 1, no command will be transfered nor boot procedure will be started. CPSMEN is cleared to 0.

BitField.name: DTHOLD
BitField.description: Hold new data block transmission and reception in the DPSM. If this bit is set, the DPSM will not move from the Wait_S state to the Send state or from the Wait_R state to the Receive state.

BitField.name: BOOTMODE
BitField.description: Select the boot mode procedure to be used. This bit can only be written by firmware when CPSM is disabled (CPSMEN = 0)

BitField.name: CMDSUSPEND
BitField.description: The CPSM treats the command as a Suspend or Resume command and signals interrupt period start/end. This bit can only be written by firmware when CPSM is disabled (CPSMEN = 0). CMDSUSPEND = 1 and CMDTRANS = 0 Suspend command, start interrupt period when response bit BS=0. CMDSUSPEND = 1 and CMDTRANS = 1 Resume command with data, end interrupt period when response bit DF=1.

Register.name: SDMMC_RESP1R
Register.description: The SDMMC_RESP1/2/3/4R registers contain the status of a card, which is part of the received response.

Register.name: SDMMC_RESP2R
Register.description: The SDMMC_RESP1/2/3/4R registers contain the status of a card, which is part of the received response.

Register.name: SDMMC_RESP3R
Register.description: The SDMMC_RESP1/2/3/4R registers contain the status of a card, which is part of the received response.

Register.name: SDMMC_RESP4R
Register.description: The SDMMC_RESP1/2/3/4R registers contain the status of a card, which is part of the received response.

Register.name: SDMMC_DTIMER
Register.description: The SDMMC_DTIMER register contains the data timeout period, in card bus clock periods. A counter loads the value from the SDMMC_DTIMER register, and starts decrementing when the data path state machine (DPSM) enters the Wait_R or Busy state. If the timer reaches 0 while the DPSM is in either of these states, the timeout status flag is set.

BitField.name: DATATIME
BitField.description: Data and R1b busy timeout period This bit can only be written when the CPSM and DPSM are not active (CPSMACT = 0 and DPSMACT = 0). Data and R1b busy timeout period expressed in card bus clock periods.

Register.name: SDMMC_DLENR
Register.description: The SDMMC_DLENR register contains the number of data bytes to be transferred. The value is loaded into the data counter when data transfer starts.

BitField.name: DATALENGTH
BitField.description: Data length value This register can only be written by firmware when DPSM is inactive (DPSMACT = 0). Number of data bytes to be transferred. When DDR = 1 DATALENGTH is truncated to a multiple of 2. (The last odd byte is not transfered) When DATALENGTH = 0 no data will be transfered, when requested by a CPSMEN and CMDTRANS = 1 also no command will be transfered. DTEN and CPSMEN are cleared to 0.

Register.name: SDMMC_DCTRL
Register.description: The SDMMC_DCTRL register control the data path state machine (DPSM).

BitField.name: DTEN
BitField.description: Data transfer enable bit This bit can only be written by firmware when DPSM is inactive (DPSMACT = 0). This bit is cleared by Hardware when data transfer completes. This bit shall only be used to transfer data when no associated data transfer command is used, i.e. shall not be used with SD or eMMC cards.

BitField.name: DTDIR
BitField.description: Data transfer direction selection This bit can only be written by firmware when DPSM is inactive (DPSMACT = 0).

BitField.name: DTMODE
BitField.description: Data transfer mode selection. This bit can only be written by firmware when DPSM is inactive (DPSMACT = 0).

BitField.name: DBLOCKSIZE
BitField.description: Data block size This bit can only be written by firmware when DPSM is inactive (DPSMACT = 0). Define the data block length when the block data transfer mode is selected: When DATALENGTH is not a multiple of DBLOCKSIZE, the transfered data is truncated at a multiple of DBLOCKSIZE. (Any remain data will not be transfered.) When DDR = 1, DBLOCKSIZE = 0000 shall not be used. (No data will be transfered)

BitField.name: RWSTART
BitField.description: Read wait start. If this bit is set, read wait operation starts.

BitField.name: RWSTOP
BitField.description: Read wait stop This bit is written by firmware and auto cleared by hardware when the DPSM moves from the READ_WAIT state to the WAIT_R or IDLE state.

BitField.name: RWMOD
BitField.description: Read wait mode. This bit can only be written by firmware when DPSM is inactive (DPSMACT = 0).

BitField.name: SDIOEN
BitField.description: SD I/O interrupt enable functions This bit can only be written by firmware when DPSM is inactive (DPSMACT = 0). If this bit is set, the DPSM enables the SD I/O card specific interrupt operation.

BitField.name: BOOTACKEN
BitField.description: Enable the reception of the boot acknowledgment. This bit can only be written by firmware when DPSM is inactive (DPSMACT = 0).

BitField.name: FIFORST
BitField.description: FIFO reset, will flush any remaining data. This bit can only be written by firmware when IDMAEN= 0 and DPSM is active (DPSMACT = 1). This bit will only take effect when a transfer error or transfer hold occurs.

Register.name: SDMMC_DCNTR
Register.description: The SDMMC_DCNTR register loads the value from the data length register (see SDMMC_DLENR) when the DPSM moves from the Idle state to the Wait_R or Wait_S state. As data is transferred, the counter decrements the value until it reaches 0. The DPSM then moves to the Idle state and when there has been no error, the data status end flag (DATAEND) is set.

BitField.name: DATACOUNT
BitField.description: Data count value When read, the number of remaining data bytes to be transferred is returned. Write has no effect.

Register.name: SDMMC_STAR
Register.description: The SDMMC_STAR register is a read-only register. It contains two types of flag:Static flags (bits [29,21,11:0]): these bits remain asserted until they are cleared by writing to the SDMMC interrupt Clear register (see SDMMC_ICR)Dynamic flags (bits [20:12]): these bits change state depending on the state of the underlying logic (for example, FIFO full and empty flags are asserted and de-asserted as data while written to the FIFO)

BitField.name: CCRCFAIL
BitField.description: Command response received (CRC check failed). Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

BitField.name: DCRCFAIL
BitField.description: Data block sent/received (CRC check failed). Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

BitField.name: CTIMEOUT
BitField.description: Command response timeout. Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR. The Command Timeout period has a fixed value of 64 SDMMC_CK clock periods.

BitField.name: DTIMEOUT
BitField.description: Data timeout. Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

BitField.name: TXUNDERR
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO underrun error or IDMA read transfer error. Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

BitField.name: RXOVERR
BitField.description: Received FIFO overrun error or IDMA write transfer error. Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

BitField.name: CMDREND
BitField.description: Command response received (CRC check passed, or no CRC). Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

BitField.name: CMDSENT
BitField.description: Command sent (no response required). Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

BitField.name: DATAEND
BitField.description: Data transfer ended correctly. (data counter, DATACOUNT is zero and no errors occur). Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

BitField.name: DHOLD
BitField.description: Data transfer Hold. Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

BitField.name: DBCKEND
BitField.description: Data block sent/received. (CRC check passed) and DPSM moves to the READWAIT state. Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

BitField.name: DABORT
BitField.description: Data transfer aborted by CMD12. Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

BitField.name: DPSMACT
BitField.description: Data path state machine active, i.e. not in Idle state. This is a hardware status flag only, does not generate an interrupt.

BitField.name: CPSMACT
BitField.description: Command path state machine active, i.e. not in Idle state. This is a hardware status flag only, does not generate an interrupt.

BitField.name: TXFIFOHE
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO half empty At least half the number of words can be written into the FIFO. This bit is cleared when the FIFO becomes half+1 full.

BitField.name: RXFIFOHF
BitField.description: Receive FIFO half full There are at least half the number of words in the FIFO. This bit is cleared when the FIFO becomes half+1 empty.

BitField.name: TXFIFOF
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO full This is a hardware status flag only, does not generate an interrupt. This bit is cleared when one FIFO location becomes empty.

BitField.name: RXFIFOF
BitField.description: Receive FIFO full This bit is cleared when one FIFO location becomes empty.

BitField.name: TXFIFOE
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO empty This bit is cleared when one FIFO location becomes full.

BitField.name: RXFIFOE
BitField.description: Receive FIFO empty This is a hardware status flag only, does not generate an interrupt. This bit is cleared when one FIFO location becomes full.

BitField.name: BUSYD0
BitField.description: Inverted value of SDMMC_D0 line (Busy), sampled at the end of a CMD response and a second time 2 SDMMC_CK cycles after the CMD response. This bit is reset to not busy when the SDMMCD0 line changes from busy to not busy. This bit does not signal busy due to data transfer. This is a hardware status flag only, it does not generate an interrupt.

BitField.name: BUSYD0END
BitField.description: end of SDMMC_D0 Busy following a CMD response detected. This indicates only end of busy following a CMD response. This bit does not signal busy due to data transfer. Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

BitField.name: SDIOIT
BitField.description: SDIO interrupt received. Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

BitField.name: ACKFAIL
BitField.description: Boot acknowledgment received (boot acknowledgment check fail). Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

BitField.name: ACKTIMEOUT
BitField.description: Boot acknowledgment timeout. Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

BitField.name: VSWEND
BitField.description: Voltage switch critical timing section completion. Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

BitField.name: CKSTOP
BitField.description: SDMMC_CK stopped in Voltage switch procedure. Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

BitField.name: IDMATE
BitField.description: IDMA transfer error. Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

BitField.name: IDMABTC
BitField.description: IDMA buffer transfer complete. interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

Register.name: SDMMC_ICR
Register.description: The SDMMC_ICR register is a write-only register. Writing a bit with 1 clears the corresponding bit in the SDMMC_STAR status register.

BitField.name: CCRCFAILC
BitField.description: CCRCFAIL flag clear bit Set by software to clear the CCRCFAIL flag.

BitField.name: DCRCFAILC
BitField.description: DCRCFAIL flag clear bit Set by software to clear the DCRCFAIL flag.

BitField.name: CTIMEOUTC
BitField.description: CTIMEOUT flag clear bit Set by software to clear the CTIMEOUT flag.

BitField.name: DTIMEOUTC
BitField.description: DTIMEOUT flag clear bit Set by software to clear the DTIMEOUT flag.

BitField.name: TXUNDERRC
BitField.description: TXUNDERR flag clear bit Set by software to clear TXUNDERR flag.

BitField.name: RXOVERRC
BitField.description: RXOVERR flag clear bit Set by software to clear the RXOVERR flag.

BitField.name: CMDRENDC
BitField.description: CMDREND flag clear bit Set by software to clear the CMDREND flag.

BitField.name: CMDSENTC
BitField.description: CMDSENT flag clear bit Set by software to clear the CMDSENT flag.

BitField.name: DATAENDC
BitField.description: DATAEND flag clear bit Set by software to clear the DATAEND flag.

BitField.name: DHOLDC
BitField.description: DHOLD flag clear bit Set by software to clear the DHOLD flag.

BitField.name: DBCKENDC
BitField.description: DBCKEND flag clear bit Set by software to clear the DBCKEND flag.

BitField.name: DABORTC
BitField.description: DABORT flag clear bit Set by software to clear the DABORT flag.

BitField.name: BUSYD0ENDC
BitField.description: BUSYD0END flag clear bit Set by software to clear the BUSYD0END flag.

BitField.name: SDIOITC
BitField.description: SDIOIT flag clear bit Set by software to clear the SDIOIT flag.

BitField.name: ACKFAILC
BitField.description: ACKFAIL flag clear bit Set by software to clear the ACKFAIL flag.

BitField.name: ACKTIMEOUTC
BitField.description: ACKTIMEOUT flag clear bit Set by software to clear the ACKTIMEOUT flag.

BitField.name: VSWENDC
BitField.description: VSWEND flag clear bit Set by software to clear the VSWEND flag.

BitField.name: CKSTOPC
BitField.description: CKSTOP flag clear bit Set by software to clear the CKSTOP flag.

BitField.name: IDMATEC
BitField.description: IDMA transfer error clear bit Set by software to clear the IDMATE flag.

BitField.name: IDMABTCC
BitField.description: IDMA buffer transfer complete clear bit Set by software to clear the IDMABTC flag.

Register.name: SDMMC_MASKR
Register.description: The interrupt mask register determines which status flags generate an interrupt request by setting the corresponding bit to 1.

BitField.name: CCRCFAILIE
BitField.description: Command CRC fail interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by command CRC failure.

BitField.name: DCRCFAILIE
BitField.description: Data CRC fail interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by data CRC failure.

BitField.name: CTIMEOUTIE
BitField.description: Command timeout interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by command timeout.

BitField.name: DTIMEOUTIE
BitField.description: Data timeout interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by data timeout.

BitField.name: TXUNDERRIE
BitField.description: Tx FIFO underrun error interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by Tx FIFO underrun error.

BitField.name: RXOVERRIE
BitField.description: Rx FIFO overrun error interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by Rx FIFO overrun error.

BitField.name: CMDRENDIE
BitField.description: Command response received interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by receiving command response.

BitField.name: CMDSENTIE
BitField.description: Command sent interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by sending command.

BitField.name: DATAENDIE
BitField.description: Data end interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by data end.

BitField.name: DHOLDIE
BitField.description: Data hold interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable the interrupt generated when sending new data is hold in the DPSM Wait_S state.

BitField.name: DBCKENDIE
BitField.description: Data block end interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by data block end.

BitField.name: DABORTIE
BitField.description: Data transfer aborted interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by a data transfer being aborted.

BitField.name: TXFIFOHEIE
BitField.description: Tx FIFO half empty interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by Tx FIFO half empty.

BitField.name: RXFIFOHFIE
BitField.description: Rx FIFO half full interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by Rx FIFO half full.

BitField.name: RXFIFOFIE
BitField.description: Rx FIFO full interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by Rx FIFO full.

BitField.name: TXFIFOEIE
BitField.description: Tx FIFO empty interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by Tx FIFO empty.

BitField.name: BUSYD0ENDIE
BitField.description: BUSYD0END interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable the interrupt generated when SDMMC_D0 signal changes from busy to NOT busy following a CMD response.

BitField.name: SDIOITIE
BitField.description: SDIO mode interrupt received interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable the interrupt generated when receiving the SDIO mode interrupt.

BitField.name: ACKFAILIE
BitField.description: Acknowledgment Fail interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by acknowledgment Fail.

BitField.name: ACKTIMEOUTIE
BitField.description: Acknowledgment timeout interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by acknowledgment timeout.

BitField.name: VSWENDIE
BitField.description: Voltage switch critical timing section completion interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable the interrupt generated when voltage switch critical timing section completion.

BitField.name: CKSTOPIE
BitField.description: Voltage Switch clock stopped interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by Voltage Switch clock stopped.

BitField.name: IDMABTCIE
BitField.description: IDMA buffer transfer complete interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable the interrupt generated when the IDMA has transferred all data belonging to a memory buffer.

Register.name: SDMMC_ACKTIMER
Register.description: The SDMMC_ACKTIMER register contains the acknowledgment timeout period, in SDMMC_CK bus clock periods. A counter loads the value from the SDMMC_ACKTIMER register, and starts decrementing when the data path state machine (DPSM) enters the Wait_Ack state. If the timer reaches 0 while the DPSM is in this states, the acknowledgment timeout status flag is set.

BitField.name: ACKTIME
BitField.description: Boot acknowledgment timeout period This bit can only be written by firmware when CPSM is disabled (CPSMEN = 0). Boot acknowledgment timeout period expressed in card bus clock periods.

Register.name: SDMMC_IDMACTRLR
Register.description: The receive and transmit FIFOs can be read or written as 32-bit wide registers. The FIFOs contain 32 entries on 32 sequential addresses. This allows the CPU to use its load and store multiple operands to read from/write to the FIFO.

BitField.name: IDMAEN
BitField.description: IDMA enable This bit can only be written by firmware when DPSM is inactive (DPSMACT = 0).

BitField.name: IDMABMODE
BitField.description: Buffer mode selection. This bit can only be written by firmware when DPSM is inactive (DPSMACT = 0).

BitField.name: IDMABACT
BitField.description: Double buffer mode active buffer indication This bit can only be written by firmware when DPSM is inactive (DPSMACT = 0). When IDMA is enabled this bit is toggled by hardware.

Register.name: SDMMC_IDMABSIZER
Register.description: The SDMMC_IDMABSIZER register contains the buffers size when in double buffer configuration.

BitField.name: IDMABNDT
BitField.description: Number of transfers per buffer. This 8-bit value shall be multiplied by 8 to get the size of the buffer in 32-bit words and by 32 to get the size of the buffer in bytes. Example: IDMABNDT = 0x01: buffer size = 8 words = 32 bytes. These bits can only be written by firmware when DPSM is inactive (DPSMACT = 0).

Register.name: SDMMC_IDMABASE0R
Register.description: The SDMMC_IDMABASE0R register contains the memory buffer base address in single buffer configuration and the buffer 0 base address in double buffer configuration.

BitField.name: IDMABASE0
BitField.description: Buffer 0 memory base address bits [31:2], shall be word aligned (bit [1:0] are always 0 and read only). This register can be written by firmware when DPSM is inactive (DPSMACT = 0), and can dynamically be written by firmware when DPSM active (DPSMACT = 1) and memory buffer 0 is inactive (IDMABACT = 1).

Register.name: SDMMC_IDMABASE1R
Register.description: The SDMMC_IDMABASE1R register contains the double buffer configuration second buffer memory base address.

BitField.name: IDMABASE1
BitField.description: Buffer 1 memory base address, shall be word aligned (bit [1:0] are always 0 and read only). This register can be written by firmware when DPSM is inactive (DPSMACT = 0), and can dynamically be written by firmware when DPSM active (DPSMACT = 1) and memory buffer 1 is inactive (IDMABACT = 0).

Register.name: SDMMC_FIFOR
Register.description: The receive and transmit FIFOs can be only read or written as word (32-bit) wide registers. The FIFOs contain 16 entries on sequential addresses. This allows the CPU to use its load and store multiple operands to read from/write to the FIFO.When accessing SDMMC_FIFOR with half word or byte access an AHB bus fault is generated.

BitField.name: FIFODATA
BitField.description: Receive and transmit FIFO data This register can only be read or written by firmware when the DPSM is active (DPSMACT=1). The FIFO data occupies 16 entries of 32-bit words.

BitField.name: PWRCTRL
BitField.description: SDMMC state control bits. These bits can only be written when the SDMMC is not in the power-on state (PWRCTRL?11). These bits are used to define the functional state of the SDMMC signals: Any further write will be ignored, PWRCTRL value will keep 11.

BitField.name: VSWITCH
BitField.description: Voltage switch sequence start. This bit is used to start the timing critical section of the voltage switch sequence:

BitField.name: VSWITCHEN
BitField.description: Voltage switch procedure enable. This bit can only be written by firmware when CPSM is disabled (CPSMEN = 0). This bit is used to stop the SDMMC_CK after the voltage switch command response:

BitField.name: DIRPOL
BitField.description: Data and command direction signals polarity selection. This bit can only be written when the SDMMC is in the power-off state (PWRCTRL = 00).

Register.name: SDMMC_CLKCR
Register.description: The SDMMC_CLKCR register controls the SDMMC_CK output clock, the SDMMC_RX_CLK receive clock, and the bus width.

BitField.name: CLKDIV
BitField.description: Clock divide factor This bit can only be written when the CPSM and DPSM are not active (CPSMACT = 0 and DPSMACT = 0). This field defines the divide factor between the input clock (SDMMCCLK) and the output clock (SDMMC_CK): SDMMC_CK frequency = SDMMCCLK / [2 * CLKDIV]. 0xx: etc.. xxx: etc..

BitField.name: PWRSAV
BitField.description: Power saving configuration bit This bit can only be written when the CPSM and DPSM are not active (CPSMACT = 0 and DPSMACT = 0) For power saving, the SDMMC_CK clock output can be disabled when the bus is idle by setting PWRSAV:

BitField.name: WIDBUS
BitField.description: Wide bus mode enable bit This bit can only be written when the CPSM and DPSM are not active (CPSMACT = 0 and DPSMACT = 0)

BitField.name: NEGEDGE
BitField.description: SDMMC_CK dephasing selection bit for data and Command. This bit can only be written when the CPSM and DPSM are not active (CPSMACT = 0 and DPSMACT = 0). When clock division = 1 (CLKDIV = 0), this bit has no effect. Data and Command change on SDMMC_CK falling edge. When clock division >1 (CLKDIV > 0) & DDR = 0: - SDMMC_CK edge occurs on SDMMCCLK rising edge. When clock division >1 (CLKDIV > 0) & DDR = 1: - Data changed on the SDMMCCLK falling edge succeeding a SDMMC_CK edge. - SDMMC_CK edge occurs on SDMMCCLK rising edge. - Data changed on the SDMMC_CK falling edge succeeding a SDMMC_CK edge. - SDMMC_CK edge occurs on SDMMCCLK rising edge.

BitField.name: HWFC_EN
BitField.description: Hardware flow control enable This bit can only be written when the CPSM and DPSM are not active (CPSMACT = 0 and DPSMACT = 0) When Hardware flow control is enabled, the meaning of the TXFIFOE and RXFIFOF flags change, please see SDMMC status register definition in Section56.8.11.

BitField.name: DDR
BitField.description: Data rate signaling selection This bit can only be written when the CPSM and DPSM are not active (CPSMACT = 0 and DPSMACT = 0) DDR rate shall only be selected with 4-bit or 8-bit wide bus mode. (WIDBUS > 00). DDR = 1 has no effect when WIDBUS = 00 (1-bit wide bus). DDR rate shall only be selected with clock division >1. (CLKDIV > 0)

BitField.name: BUSSPEED
BitField.description: Bus speed mode selection between DS, HS, SDR12, SDR25 and SDR50, DDR50, SDR104. This bit can only be written when the CPSM and DPSM are not active (CPSMACT = 0 and DPSMACT = 0)

BitField.name: SELCLKRX
BitField.description: Receive clock selection. These bits can only be written when the CPSM and DPSM are not active (CPSMACT = 0 and DPSMACT = 0)

Register.name: SDMMC_ARGR
Register.description: The SDMMC_ARGR register contains a 32-bit command argument, which is sent to a card as part of a command message.

BitField.name: CMDARG
BitField.description: Command argument. These bits can only be written by firmware when CPSM is disabled (CPSMEN = 0). Command argument sent to a card as part of a command message. If a command contains an argument, it must be loaded into this register before writing a command to the command register.

Register.name: SDMMC_CMDR
Register.description: The SDMMC_CMDR register contains the command index and command type bits. The command index is sent to a card as part of a command message. The command type bits control the command path state machine (CPSM).

BitField.name: CMDINDEX
BitField.description: Command index. This bit can only be written by firmware when CPSM is disabled (CPSMEN = 0). The command index is sent to the card as part of a command message.

BitField.name: CMDTRANS
BitField.description: The CPSM treats the command as a data transfer command, stops the interrupt period, and signals DataEnable to the DPSM This bit can only be written by firmware when CPSM is disabled (CPSMEN = 0). If this bit is set, the CPSM issues an end of interrupt period and issues DataEnable signal to the DPSM when the command is sent.

BitField.name: CMDSTOP
BitField.description: The CPSM treats the command as a Stop Transmission command and signals Abort to the DPSM. This bit can only be written by firmware when CPSM is disabled (CPSMEN = 0). If this bit is set, the CPSM issues the Abort signal to the DPSM when the command is sent.

BitField.name: WAITRESP
BitField.description: Wait for response bits. This bit can only be written by firmware when CPSM is disabled (CPSMEN = 0). They are used to configure whether the CPSM is to wait for a response, and if yes, which kind of response.

BitField.name: WAITINT
BitField.description: CPSM waits for interrupt request. If this bit is set, the CPSM disables command timeout and waits for an card interrupt request (Response). If this bit is cleared in the CPSM Wait state, will cause the abort of the interrupt mode.

BitField.name: WAITPEND
BitField.description: CPSM Waits for end of data transfer (CmdPend internal signal) from DPSM. This bit when set, the CPSM waits for the end of data transfer trigger before it starts sending a command. WAITPEND is only taken into account when DTMODE = MMC stream data transfer, WIDBUS = 1-bit wide bus mode, DPSMACT = 1 and DTDIR = from host to card.

BitField.name: CPSMEN
BitField.description: Command path state machine (CPSM) Enable bit This bit is written 1 by firmware, and cleared by hardware when the CPSM enters the Idle state. If this bit is set, the CPSM is enabled. When DTEN = 1, no command will be transfered nor boot procedure will be started. CPSMEN is cleared to 0.

BitField.name: DTHOLD
BitField.description: Hold new data block transmission and reception in the DPSM. If this bit is set, the DPSM will not move from the Wait_S state to the Send state or from the Wait_R state to the Receive state.

BitField.name: BOOTMODE
BitField.description: Select the boot mode procedure to be used. This bit can only be written by firmware when CPSM is disabled (CPSMEN = 0)

BitField.name: CMDSUSPEND
BitField.description: The CPSM treats the command as a Suspend or Resume command and signals interrupt period start/end. This bit can only be written by firmware when CPSM is disabled (CPSMEN = 0). CMDSUSPEND = 1 and CMDTRANS = 0 Suspend command, start interrupt period when response bit BS=0. CMDSUSPEND = 1 and CMDTRANS = 1 Resume command with data, end interrupt period when response bit DF=1.

Register.name: SDMMC_RESP1R
Register.description: The SDMMC_RESP1/2/3/4R registers contain the status of a card, which is part of the received response.

Register.name: SDMMC_RESP2R
Register.description: The SDMMC_RESP1/2/3/4R registers contain the status of a card, which is part of the received response.

Register.name: SDMMC_RESP3R
Register.description: The SDMMC_RESP1/2/3/4R registers contain the status of a card, which is part of the received response.

Register.name: SDMMC_RESP4R
Register.description: The SDMMC_RESP1/2/3/4R registers contain the status of a card, which is part of the received response.

Register.name: SDMMC_DTIMER
Register.description: The SDMMC_DTIMER register contains the data timeout period, in card bus clock periods. A counter loads the value from the SDMMC_DTIMER register, and starts decrementing when the data path state machine (DPSM) enters the Wait_R or Busy state. If the timer reaches 0 while the DPSM is in either of these states, the timeout status flag is set.

BitField.name: DATATIME
BitField.description: Data and R1b busy timeout period This bit can only be written when the CPSM and DPSM are not active (CPSMACT = 0 and DPSMACT = 0). Data and R1b busy timeout period expressed in card bus clock periods.

Register.name: SDMMC_DLENR
Register.description: The SDMMC_DLENR register contains the number of data bytes to be transferred. The value is loaded into the data counter when data transfer starts.

BitField.name: DATALENGTH
BitField.description: Data length value This register can only be written by firmware when DPSM is inactive (DPSMACT = 0). Number of data bytes to be transferred. When DDR = 1 DATALENGTH is truncated to a multiple of 2. (The last odd byte is not transfered) When DATALENGTH = 0 no data will be transfered, when requested by a CPSMEN and CMDTRANS = 1 also no command will be transfered. DTEN and CPSMEN are cleared to 0.

Register.name: SDMMC_DCTRL
Register.description: The SDMMC_DCTRL register control the data path state machine (DPSM).

BitField.name: DTEN
BitField.description: Data transfer enable bit This bit can only be written by firmware when DPSM is inactive (DPSMACT = 0). This bit is cleared by Hardware when data transfer completes. This bit shall only be used to transfer data when no associated data transfer command is used, i.e. shall not be used with SD or eMMC cards.

BitField.name: DTDIR
BitField.description: Data transfer direction selection This bit can only be written by firmware when DPSM is inactive (DPSMACT = 0).

BitField.name: DTMODE
BitField.description: Data transfer mode selection. This bit can only be written by firmware when DPSM is inactive (DPSMACT = 0).

BitField.name: DBLOCKSIZE
BitField.description: Data block size This bit can only be written by firmware when DPSM is inactive (DPSMACT = 0). Define the data block length when the block data transfer mode is selected: When DATALENGTH is not a multiple of DBLOCKSIZE, the transfered data is truncated at a multiple of DBLOCKSIZE. (Any remain data will not be transfered.) When DDR = 1, DBLOCKSIZE = 0000 shall not be used. (No data will be transfered)

BitField.name: RWSTART
BitField.description: Read wait start. If this bit is set, read wait operation starts.

BitField.name: RWSTOP
BitField.description: Read wait stop This bit is written by firmware and auto cleared by hardware when the DPSM moves from the READ_WAIT state to the WAIT_R or IDLE state.

BitField.name: RWMOD
BitField.description: Read wait mode. This bit can only be written by firmware when DPSM is inactive (DPSMACT = 0).

BitField.name: SDIOEN
BitField.description: SD I/O interrupt enable functions This bit can only be written by firmware when DPSM is inactive (DPSMACT = 0). If this bit is set, the DPSM enables the SD I/O card specific interrupt operation.

BitField.name: BOOTACKEN
BitField.description: Enable the reception of the boot acknowledgment. This bit can only be written by firmware when DPSM is inactive (DPSMACT = 0).

BitField.name: FIFORST
BitField.description: FIFO reset, will flush any remaining data. This bit can only be written by firmware when IDMAEN= 0 and DPSM is active (DPSMACT = 1). This bit will only take effect when a transfer error or transfer hold occurs.

Register.name: SDMMC_DCNTR
Register.description: The SDMMC_DCNTR register loads the value from the data length register (see SDMMC_DLENR) when the DPSM moves from the Idle state to the Wait_R or Wait_S state. As data is transferred, the counter decrements the value until it reaches 0. The DPSM then moves to the Idle state and when there has been no error, the data status end flag (DATAEND) is set.

BitField.name: DATACOUNT
BitField.description: Data count value When read, the number of remaining data bytes to be transferred is returned. Write has no effect.

Register.name: SDMMC_STAR
Register.description: The SDMMC_STAR register is a read-only register. It contains two types of flag:Static flags (bits [29,21,11:0]): these bits remain asserted until they are cleared by writing to the SDMMC interrupt Clear register (see SDMMC_ICR)Dynamic flags (bits [20:12]): these bits change state depending on the state of the underlying logic (for example, FIFO full and empty flags are asserted and de-asserted as data while written to the FIFO)

BitField.name: CCRCFAIL
BitField.description: Command response received (CRC check failed). Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

BitField.name: DCRCFAIL
BitField.description: Data block sent/received (CRC check failed). Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

BitField.name: CTIMEOUT
BitField.description: Command response timeout. Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR. The Command Timeout period has a fixed value of 64 SDMMC_CK clock periods.

BitField.name: DTIMEOUT
BitField.description: Data timeout. Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

BitField.name: TXUNDERR
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO underrun error or IDMA read transfer error. Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

BitField.name: RXOVERR
BitField.description: Received FIFO overrun error or IDMA write transfer error. Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

BitField.name: CMDREND
BitField.description: Command response received (CRC check passed, or no CRC). Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

BitField.name: CMDSENT
BitField.description: Command sent (no response required). Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

BitField.name: DATAEND
BitField.description: Data transfer ended correctly. (data counter, DATACOUNT is zero and no errors occur). Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

BitField.name: DHOLD
BitField.description: Data transfer Hold. Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

BitField.name: DBCKEND
BitField.description: Data block sent/received. (CRC check passed) and DPSM moves to the READWAIT state. Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

BitField.name: DABORT
BitField.description: Data transfer aborted by CMD12. Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

BitField.name: DPSMACT
BitField.description: Data path state machine active, i.e. not in Idle state. This is a hardware status flag only, does not generate an interrupt.

BitField.name: CPSMACT
BitField.description: Command path state machine active, i.e. not in Idle state. This is a hardware status flag only, does not generate an interrupt.

BitField.name: TXFIFOHE
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO half empty At least half the number of words can be written into the FIFO. This bit is cleared when the FIFO becomes half+1 full.

BitField.name: RXFIFOHF
BitField.description: Receive FIFO half full There are at least half the number of words in the FIFO. This bit is cleared when the FIFO becomes half+1 empty.

BitField.name: TXFIFOF
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO full This is a hardware status flag only, does not generate an interrupt. This bit is cleared when one FIFO location becomes empty.

BitField.name: RXFIFOF
BitField.description: Receive FIFO full This bit is cleared when one FIFO location becomes empty.

BitField.name: TXFIFOE
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO empty This bit is cleared when one FIFO location becomes full.

BitField.name: RXFIFOE
BitField.description: Receive FIFO empty This is a hardware status flag only, does not generate an interrupt. This bit is cleared when one FIFO location becomes full.

BitField.name: BUSYD0
BitField.description: Inverted value of SDMMC_D0 line (Busy), sampled at the end of a CMD response and a second time 2 SDMMC_CK cycles after the CMD response. This bit is reset to not busy when the SDMMCD0 line changes from busy to not busy. This bit does not signal busy due to data transfer. This is a hardware status flag only, it does not generate an interrupt.

BitField.name: BUSYD0END
BitField.description: end of SDMMC_D0 Busy following a CMD response detected. This indicates only end of busy following a CMD response. This bit does not signal busy due to data transfer. Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

BitField.name: SDIOIT
BitField.description: SDIO interrupt received. Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

BitField.name: ACKFAIL
BitField.description: Boot acknowledgment received (boot acknowledgment check fail). Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

BitField.name: ACKTIMEOUT
BitField.description: Boot acknowledgment timeout. Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

BitField.name: VSWEND
BitField.description: Voltage switch critical timing section completion. Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

BitField.name: CKSTOP
BitField.description: SDMMC_CK stopped in Voltage switch procedure. Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

BitField.name: IDMATE
BitField.description: IDMA transfer error. Interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

BitField.name: IDMABTC
BitField.description: IDMA buffer transfer complete. interrupt flag is cleared by writing corresponding interrupt clear bit in SDMMC_ICR.

Register.name: SDMMC_ICR
Register.description: The SDMMC_ICR register is a write-only register. Writing a bit with 1 clears the corresponding bit in the SDMMC_STAR status register.

BitField.name: CCRCFAILC
BitField.description: CCRCFAIL flag clear bit Set by software to clear the CCRCFAIL flag.

BitField.name: DCRCFAILC
BitField.description: DCRCFAIL flag clear bit Set by software to clear the DCRCFAIL flag.

BitField.name: CTIMEOUTC
BitField.description: CTIMEOUT flag clear bit Set by software to clear the CTIMEOUT flag.

BitField.name: DTIMEOUTC
BitField.description: DTIMEOUT flag clear bit Set by software to clear the DTIMEOUT flag.

BitField.name: TXUNDERRC
BitField.description: TXUNDERR flag clear bit Set by software to clear TXUNDERR flag.

BitField.name: RXOVERRC
BitField.description: RXOVERR flag clear bit Set by software to clear the RXOVERR flag.

BitField.name: CMDRENDC
BitField.description: CMDREND flag clear bit Set by software to clear the CMDREND flag.

BitField.name: CMDSENTC
BitField.description: CMDSENT flag clear bit Set by software to clear the CMDSENT flag.

BitField.name: DATAENDC
BitField.description: DATAEND flag clear bit Set by software to clear the DATAEND flag.

BitField.name: DHOLDC
BitField.description: DHOLD flag clear bit Set by software to clear the DHOLD flag.

BitField.name: DBCKENDC
BitField.description: DBCKEND flag clear bit Set by software to clear the DBCKEND flag.

BitField.name: DABORTC
BitField.description: DABORT flag clear bit Set by software to clear the DABORT flag.

BitField.name: BUSYD0ENDC
BitField.description: BUSYD0END flag clear bit Set by software to clear the BUSYD0END flag.

BitField.name: SDIOITC
BitField.description: SDIOIT flag clear bit Set by software to clear the SDIOIT flag.

BitField.name: ACKFAILC
BitField.description: ACKFAIL flag clear bit Set by software to clear the ACKFAIL flag.

BitField.name: ACKTIMEOUTC
BitField.description: ACKTIMEOUT flag clear bit Set by software to clear the ACKTIMEOUT flag.

BitField.name: VSWENDC
BitField.description: VSWEND flag clear bit Set by software to clear the VSWEND flag.

BitField.name: CKSTOPC
BitField.description: CKSTOP flag clear bit Set by software to clear the CKSTOP flag.

BitField.name: IDMATEC
BitField.description: IDMA transfer error clear bit Set by software to clear the IDMATE flag.

BitField.name: IDMABTCC
BitField.description: IDMA buffer transfer complete clear bit Set by software to clear the IDMABTC flag.

Register.name: SDMMC_MASKR
Register.description: The interrupt mask register determines which status flags generate an interrupt request by setting the corresponding bit to 1.

BitField.name: CCRCFAILIE
BitField.description: Command CRC fail interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by command CRC failure.

BitField.name: DCRCFAILIE
BitField.description: Data CRC fail interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by data CRC failure.

BitField.name: CTIMEOUTIE
BitField.description: Command timeout interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by command timeout.

BitField.name: DTIMEOUTIE
BitField.description: Data timeout interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by data timeout.

BitField.name: TXUNDERRIE
BitField.description: Tx FIFO underrun error interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by Tx FIFO underrun error.

BitField.name: RXOVERRIE
BitField.description: Rx FIFO overrun error interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by Rx FIFO overrun error.

BitField.name: CMDRENDIE
BitField.description: Command response received interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by receiving command response.

BitField.name: CMDSENTIE
BitField.description: Command sent interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by sending command.

BitField.name: DATAENDIE
BitField.description: Data end interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by data end.

BitField.name: DHOLDIE
BitField.description: Data hold interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable the interrupt generated when sending new data is hold in the DPSM Wait_S state.

BitField.name: DBCKENDIE
BitField.description: Data block end interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by data block end.

BitField.name: DABORTIE
BitField.description: Data transfer aborted interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by a data transfer being aborted.

BitField.name: TXFIFOHEIE
BitField.description: Tx FIFO half empty interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by Tx FIFO half empty.

BitField.name: RXFIFOHFIE
BitField.description: Rx FIFO half full interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by Rx FIFO half full.

BitField.name: RXFIFOFIE
BitField.description: Rx FIFO full interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by Rx FIFO full.

BitField.name: TXFIFOEIE
BitField.description: Tx FIFO empty interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by Tx FIFO empty.

BitField.name: BUSYD0ENDIE
BitField.description: BUSYD0END interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable the interrupt generated when SDMMC_D0 signal changes from busy to NOT busy following a CMD response.

BitField.name: SDIOITIE
BitField.description: SDIO mode interrupt received interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable the interrupt generated when receiving the SDIO mode interrupt.

BitField.name: ACKFAILIE
BitField.description: Acknowledgment Fail interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by acknowledgment Fail.

BitField.name: ACKTIMEOUTIE
BitField.description: Acknowledgment timeout interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by acknowledgment timeout.

BitField.name: VSWENDIE
BitField.description: Voltage switch critical timing section completion interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable the interrupt generated when voltage switch critical timing section completion.

BitField.name: CKSTOPIE
BitField.description: Voltage Switch clock stopped interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable interrupt caused by Voltage Switch clock stopped.

BitField.name: IDMABTCIE
BitField.description: IDMA buffer transfer complete interrupt enable Set and cleared by software to enable/disable the interrupt generated when the IDMA has transferred all data belonging to a memory buffer.

Register.name: SDMMC_ACKTIMER
Register.description: The SDMMC_ACKTIMER register contains the acknowledgment timeout period, in SDMMC_CK bus clock periods. A counter loads the value from the SDMMC_ACKTIMER register, and starts decrementing when the data path state machine (DPSM) enters the Wait_Ack state. If the timer reaches 0 while the DPSM is in this states, the acknowledgment timeout status flag is set.

BitField.name: ACKTIME
BitField.description: Boot acknowledgment timeout period This bit can only be written by firmware when CPSM is disabled (CPSMEN = 0). Boot acknowledgment timeout period expressed in card bus clock periods.

Register.name: SDMMC_IDMACTRLR
Register.description: The receive and transmit FIFOs can be read or written as 32-bit wide registers. The FIFOs contain 32 entries on 32 sequential addresses. This allows the CPU to use its load and store multiple operands to read from/write to the FIFO.

BitField.name: IDMAEN
BitField.description: IDMA enable This bit can only be written by firmware when DPSM is inactive (DPSMACT = 0).

BitField.name: IDMABMODE
BitField.description: Buffer mode selection. This bit can only be written by firmware when DPSM is inactive (DPSMACT = 0).

BitField.name: IDMABACT
BitField.description: Double buffer mode active buffer indication This bit can only be written by firmware when DPSM is inactive (DPSMACT = 0). When IDMA is enabled this bit is toggled by hardware.

Register.name: SDMMC_IDMABSIZER
Register.description: The SDMMC_IDMABSIZER register contains the buffers size when in double buffer configuration.

BitField.name: IDMABNDT
BitField.description: Number of transfers per buffer. This 8-bit value shall be multiplied by 8 to get the size of the buffer in 32-bit words and by 32 to get the size of the buffer in bytes. Example: IDMABNDT = 0x01: buffer size = 8 words = 32 bytes. These bits can only be written by firmware when DPSM is inactive (DPSMACT = 0).

Register.name: SDMMC_IDMABASE0R
Register.description: The SDMMC_IDMABASE0R register contains the memory buffer base address in single buffer configuration and the buffer 0 base address in double buffer configuration.

BitField.name: IDMABASE0
BitField.description: Buffer 0 memory base address bits [31:2], shall be word aligned (bit [1:0] are always 0 and read only). This register can be written by firmware when DPSM is inactive (DPSMACT = 0), and can dynamically be written by firmware when DPSM active (DPSMACT = 1) and memory buffer 0 is inactive (IDMABACT = 1).

Register.name: SDMMC_IDMABASE1R
Register.description: The SDMMC_IDMABASE1R register contains the double buffer configuration second buffer memory base address.

BitField.name: IDMABASE1
BitField.description: Buffer 1 memory base address, shall be word aligned (bit [1:0] are always 0 and read only). This register can be written by firmware when DPSM is inactive (DPSMACT = 0), and can dynamically be written by firmware when DPSM active (DPSMACT = 1) and memory buffer 1 is inactive (IDMABACT = 0).

Register.name: SDMMC_FIFOR
Register.description: The receive and transmit FIFOs can be only read or written as word (32-bit) wide registers. The FIFOs contain 16 entries on sequential addresses. This allows the CPU to use its load and store multiple operands to read from/write to the FIFO.When accessing SDMMC_FIFOR with half word or byte access an AHB bus fault is generated.

BitField.name: FIFODATA
BitField.description: Receive and transmit FIFO data This register can only be read or written by firmware when the DPSM is active (DPSMACT=1). The FIFO data occupies 16 entries of 32-bit words.

BitField.name: RXDMAEN
BitField.description: Receiver DMA ENable for data flow

BitField.name: CUMSK
BitField.description: Mask of channel status and user bits

BitField.name: CBDMAEN
BitField.description: Control Buffer DMA ENable for control flow

BitField.name: NBTR
BitField.description: Maximum allowed re-tries during synchronization phase

BitField.name: CSRNE
BitField.description: Control Buffer register is not empty

BitField.name: WIDTH5
BitField.description: Duration of 5 symbols counted with SPDIF_CLK

BitField.name: SBDCF
BitField.description: Clears the Synchronization Block Detected flag

BitField.name: MASRX
BitField.description: Master automatic SUSP in Receive mode

BitField.name: RCRCI
BitField.description: CRC calculation initialization pattern control for receiver

BitField.name: TCRCI
BitField.description: CRC calculation initialization pattern control for transmitter

BitField.description: Locking the AF configuration of associated IOs

BitField.description: Number of data transfer extension to be reload into TSIZE just when a previous

BitField.name: DSIZE
BitField.description: Number of bits in at single SPI data frame

BitField.description: Behavior of slave transmitter at underrun condition

BitField.name: UDRDET
BitField.description: Detection of underrun condition at slave transmitter

BitField.description: Length of CRC frame to be transacted and compared

BitField.description: Software management of SS signal input

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Tamper detection on TAMP_IN1 is disabled.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Tamper detection on TAMP_IN1 is enabled.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Tamper detection on TAMP_IN2 is disabled.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Tamper detection on TAMP_IN2 is enabled.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Tamper detection on TAMP_IN3 is disabled.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Tamper detection on TAMP_IN3 is enabled.

BitField.name: ITAMP1E
BitField.description: Internal tamper 1 enable: RTC power domain supply monitoring

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Internal tamper 1 disabled.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Internal tamper 1 enabled: a tamper is generated when the RTC power domain supply is below or above thresholds.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Internal tamper 2 disabled.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Internal tamper 2 enabled: a tamper is generated when the temperature is below or above thresholds.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Internal tamper 3 disabled.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Internal tamper 3 enabled: a tamper is generated when the LSE frequency is below or above thresholds.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Internal tamper 4 disabled.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Internal tamper 4 enabled. a tamper is generated when the HSE frequency is below or above thresholds.

BitField.name: ITAMP5E
BitField.description: Internal tamper 5 enable: RTC calendar overflow

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Internal tamper 5 disabled.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Internal tamper 5 enabled: a tamper is generated when the RTC calendar reaches its maximum value, on the 31st of December 99, at 23:59:59. The calendar is then frozen and cannot overflow.

BitField.name: ITAMP6E
BitField.description: Internal tamper 6 enable: ST manufacturer readout

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Internal tamper 6 disabled.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Internal tamper 6 enabled: a tamper is generated in case of ST manufacturer readout.

BitField.name: ITAMP8E
BitField.description: Internal tamper 8 enable: monotonic counter overflow

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Internal tamper 8 disabled.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Internal tamper 8 enabled: a tamper is generated when the TAMP_CNT overflows.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Tamper 1 event erases the backup registers.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Tamper 1 event does not erase the backup registers.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Tamper 2 event erases the backup registers.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Tamper 2 event does not erase the backup registers(1).

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Tamper 3 event erases the backup registers.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Tamper 3 event does not erase the backup registers(1).

BitField.name: TAMP1MSK
BitField.description: Tamper 1 mask The tamper 1 interrupt must not be enabled when TAMP1MSK is set.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Tamper 1 event generates a trigger event and TAMP1F must be cleared by software to allow next tamper event detection.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Tamper 1 event generates a trigger event. TAMP1F is masked and internally cleared by hardware. The backup registers are not erased.

BitField.name: TAMP2MSK
BitField.description: Tamper 2 mask The tamper 2 interrupt must not be enabled when TAMP2MSK is set.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Tamper 2 event generates a trigger event and TAMP2F must be cleared by software to allow next tamper event detection.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Tamper 2 event generates a trigger event. TAMP2F is masked and internally cleared by hardware. The backup registers are not erased.

BitField.name: TAMP3MSK
BitField.description: Tamper 3 mask The tamper 3 interrupt must not be enabled when TAMP3MSK is set.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Tamper 3 event generates a trigger event and TAMP3F must be cleared by software to allow next tamper event detection.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Tamper 3 event generates a trigger event. TAMP3F is masked and internally cleared by hardware. The backup registers are not erased.

BitField.name: TAMP1TRG
BitField.description: Active level for tamper 1 input (active mode disabled) If TAMPFLT = 00 Tamper 1 input rising edge and high level triggers a tamper detection event. If TAMPFLT = 00 Tamper 1 input falling edge and low level triggers a tamper detection event.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: If TAMPFLT Ã¢Â‰Â 00 Tamper 1 input staying low triggers a tamper detection event.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: If TAMPFLT Ã¢Â‰Â 00 Tamper 1 input staying high triggers a tamper detection event.

BitField.name: TAMP2TRG
BitField.description: Active level for tamper 2 input (active mode disabled) If TAMPFLT = 00 Tamper 2 input rising edge and high level triggers a tamper detection event. If TAMPFLT = 00 Tamper 2 input falling edge and low level triggers a tamper detection event.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: If TAMPFLT Ã¢Â‰Â 00 Tamper 2 input staying low triggers a tamper detection event.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: If TAMPFLT Ã¢Â‰Â 00 Tamper 2 input staying high triggers a tamper detection event.

BitField.name: TAMP3TRG
BitField.description: Active level for tamper 3 input (active mode disabled) If TAMPFLT = 00 Tamper 3 input rising edge and high level triggers a tamper detection event. If TAMPFLT = 00 Tamper 3 input falling edge and low level triggers a tamper detection event.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: If TAMPFLT Ã¢Â‰Â 00 Tamper 3 input staying low triggers a tamper detection event.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: If TAMPFLT Ã¢Â‰Â 00 Tamper 3 input staying high triggers a tamper detection event.

BitField.name: TAMPFREQ
BitField.description: Tamper sampling frequency Determines the frequency at which each of the TAMP_INx inputs are sampled.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: RTCCLK / 32768 (1 Hz when RTCCLK = 32768 Hz)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: RTCCLK / 16384 (2 Hz when RTCCLK = 32768 Hz)

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: RTCCLK / 8192 (4 Hz when RTCCLK = 32768 Hz)

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: RTCCLK / 4096 (8 Hz when RTCCLK = 32768 Hz)

Enum.name: B_0x4
Enum.description: RTCCLK / 2048 (16 Hz when RTCCLK = 32768 Hz)

Enum.name: B_0x5
Enum.description: RTCCLK / 1024 (32 Hz when RTCCLK = 32768 Hz)

Enum.name: B_0x6
Enum.description: RTCCLK / 512 (64 Hz when RTCCLK = 32768 Hz)

Enum.name: B_0x7
Enum.description: RTCCLK / 256 (128 Hz when RTCCLK = 32768 Hz)

BitField.name: TAMPFLT
BitField.description: TAMP_INx filter count These bits determines the number of consecutive samples at the specified level (TAMP*TRG) needed to activate a tamper event. TAMPFLT is valid for each of the TAMP_INx inputs.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Tamper event is activated on edge of TAMP_INx input transitions to the active level (no internal pull-up on TAMP_INx input).

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Tamper event is activated after 2 consecutive samples at the active level.

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: Tamper event is activated after 4 consecutive samples at the active level.

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: Tamper event is activated after 8 consecutive samples at the active level.

BitField.name: TAMPPRCH
BitField.description: TAMP_INx precharge duration These bit determines the duration of time during which the pull-up/is activated before each sample. TAMPPRCH is valid for each of the TAMP_INx inputs.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: 1 RTCCLK cycle

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: 2 RTCCLK cycles

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: 4 RTCCLK cycles

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: 8 RTCCLK cycles

BitField.name: TAMPPUDIS
BitField.description: TAMP_INx pull-up disable This bit determines if each of the TAMPx pins are precharged before each sample.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Precharge TAMP_INx pins before sampling (enable internal pull-up)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Disable precharge of TAMP_INx pins.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Tamper 1 detection mode is passive.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Tamper 1 detection mode is active.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Tamper 2 detection mode is passive.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Tamper 2 detection mode is active.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Tamper 3 detection mode is passive.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Tamper 3 detection mode is active.

BitField.name: ATOSEL1
BitField.description: Active tamper shared output 1 selection The selected output must be available in the package pinout

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: TAMPOUTSEL1 = TAMP_OUT1

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: TAMPOUTSEL1 = TAMP_OUT2

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: TAMPOUTSEL1 = TAMP_OUT3

BitField.name: ATOSEL2
BitField.description: Active tamper shared output 2 selection The selected output must be available in the package pinout

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: TAMPOUTSEL2 = TAMP_OUT1

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: TAMPOUTSEL2 = TAMP_OUT2

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: TAMPOUTSEL2 = TAMP_OUT3

BitField.name: ATOSEL3
BitField.description: Active tamper shared output 3 selection The selected output must be available in the package pinout

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: TAMPOUTSEL3 = TAMP_OUT1

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: TAMPOUTSEL3 = TAMP_OUT2

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: TAMPOUTSEL3 = TAMP_OUT3

BitField.name: ATCKSEL
BitField.description: Active tamper RTC asynchronous prescaler clock selection These bits selects the RTC asynchronous prescaler stage output.The selected clock is CK_ATPRE. fCK_ATPRE = fRTCCLK / 2ATCKSEL when (PREDIV_A+1) = 128. ... Note: These bits can be written only when all active tampers are disabled. The write protection remains for up to 1.5 ck_atpre cycles after all the active tampers are disable.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: RTCCLK is selected

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: RTCCLK/2 is selected when (PREDIV_A+1) = 128 (actually selects 1st flip flop output)

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: RTCCLK/4 is selected when (PREDIV_A+1) = 128 (actually selects 2nd flip flop output)

Enum.name: B_0x7
Enum.description: RTCCLK/128 is selected when (PREDIV_A+1) = 128 (actually selects 7th flip flop output)

BitField.name: ATPER
BitField.description: Active tamper output change period The tamper output is changed every CK_ATPER = (2ATPER x CK_ATPRE) cycles. Refer to .

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Each active tamper input TAMP_INi is compared with its dedicated output TAMP_OUTi

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Each active tamper input TAMP_INi is compared with TAMPOUTSELx as defined below, with TAMPOUTSELx defined by ATOSELx bits.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Active tamper filtering disable

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Active tamper filtering enable: a tamper event is detected when 2 comparison mismatches occur out of 4 consecutive samples.

BitField.name: SEED
BitField.description: Pseudo-random generator seed value This register must be written four times with 32-bit values to provide the 128-bit seed to the PRNG. Writing to this register automatically sends the seed value to the PRNG.

BitField.name: PRNG
BitField.description: Pseudo-random generator value This field provides the values of the PRNG output. Because of potential inconsistencies due to synchronization delays, PRNG must be read at least twice. The read value is correct if it is equal to previous read value.

BitField.name: SEEDF
BitField.description: Seed running flag This flag is set by hardware when a new seed is written in the TAMP_ATSEEDR. It is cleared by hardware when the PRNG has absorbed this new seed, and by system reset. The TAMP APB cock must not be switched off as long as SEEDF is set.

BitField.name: INITS
BitField.description: Active tamper initialization status This flag is set by hardware when the PRNG has absorbed the first 128-bit seed, meaning that the enabled active tampers are functional. This flag is left unchanged when the active tampers are disabled.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Tamper 1 interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Tamper 1 interrupt enabled.

Enum.description: Tamper 3 interrupt enabled..

BitField.name: TAMP1F
BitField.description: TAMP1 detection flag This flag is set by hardware when a tamper detection event is detected on the TAMP1 input.

BitField.name: TAMP2F
BitField.description: TAMP2 detection flag This flag is set by hardware when a tamper detection event is detected on the TAMP2 input.

BitField.name: TAMP3F
BitField.description: TAMP3 detection flag This flag is set by hardware when a tamper detection event is detected on the TAMP3 input.

BitField.name: ITAMP1F
BitField.description: RTC power domain voltage monitoring tamper detection flag This flag is set by hardware when a tamper detection event is detected on the internal tamper 1.

BitField.name: ITAMP2F
BitField.description: Temperature monitoring tamper detection flag This flag is set by hardware when a tamper detection event is detected on the internal tamper 2.

BitField.name: ITAMP8F
BitField.description: Monotonic counter overflow tamper flag This flag is set by hardware when a tamper detection event is detected on the internal tamper 8.

BitField.name: COUNT
BitField.description: This register is read-only only and is incremented by one when a write access is done to this register. This register cannot roll-over and is frozen when reaching the maximum value.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: TAMP_OUT3 is mapped on PI8

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: TAMP_OUT3 is mapped on PC13

BitField.name: BKP
BitField.description: The application can write or read data to and from these registers. They are powered-on by VBAT when VDD is switched off, so that they are not reset by System reset, and their contents remain valid when the device operates in low-power mode. In the default configuration this register is reset on a tamper detection event. It is forced to reset value as long as there is at least one internal or external tamper flag being set. This register is also reset when the readout protection (RDP) is disabled.

BitField.name: ENVR
BitField.description: Voltage reference buffer mode enable This bit is used to enable the voltage reference buffer mode.

BitField.name: HIZ
BitField.description: High impedance mode This bit controls the analog switch to connect or not the VREF+ pin. Refer to Table196: VREF buffer modes for the mode descriptions depending on ENVR bit configuration.

BitField.name: VRS
BitField.description: Voltage reference scale These bits select the value generated by the voltage reference buffer. Other: Reserved

BitField.name: TRIM
BitField.description: Trimming code These bits are automatically initialized after reset with the trimming value stored in the Flash memory during the production test. Writing into these bits allows to tune the internal reference buffer voltage.

BitField.name: T
BitField.description: 7-bit counter (MSB to LSB) These bits contain the value of the watchdog counter. It is decremented every (4096 x 2WDGTB[1:0]) PCLK cycles. A reset is produced when it is decremented from 0x40 to 0x3F (T6 becomes cleared).

BitField.name: WDGA
BitField.description: Activation bit This bit is set by software and only cleared by hardware after a reset. When WDGA=1, the watchdog can generate a reset.

BitField.name: W
BitField.description: 7-bit window value These bits contain the window value to be compared to the downcounter.

BitField.name: WDGTB
BitField.description: Timer base The time base of the prescaler can be modified as follows:

BitField.name: EWI
BitField.description: Early wakeup interrupt When set, an interrupt occurs whenever the counter reaches the value 0x40. This interrupt is only cleared by hardware after a reset.

BitField.name: EWIF
BitField.description: Early wakeup interrupt flag This bit is set by hardware when the counter has reached the value 0x40. It must be cleared by software by writing 0. A write of 1 has no effect. This bit is also set if the interrupt is not enabled.

BitField.name: RELOAD
BitField.description: Value to load into the SYST_CVR when the counter is enabled and when it reaches 0

BitField.name: CURRENT
BitField.description: The current value of the SysTick counter

BitField.name: NOREF
BitField.description: Indicates whether the device provides a reference clock to the processor

BitField.name: SKEW
BitField.description: Indicates whether the TENMS value is exact

BitField.name: TENMS
BitField.description: Reload value for 10ms (100Hz) timing, subject to system clock skew errors
